review: Dear Guest, Thank you for your feedback.  I appreciate you taking the time to write all comments both good and bad.  Please accept my sincere apology for the issues you have experienced.    You mentioned your room not being ready at check-in.  We do our absolute best to get all rooms ready for guests as soon as they arrive but unfortunately sometimes that is not possible due to business levels and prior guests checking out.  That is why we guarantee everyone a 4pm check-in.    Again, please accept my apologies for the issues you experienced.  If you would like to speak personally regarding your experiences and feel it appropriate please feel free to call me at the hotel.  Regards, Eric Waltz General Manager

title: massive disappointment
review: We booked this hotel as a 6 night break in the middle of a trip to Orlando. It is advertised as a 5star hotel and having read the reviews thought we had made the right choice. When we arrived it was 2pm check in was 4pm so were told they would telephone us when the room was ready. Needless to say they didn't!  We had high hopes as we knew we had a coastal view room. How wrong could we be. The room we were allocated was right above the hotel kitchen, dustbins and air conditioning unit. It was so noisy it was like trying to sleep on an aeroplane. strangley these rooms had balconies although unless you wore ear plugs, closed your eyes and couldnt smell you would never sit out on it! We went straight back to reception and were offered two alternatives about three rooms along…

title: A must visit
review: Dear Guest, Thank your for taking the time to write a review of your recent trip to the Sandpearl Resort.  Please accept my apologies for the issues  you had with your initial room assignment, housekeeping and valet.    While all rooms have nice views of either the Gulf of Mexico or Clearwater Bay there is definately a difference between some rooms and our Gulf Front rooms.  The quality of the view is definately reflected in the rate.  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your upgraded room on the second day of your stay and your remaining time with us.    Regarding your experiences with Valet and Housekeeping.  I am very sorry.  We spend much time training our Associates on proper service and it appears that we disappointed you.  I will share your feedback to make sure that all associates are aware of your comments.  Again, thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  If you would like to speak personally regarding your stay please feel free to contact me directly.  Regards, Eric Waltz General Manager

title: summer 2012
review: We stayed at the Sand Pearl July 6-8.  Pool deck was filthy and incredibly crowded.  Plastic cups, even a used swim diaper, under tables and chairs, and unattended to by housekeeping staff.  No towels in our King Suite room when we returned at the end of the day.  Took two phone calls and 45 minutes to have them delivered, making everyone late for a dinner reservation.    As so many friends had recommended this property, our expectations were high.  I'd never stay here again.  Our prior two nights were at a Disney World Resort, which was immaculate, with delightful service on the concierge floor.  (even on a PACKED holiday weekend)

title: Perfect hotel and location for a honeymoon
review: “Fantastic honeymoon hotel.. Location of the Sandpearl is incredaible, one of most beautiful beaches we have ever seen. The pool area is superb. The staff was consistently friendly and helpful. Both the room and the views were fantastic. It's worth every penny. We stayed in the suites and really they were worth every penny. loved it

title: Going downhill fast!!
review: Dear JulsDuffy,  Congratulations! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed celebrating your honeymoon here at the Sandpearl Resort! I am pleased to hear that you found our staff to be consistently friendly and helpful. We hope to welcome you back to celebrate your anniversary if not sooner!

title: Small but beautiful resort
review: We have recommended to friends and stayed here for the last 4 years - this is our last stay. Filthy (black mold , pink slime) in shower, tatty, torn bathrobes, our sheets were not changed from the previous occupant!!, dirty unkept hallways - not a wonderful relaxing experience. Spa staff not accomodating, insufficient pool service staff. The assistant manager on duty even took photos of our room - so did I!! I don't think that it is inappropriate to expect a clean unused bed and a clean, hygenic shower - Tampa International Airport was cleaner than this place. Yes - we did change rooms, but our initial experience ruined our whole vacation - the two free drinks afforded as recompense to us at dinner the last evening was totally inappropriate.

title: Fantastic venue  for  special wedding occasion, could not have  been better.
review: The stretch of beach the hotel is located on is just perfect!  Less crowded than the hotels closer to Pier 60.  The sand is like powdered sugar and perfect for building sandcastles!  The rooms are small, but everything is updated & upscale.  We loved Tate island grill for meals by the pool & beach.  Pulled pork nachos & veggie quesadillas were the best!  It never took long to get our food.  Great children's activities.  The kids loved Camp Ridley.  It is so nice to stop by the activities desk anytime the kids needed anything...boogie boards, noodles, towels, fresh water, buckets, shovels.  They are super helpful.  I am only giving 4 stars because we had a hard time getting enough towels.  Also turn down service came too early (5-6pm).  I asked them to come back to refresh towels…

title: SandPearl, a bit pricey but a True 5 Star
review: Dear MDV76,  I am so glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. If sounds like the pool, beach, and Camp Ridley were highlights for the children. I am also pleased that you enjoyed our full service spa and hot tub. We hope you are able to visit with us again soon.

title: Probably stay somewhere else for the money
review: Just got back from a 4 day trip to Clearwater and stayed at the Sandpearl.  First time staying there.  Started off great with a mamosa drink offered to me at check in.  However, when you book your trip, all the "little" incidental fees aren't disclosed to you.  I believe they mention a "resort" fee, which is standard but there's more.  There is no option of parking your own car.  You must pay $20 a day valet parking fee.  This is on top of the $25 a day resort fee.  After getting a smart alecky remark from one of the valets, I complained to the front desk and asked if they are expecting a tip each time since I am paying $20 a day.  She said usually, people pay a tip at the end of their stay.  I advised I would not be paying a tip because of the rude comment and she said she…

title: I'm hard to please, but left very pleased
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for taking the time to review your stay at our resort.  I was glad to see that you had a good arrival experience .  Please accept my sincere apology for the comment made by one of our valets.  I am not sure what was said but I can honestly say that is not a norm and our entire team goes through much customer service training regarding proper ways to interact with guests.    In you review you mentioned our valet parking fees.  We do charge a valet parking fee of $20 per day.  While tipping each and every time you get your car is not required giving gratuities for fast friendly service is appreciated.  Also, we do have an off site parking lot available for guests to utilize however it is several blocks away.  For the price, the convenience of utilizing our valet service is well worth it.  Again, thank you for taking the time to write the reivew.  If you would like to talk personally regarding your experience please feel free to contact me directly at the hotel.  Regards, Eric Waltz General Manager

title: Fabulous hotel!
review: this was the nicest room with the cleanest softest bed I've eve had in a room, I've stayed all over the east coast and this by farrrrr is the best. everything is close. as soon as u get off the elevator u have a pool(very clean) and a hot tub(very clean) and as many free towels as u need. the tate restaurant was very cheap and clean and had great food. ITS RIGHT ON THE BEACH. I'm not a big beach person but i was impressed. clean soft sand and beautiful water. id say from the minute i walk out of my room i am less then 500 feet from good food, a clean pool, a nice big clean hot tub, and the most beautiful beach. thats impressive. I've stayed in the nicest hotels in nyc and ac and this place accommodated me and my girlfriend more then anywhere else. if u go to clearwater stay…

title: Great vacation with 2 teens
review: Dear Tony B,  I am so glad to hear that you and your girlfriend had such a wonderful time staying with us here at the Sandpearl Resort. We hope we can exceed your expectations once again on your next visit with us.

title: Best stay in Clearwater
review: I stayed at Sandpearl Resort July 7-13, 2012. This was my third visit there since 2009. My son and 15 year old granddaughter joined me on this trip to Clearwater. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with a perfect view of the gorgeous pool and beach!  The employees always went out of their way to be friendly and courteous at all times. We enjoyed the Sunday brunch at Caretta on the Gulf, their fine dining restaurant. It was $39 pp which included unlimited champagne and/or mimosas. The food was good.  Tate Island Grill, beachside, is a great place to eat a casual meal or to be served on the beach and by the pool. Order a drink right before sunset and sit by the fire pit to enjoy a breathtaking sunset! I have never seen one as beautiful.  We were treated to a magnificent fireworks…

title: Absolutely Beautiful!!! Love the Sandpearl Resort!
review: If you are traveling to Clearwater Beach, this is a MUST! Prestigious, clean, great friendly staff. Spa services are amazing, The food is wonderful at both restaurants, Caretta on the Gulf is more upscale and Tate Island Grill is more casual. Amazing views EVERYWHERE you turn! Love sitting by the bonfire at night with my favorite tropical drink or martini. Love to come and lunch with my friends, or have a romantic getaway with my husband. LOVE the SANDPEARL!!!

title: Family of four review - Very Nice Hotel
review: Dear Lovethebeach74,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your most recent stay. I am pleased to hear that you found our staff to be so friendly and your spa services amazing! We hope you chose to stay with us again the next time you are in the Clearwater area.

title: Beautiful!
review: We just returned from our stay at the SandPearl Resort in Clearwater, FL.  We wanted to end our hectic Orlando Disney trip with a few quiet days at the beach.  With all the positive reviews, I had some pretty high expectations.  I can tell you that I was not disappointed.  Our family of 4 (Kids ages 3 & 6) had a great time at the beach and at the pool.  They also have something called camp Ridely for kids ages 5 to 11.  The camp was closed during our visit but we were allowed to use the play room and use all the crafts they had.  I don’t think anyone else knew you could use this room because we were the only ones in there.  The pool is pretty small but you have the beach and ocean right there, so it was a not an issue.  The resort itself is not very big.  They have a gift shop…

title: Loved it all, already missing my room at the Sandpearl.
review: Dear Hike337,  I am so pleased to hear that you and your family had such a wonderful time here at the Sandpearl Resort. It sounds like they really enjoyed the pool, beach and children’s activities. We appreciate your business and hope to welcome you back again soon.

title: The Best Place To Stay In Clearwater!!!
review: Stayed at the Sandpearl for a week and loved it.  We had only 2 days of partial sun thanks to a tropical storm that hit while we were there but we made the most of it. Had a small problem at check in with our room but luckily I had an email to back up my story, and problem was fixed. My only complaint would've been the weather, which they can't help. Reading reviews of the beautiful sunsets and sitting on the beach around the fire pit is what had me so excited to visit.. Never saw a sunset and obviously with the rain... never had a fire : ( The Staff is great, very attentive and willing to help you with anything. I LOVED LOVED LOVED Marla our housekeeper!! She was awesome! Stayed on the 5th floor overlooking the pool with a great ocean view. There's a few different places to eat…

title: Destination Beach Wedding
review: My husband and I live in Chicago and chose the Sandpearl to host our destination beach wedding. We had approximately 50 of our family and friends travel to and stay at the Sandpearl for the weekend. Every single one of them raved about the Sandpearl...they are still talking about how spectacular the wedding was. The entire staff is friendly and the service is attentive without being stuffy. The Sandpearl owns part of the beach, others in the area do not, so they can have weddings on the beach, a fire pit on the beach and lounge chairs with alcohol service on the beach as well. The pool is large so it never feels over crowded. The food is delicious and the drinks are strong. Debbie Glancy was a fantastic wedding coordinator who went above and beyond to assure that the wedding…

title: The best resort (so far)
review: Dear Meagan S,  Congratulations! We are so excited we could be a part of such a special day for you and your husband. It sounds like your wedding day was perfect in every way. Congratulations again and we look forward to welcoming you back for an anniversary celebrations.

title: horrible....
review: In my opinion, although I have not been to a lot of places, this was the absolutely best place to stay for a vacation (so far).

title: Fantastic, beautiful memories, want to return!
review: Dear Gary_and_Shelly,  Thank you for stay with us here at the Sandpearl Resort. We appreciate your business and hope that you chose to stay with us again the next time you are in the Clearwater area.

title: World Class Honeymoon Paradise
review: Maybe. I am a resort snob and normally stay at the Ritz.. But anything that could go wrong..did. They gave away our two bedroom oceanfront suite to someone else..they think I dont k now they messed up..but whatever.?  The one they tried to put us in faced partial ocean..the rest parking.. We were paying over $500 a night..that wasnt going to fly.. Well they had nothing else..so they found us a 1bedroom suite.. So fine whatever.. And from there completely down hill..  The bathroom door knob was broken..eventually fell off. You could not make coffee because each outlet popped. The room was dilapidated.? I get the ocean deteriorates beach front hotels..but come on fix it.. We ordered room service..an easy two hundred plus meal with three kids.? Two adults and a bottle. Of wine..…

title: excellent hotel
review: Lovely hotel right on the beach, We were upgraded on arrival at reception free of charge. I am an i prefer member so mdon't know if this was the case. As other reviews state as long as you know in advance about valet parking and resort fees which we didnt find too bad when we got the bill. We are from Scotland so stayed 21 nights in the usa, 5 of these at the sandpearl and unfortunately when hurricane debby was around so only had about 3 days good sunshine. For resort fee you get 2 bottles water, pool towels,internet facilities,shoe shine and 1 free bike per room per stay. We wouldnt use the bike but think it would be fairer to give each guest 1 bike per stay as it seems to me that is to get another 25 dollars per person if you rent out the bikes as only 1 would be free. so…

title: Excellent Resort! Excellent Location!
review: Dear Letitia,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your most recent stay. I am so pleased to hear that several of our staff members assisted in making you stay memorable. I will certainly pass along the kind words to our team. We appreciate your business and hope that you are able to visit with us again soon.

title: Luxurious and comfortable
review: We stayed in the Sandpearl Resort in Clearwater Beach, on June 2012.  We were travelling my husband, my 8 month old baby and I.  I must say that the Mandalay bay suite is incredible! we had a full equiped kitchen, washer and dryer machines, a jettina, a very large and confortable bedroom and a nice living and dining room.  Everything is clean and tidy. We stayed on the 7th floor, we never heard any noise from the halls and the suite had 2 balconies facing the mandala bay.  The pool area was clean and the crew is very nice. They give you pool towels included in the resort fee ( $25.00 per day)  and if you want to rent a beach umbrella the rate is $25.00 a day. Honestly they have the best location on the beach! you only walk a few steps from the pool to the beach and the sand is…

title: Another great stay!
review: Dear Esmariehs,  Thank you for your comments of your most recent stay. I am pleased to hear that you and your family thoroughly enjoyed the resort and all of our amenities. We certainly appreciate your business and we will look forward to your return!

title: Great Vacation
review: We had a2BR suite.  It also had a living room, kitchen, 2 baths and washer dryer.  Really great for a family.  View of the causeway was great.  We enjoyed the pool, hot tub, and beach.  The restauant was very good but extremely expensive for a family of 5.   We also walked on the beach to frenchys, and multiple other stores and restaurants.  Nice town.

title: An excellent stay!!!!
review: This resort is a wonderful place to go with family and friends!! Food is good, service is great, and room as are always clean

title: Overall very nice
review: Dear Dizane, Thank you for your positive remarks. I am glad that you and your friends and family all enjoyed the resort and its amenities. We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you are in the Clearwater area.

title: Great Time
review: The staff  was very friendly and polite a++. This goes from check in, valet and house keeping. They really take this hotel from a good place to great place. Patio on north side was a little noisy with air conditioning units on roof.  Food and drinks at outside grill were on pricey but I guess it's pretty standard for any resort.  We were traveling with 2 kids and is very family friendly.  We were especially pleased with the pack n play provided for our baby. It was clean and appeared to have been well maintained.  we are leaving happy and relaxed.  Again a special thanks to the staff,

title: vacation trip
review: Dear D T,  Thank you for sharing you most recent stay with us. I am pleased to hear that you found our staff to be very friendly and polite. We certainly take pride in exceeding our guest’s expectations. We hope to welcome you back again soon.

title: Beautiful property!
review: Know the goofy prices up front and all will be great.  The price is actually a decent "deal" compared to other great hotels in the area.  The problem is not knowing what you are getting into.  Employees are the best.  Rooms are great.  High ceilings are a nice touch.  One beef, not really the hotels fault, is they recommended "Bros Pizza" and it was terrible and the owner is the worst person to deal with.  Forgot part of our order and basically told us "tough crap" and wouldn't refund the items he did not deliver.  The delivery guy was aware of this when he dropped the order off and said they would bring the rest "right away".  Well an hour and a half later we called and told the owner we wanted a refund and he basically said tough luck I already got your money.  Again not…

title: Top Quality - great Stay
review: Arrived after a 17 hour journey to a great welcome from concierge and receptionist, who both handled their jobs with minimum fuss.  Room was on 6th floor with a marina view, slight issue with somebody murdering a Bon Jovi song late on at night (12ish), apart from that had 3 very comfortable nights, in a very clean room.  Nice touches abounded including bed turned out after 7pm, with chocolates on bed, nice friendly staff abounded, and watched the sunset at the beachside bar.  Only complaint i could make would be at the cost of drinks and meals at the beachside bar, we paid nearly $60 dollars for 2 beers, 2 sandwiches, and 2 drinks for my wife.  Compared to our last stay 3 years ago in clearwater, the place had much more action going on, lots more shops open, last time it was…

title: Fantastic hotel for wedding and getaway.
review: Dear GuyCarr360,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your most recent stay. I am so pleased to hear that you had a wonderful time and found our staff to be welcoming and friendly. We appreciate your business and hope to welcome you back again soon.

title: Second time visitor
review: We went to this hotel for a family wedding.  Fell in love with clearwater again.  Perfect location, walking distance to several casual out of hotel restaurants.  Restaurant hotel food good especially at lunch around the pool at the restaurant.  Great drinks and service.  Lots of children at pool..so we stayed at beach in chairs and umbrellas.  Great service there too. Our room was lovely with ocean view.  Spa was overpriced IMO.  But very good.

title: Still a great resort 1 year later....
review: Dear BobKatky,  I am pleased to hear that you “fell in love with Clearwater again” with your most recent stay at the Sandpearl Resort. It sounds like you really enjoyed the area and the amenities our resort offers. We appreciate your business and hope to welcome you back again soon.

title: Excellent stay. Very nice hotel but wouldn't rate spectacular.
review: I love the Sandpearl. We stayed for seven days this year. I stayed here before and overall the staff is great.  The accommodations and location are excellent.  That's why we returned again.  The reason I did not give it 5 stars is because on the Saturday and Sunday that we were in the hotel there was a large crowd.  There were many drunk and loud people around the pool and it made us feel terribly uncomfortable. People were allowed to drink in the pool and no one came around to correct the horrible behavior of many guests.  The staff seemed overwhelmed especially on Saturday.  It seems like they Pricelined rooms to get people in there but definitely not the kind of people you would expect to see at Sandpearl.  Also upsetting was the food and service at the Island Grill the…

title: 1st Class All the Way
review: We stay at the Sandpearl once a year and love it. This is a first class operation! The staff is THE best I have ever encountered in a hotel.

title: Great experience in Clearwater
review: Dear MikeWebb219,   I am so pleased to hear that you loved the resort and found our staff to be exceptional. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

title: Amazing in every way!
review: We arrived in Clearwater without knowing the area. This hotel is logistically very well located and has in front a spectacular beach. Quite frankly I considered the pool area too crowded but not so important for us because the beach was simply spectacular. We also enjoyed the restaurants. The one on the beach has a medium quality but the main restaurant had very good quality food and decent list of wine. I recommend this hotel and I also recomment Clearwater.

title: An absolute gem of a property
review: Dear Rb178,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts of your most recent stay. I am glad you enjoyed our restaurants we have on property. We appreciate your business and hope you chose to stay with us the next time you are in the Clearwater area.

title: Paradise Vacation
review: From the moment we checked in & were handed our complimentary champage by the polite check in desk staff, until we checked out with glum faces, we knew that we had made a great choice by staying at the Sandpearl. All staff members were helpful, polite & warm, even if the weather wasn't!  We dined at both the Grill Bar & Carette on the Gulf within the resort & weren't disappointed. The staff in the restuarant were wonderful & went out of their way for us.  Our room was very comfortable - so comfortable infact that we had room service in it most mornings - chocolate chip pancakes won hands down every morning!  Like I said, we were rather glum to leave as we had a great time! This resort will not disappoint!

title: Pearl of a stay
review: Very nice hotel and staff.  Resort fees and valet parking are explained at time of booking and at the reception when checking in. Lovely pool area and good lunch menu at fair prices .   We chose to eat out for breakfast at the Blue Sky Cafe opposite.  Stayed in a room overlooking the marina , not the gulf bay. This was fine, and the view was still very nice.  Fantastic position on the beach where you can step out of the pool and walk five paces onto the pearl white beach sand.   Sun Beds on beach seemed a little expensive and the take up of these each day showed this.  They would probably have filled them all for a lower price of say $20 per day  Valet parking is good and there was always help at hand with cases and bags etc.  Very busy on Saturdays - be warned the sun beds go…

title: Beautiful hotel but beware of the extra charges
review: Dear AndrewBailey,  We appreciate your feedback from your most recent stay. It sounds like you and your family enjoyed the resort and the local restaurants. We hope to welcome you back the next time you are in the Clearwater area.

title: Excellent hotel if you have the right room.
review: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel during our holiday travelling around Florida in May 2012, the hotel is beautiful and in a lovely location just on the beach, the only draw back was the extra charges, $20 per night for valet parking plus an extra charge per night for the resort amenity fee $15 (whether you use them or not) very poor really, total cost for extra charges for the 4 nights was $146 = £94 this didn't include sunbeds/umbrella's on the beach which was another charge of $50 per day, We couldnt fault anything with the hotel, it was very nice with fabulous views across the bay, the staff were very friendly and made you feel very welcome. The Sky Bar across the road is very good and much cheaper then the hotel with live music.

title: Nice hotel but it has problems
review: Dear Ralanengland,  We appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts about your most recent stay. I am pleased to hear that you found our resort staff to be friendly and welcoming. For our resort fee it is a standard charge for all of our reservations and outlined at the time of booking. The resort offers complimentary pool and beach chairs, however our umbrella and cabana charges are a daily rate. Thank you again and we hope you chose to stay with us the next time you are in the Clearwater area.

title: Great property. Great Location. Great service!!!
review: Stayed here for a week after a busy week in Orlando so we were looking for somewhere to relax.   The hotel has a fantastic position right on the beach. During the day this means you can alternate between the excellent pool (with zero-depth-entry for young kids) and the wonderful warm see only a few dozen yards away. In the evening a meal by the beach fire, while the sun goes down and the kids roast marshmallows, is a wonderful experience.  The restaurant in the hotel, Caretta On The Gulf, was also very good. Great food, lots of local seafood (as you would hope) and great service. Breakfast was a particular highlight with the kids really enjoying the bespoke omelette and fried egg service.  As I say in the title, it's great if you get the right room by which I mean avoiding…

title: Love love love the Sandpearl!
review: I've lost count if how many times we've stayed at this beautiful resort.  Won't even consider staying at any of the other hotels on Clearwater Beach.  From the moment you check in you are made to feel welcome.  Mark, the bellman, is terrific and even remembers us from previous visits. That may not be important to some people but to us it means a lot.  Stayed in  bay view room that was quite roomy.  View was good fr the balcony.  Which did overlook the air conditioner units for the restaurant.  It was a little noisy but not unbearable. If that kind of thing bothers you then you should consider a different view. Once in the room you can't hear the outside noise.   The room and bathroom were always very clean. I'm picky about this and did not have any issues with housekeeping.  The…

title: Luxury on beach but beware of extras!
review: Dear Lovetochill10,  Thank you for sharing your comments on your most recent stay with us. I am pleased to hear that two of our employees assisted in making your stay memorable, I will certainly share your kind words with them as well as our management team.

title: Best in US, at least Florida
review: Stayed at Sandpearl after a hetic 10 days at Disney, so it was wonderful to sit & relax!  Hotel is beautiful, very well furnished & lovely rooms.  Champagne at check in & bucket & spade for my son was a nice touch. Have to say that the rooms are the cleanest I have come across & I have stayed in many hotels.  The only thing was I couldnt get the air con to work in room (balcony door was closed) but as weather wasnt great I didnt make a big deal of it. Only things that did concern me was the resort charge of $25 per day + tax, for towels, water, coffee, sunbeds & use of gym.  It was $50 for the childrens club for 4 hours (we gave that a miss!) and $19 for smores for the fire at night on the beach??!!  I think these should be included in a 4/5 star hotel, maybe this is just a…

title: Relaxing stay in hotel with character
review: Dear Korkyf,  I am so pleased to hear that you and your family we able to enjoy a relaxing time here, especially after a 10 day stretch at Disney! I will pass along your compliments to our housekeeping department as I know they take great pride in maintaining our property. Thank you again and we look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

title: Nice place but couple of issues
review: Ive been a lot of places, but my fiancé and I had a wonderful time and will for sure be back! Great Resort, family friendly and great staff. A must stay. Minutes from everywhere and the weather is always a plus. Overall wonderful experience. Top notch.

title: Perfect get-away!
review: My husband and I decided to stay at the SandPearl for our babymoon - one last geat-away before we welcome our first child later this summer. The SandPearl was wonderful!  We were looking for total relaxation and that's what we got. Everything met or exceeded my expectations when it came to the accommodations, from our lovely coastal view room, to the relaxing pool environment, to the beachside service.  The best part had to be the fire pit on the beach every evening at sunset. Sitting on our balcony watching the most gorgeous sunset was just perfect!  It was exactly the trip we were hoping for!

title: Another excellent stay
review: Dear Erin F,   Congratulations on your upcoming addition to your family. It is so great to hear that you and your husband enjoyed your stay here at the Sandpearl. We hope to welcome the three of you back soon!

title: Great Family Holiday
review: Second time at the Sandpearl.  Spent a week with the family in a Caldesi suite ,2 bedroom.  The suite was very spacious with a north and east view.  With the 2 rooms we had 4 different balconies.  The room was clean and fresh the whole stay.  An excellent housekeeping staff. The pool and private beach were well attended by wait staff from Tate's grill, which has decent Florida beach fare.  We also enjoy the breakfast buffet at Caretta on the Gulf.  Except for a few days cut short by weather from tropical storm Beryl we thoroughly enjoyed our stay again.

title: You will not be disappointed.......Sandpearl is PERFECT!
review: Dear Mddoc151,  I am so pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed another excellent stay with us here at the Sandpearl Resort. It sounds like our two bedroom suite was just perfect for you and your family’s needs. I am glad that you enjoyed dining at both of our restaurants Caretta on the Gulf and Tate Island Grill. I am sad to hear that your vacation was cut short but hope that you chose to stay with us again the next time you are in the Clearwater area.

title: kiddo Loved it! pricey but lovely
review: Travelled from the UK and stayed here for 9 nights in May with the family (kids aged 4 & 2). We deliberated for a long time about the advantages of the 'all suites' appeal at the Hyatt but the zero entry pool and being right on the beach won out.   Due to our budget we booked the 'cheapest' room (costal view) and were upgraded to a pool view. (having read the reviews on here, I registered with I-Prefer and emailed the concierge my membership number - not sure if this was the reason for the upgrade but only takes 5 minutes to register so worth doing).  The room itself was comfortable and adequately sized for a family of 4 (2 double beds and enough space for a cot). I think it would be a bit tight if the kids were 10 years older but these things are always a question of budget …

title: Excellent service
review: We stayed four nights at the Sandpearl as the start of our Florida holiday. We chose a junior suite that faced the gulf and the room was very nice, and the service at the hotel was excellent, particularly from the staff serving breakfast in the dining room, and by the pool. The only downside was music from a cafe on the corner could be heard from our balcony...but this was beyond the control of the hotel, and once we were inside the room we couldn't hear it, so it did not disturb our sleep. The hotel offers very good facilities - beach, pool, spa, regular yoga programs and a Starbucks outlet that opens early in the morning. the staff are very helpful. We found the immediate area of Clearwater Beach fairly limited in things to see or do - you would need to drive to Tampa if you…

title: Paradise set in paradise
review: Dear Chasney,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thought about your most recent stay. I am so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your junior suite.  I will pass along your compliments to our breakfast and pool staff. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to welcome you back again soon.

title: Pick another place
review: Overall a fantastic resort. Charges $25/day for services you may/may not use such as the fitness/business center, etc. $20 for valet service per day or free parking a few blocks away. Employees very pleasant. Room very spacious and clean. Turndown service with chocolates and "pearls of wisdom" cards every night with soothing music a pleasant surprise. Right on a beautiful portion of the beach with shops and restaurants within walking distance. Would highly recommend.

title: class operation at the sand pearl!!!
review: Dear Keaton1979,  I am so glad to hear that you thoroughly enjoyed the resort. We certainly appreciate your business and look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

title: Overrated, So disappointed! :(
review: For the price, pick another hotel!!!  The hotel itself is very nice in its appearance.  But its not worth the price.  I was there for a girls weekend and it rain one day.  We wanted a jacuzzi to relax in but was told that we had to get a spa treatment to use the indoor jacuzzi (which we would have been fine with except for the fact that they could not accommidate all 4 of us at the same time).  There is a spa outside but due to the rain we could not use it.  Also we had dinner in the hotel and was told that there was no rice to make sushi rolls (and they have a sushi bar), it was Saturday night at 7:00!!!  The bisque was terrible and the serves was the worst!!!

title: Excellent resort for our business meeting
review: Overall our group was very pleased with SandPearl Resort. We held an intimate, 4-day meeting with 55 guests who traveled from around the United States. Our collective experiences were very positive, however as the meeting planner for this event, I would report that three things stood out: 1.) Wendy Deblinger and Lynne Grant continuously went above and beyond to ensure the success for our meeting, including responding to last-minute function space requests, hospitality room changes, and more. 2.) The staff, including reservations, concierge and banquet, were extremely helpful, professional and responsive. We were what I would say a higher maintenance group and this team did a fantastic job at meeting our needs and exceeding our expectations. 3.) The overall atmosphere for our…

title: Look no further
review: Dear Sara_Travels,  I am so pleased to hear that you and your group thoroughly enjoyed your time here at the Sandpearl Resort. I will certainly pass along you compliments to Wendy and Lynne who were instrumental in providing you with a memorable stay. Thank you again and we hope to welcome you back again soon.

title: Housekeeping issues
review: This is a great resort and I highly recommend it.  As true in many cases, you get what you pay for and this one is worth the money even with its pricey rates

title: Clearwater Beach's Finest!
review: Dear NewFam6,  It sounds like you really enjoyed your stay here at the Sandpearl Resort! We hope to welcome you back the next time you are in the Clearwater Beach area.

title: Overated, with housekeeping problems.
review: We stayed here on 5/10-5/14 and as previous posts state there were housekeeping issues.  We checked in and our room and it wasn't acceptable.  There was brown "dirt" (or something that I didn't know what it was) all over the back of the bathroom door.  The fabric shower curtain was spotted and stained.  There was liquid drippings all over the inside of the sliding patio doors.  The paint on the patio door handel was chipped.  Patio needed swept and was stained.  The fabric bench located at the bottom of the bed was stained all over.  The furniture was dusty.  After reading all of the reviews on line we were disappointed with the room and didn't find it acceptable.  We did go down and tell the front desk.  The manager was very understanding and did upgrade us to a nicer room. …

title: Beautifully overpriced
review: Nice hotel,however I feel it was overpriced. Staff was very courteous with the exception of the initial contact person at check in. She was not helpful nor was she informative. Left a bad impression.

title: Beautiful Resort, Breathtaking Sunsets, Superb Service
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for taking the time to give us your thoughts on your recent stay at the Sandpearl Resort.  I am very sorry that you felt our resort was over priced.  I am also sorry about your experience at check in.  I would like to get additional information from you if possible so that I may look into the situation.  At your convenience please call me at the resort.  While our resort is definately not inexpensive we feel that there is a great value involved.  We take much pride in the beauty of the Sandpearl and the surrounding area but are even prouder of the service in which we provide.  I am sorry that in this case you were disappointed.  Again, thank you for the review.  I look forward to talking to you in the future.  Eric Waltz General Manager

title: Not worth the money
review: This Resort was the most enjoyable vacation destination that my husband and I have experienced!  We truly felt pampered by the staff, as they were the friendliest, and most courteous group of employees that we've come across yet traveling!  The decor was absolutely lovely, with a true coastal vibe.  The grounds were lush, with palm trees, and dune grasses blowing in the breeze, not to mention the flowers.  The lagoon style pool, and 2 jacuzzis, offered a refreshing respite from the gorgeous powdery white sand beach, directly in front of this area.  It was great fun sitting around the large fire pit at dusk, watching the sun set, while some of the families with children roasted marshmallows to make s'mores!  There is an outside restaurant, Tate's Island Grill, that services the…

title: Nicest place we have ever stayed at
review: Dear Jakermymon,  I am so glad to hear that you and your husband had such a wonderful experience while staying here at the Sandpearl Resort. It is wonderful to hear that you truly felt pampered and found out staff to so courteous. We look forward to welcoming you home again soon!

title: What an AWESOME place!!
review: Clearwater Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Florida with a number of nice hotels to choose from. Sandpearl Resort is a beautiful hotel, but only if you have more money than you know what to do with would I recommend staying here. I booked a "suite" for $550 a night (on sale-they were having an off season special).  It was a regular room with a couch in it. I asked the bellman what made this a suite because I thought I was in the wrong room! He said the extra tv. They had 2 TVs on the same wall about 6 feet apart. As if that would work out! The first night we ate at Caretta's which is supposed to be there 4 diamond restaurant. The food was not good, the service was absolutely terrible, and it was not at all crowded. I don't know what our waitress was up to all…

title: Worth Every Penny
review: Just spent a long "girls weekend" at this resort and it was all-around fantastic.    There were no less than 4 valets on duty when we arrived and the car drop was quick and efficient.  Ditto the car pickup throughout the entire weekend.  We never called ahead for the car and we never had to wait more than five minutes for it to arrive.  Check-in was efficient and made extra special by the chilled glass of nice(!) champagne we were given upon arrival.  The lobby is gorgeous and the front desk staff was friendly and welcoming; a fantastic start to our visit!    I agree that the room descriptions can be tricky, but it's not rocket-science.  When booking you can always call the hotel or just look at a map of the area.  It's pretty easy to see what "bay view", "gulf view", etc.…

title: Very classy resort but very loud at night when they rent out their meeting room
review: Dear Castmember,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about you most recent stay. I am so glad that you and your friends had such a wonderful girl’s weekend. It sounds like from the beginning of your stay until your departure was filled with memories that will last a lifetime. We appreciate your business and look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

title: Great Hotel but beware if you are looking for a quiet room!
review: This resort was one of the nicest ones we have stayed at.  We stayed in a gulf front jr. suite for 4 nights on the 4th floor.  The last 2 nights we were there, the meeting room on the 3rd floor was rented out for wedding parties and the music was thumping in our room VERY loud until after midnight, which made for two tired and grumpy small children for our last two days.  We called the front desk 3 times and my husband went down to the front desk and they would not do anything.  I loved everything about this resort except the noise at night, which is enough for us to never stay here again.

title: It's all about the location
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for reviewing your recent stay at the Sandpearl Resort.  I truly appreciate the feedback.   I am very happy to hear that you believe this is one of the nicest resorts in which you have ever stayed.    I am very sorry for the noise issues you experienced from a wedding that was taking place.  We normally do our very best to guarantee that only guests with the weddings get blocked in those rooms.  I have reviewed your comments with our Front Office Team to make sure that we do a better job of reserving the correct rooms.  If you should decide to stay with us in the future please contact me and I will assist in making sure that you do not experience this issue again.  Regards, Eric Waltz General Manager

title: Beautiful resort, but over priced
review: There are several room classifications all of which, to the casual observer, sound like they have a sea view. Bay view, coastal view and Gulf view were the various classifications, all in isolation sound like you have a view looking out to sea.....not so.  We had a Coastal view room on the North side of the hotel looking up the coast. The biggest problem was that we were above the hotels air con fan outlets (I assume that's what they were?). It was very noisy even when you shut the balcony window. The noise was like we were staying in a Heathrow motel! We asked to change rooms and were given a room on the south side of the hotel. This was also a Coastal view but looked at the building to the side of the hotel. Great room but at night the noise from the pub across the street was…

title: Perfect romantic trip
review: The staff was first class from michael the conceige to the waiters logan and dennis on the beach and at restaruant. The Hotel was beautiful, beach was great only place on clearwater beach where you can enjoy a drink. One of the best vactions i have been on in a long time. I would advise any of my friends to go. Thanks again to the staff

title: Amazingly family friendly!
review: Dear SaltwaterTN,  Wow. It sounds like you had a wonderful time during your stay with us at the Sandpearl Resort. I will certainly pass along your kind words to our staff that helped to make your stay so memorable. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.

title: Perfect family vacation
review: Our Family has stayed at a number of high end resorts, and I have to stay in the last  few years this hotel has been far and away the best for kids. (Aside from the lack of diaper changing stations in the public are restrooms).   The poolside and beach atmosphere were amazing, I could enjoy my cocktail, and not worry about drunkity drunks ruining the poolside experience for my kids with foul language and other "adult" vacation behavior that is openly tolerated at other "family" resorts in the St.Pete/Clearwater beach area.  The fire pits at night were great for the s'mores   Their are no negatives only a few minor annoyances that could occur anywhere at anytime ( being evacuated for a fire alarm at the kids bedtime). The valet bringing my car around to give to someone else (the…

title: Fantastic New Years Eve Babymoon
review: Dear Pasha1,  I am so pleased to hear that you and your family thoroughly enjoyed the resort. Our pool deck is very family friendly and it soundly like your children really enjoyed it along with our fire pit. For your convenience our three main bathrooms offer children’s changing stations. Our valet team requires ID or a valet ticket to obtain a guest car I apologize if another guest mistakenly tried to access your vehicle. I will pass along your kind words to Tara who assisted you with check-in.

title: Wonderful stay at the Sandpearl.
review: Just returned from a weeklong stay at Sandpearl with my wife, and three kids ages 5, 3, and 9 months.   The bottom line on this hotel is that is a true 5 star resort (comparable to a Four Seasons or Fairmont) with the added benefit that they cater to families.  A quick word on costs: this hotel is expensive, but given the level & quality of service provides it is well worth it (why people post reviews that complain that high end resorts are expensive is beyond me: nice things cost money, you wouldn’t expect to buy a BMW for the same cost as a Chevy, and hotels are no different).   The resort itself is beautiful: not too large, well manicured grounds, easy to get around.  The pool area is perfect for young kids, as one end provides a zero-entry option.  Lunch and drinks are…

title: Outstanding
review: We spent two days at the Sandpearl this week. What a lovely property! Everything was great!

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Dear CoronelAureliano,  I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We appreciate your business and hope you chose to stay with us again soon.

title: PARADISE!!
review: Overall an outstanding, very enjoyable vacation for my family of four.  We spent 9 nights at the Sandpearl and thought that this property deserved the accolades that it receives.  From the bellmen and the front desk personnel to the poolside waiters and waitresses and the staff at Caretta’s we could not have been more pleased with our interactions.    The poolside food was above average as was the food at Caretta’s.  Ordering food and drinks poolside was a breeze with very prompt, attentive service. Nice lounge in Caretta's to have a drink after dinner. Loved the Adirondach Chairs on the beach! Lots of things for the kids to do.  The green patch of grass is a great place for the kids to keep busy playing soccer with their new friends while Mom and Dad relax.   The rooms were…

title: Best Hotel in Clearwater Beach!!!!!!!!!
review: Dear Picklesmcd,  I am pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed your time spent here with us, at the Sandpearl Resort. I am glad that you found all of our staff to be pleasant and attentive. Our resort fee includes several items including wired and wireless internet access, access to our fitness center and business center, nightly shoe shine, two bottles of water daily, in room coffee, local phone calls, pool and beach towels, and a bike rental per reservation. Again thank you for taking the time to share your thought and we hope you chose to stay with us the next time you visit Clearwater Beach.

title: Excellent hotel - highly recommend
review: So lucky to have had the opportunity to stay in a WORLD CLASS Resort

title: very good depending on the room!
review: We stayed here a couple of years ago and stayed in a south/pool facing suite and it was extraordinary. Had a wonderful time and couldn't wait to go back. This time I wasn't feeling so flush and opted for the cheaper north facing room. How bad could it be, you are still facing the beach....well let me tell you, splurge for the pool facing rooms. We were on the 4th floor, right above an alley and a smelly restaurant that smelled so oily and greasy it was hard to sit out on our oversized beautiful deck. I tried to switch rooms but they were full....so many great things about this place but it was school vacation week and way too many kids around the pool for  my liking but the beach was great and of course you can rent your chairs and umbrella for 25 bucks for the day. Expensive…

title: Disappointed
review: Dear Dalsofrom,  First I would like to thank you for choosing to stay with us again I am so pleased that you enjoyed your stay. I apologize that you were not pleased with your coastal view room, these rooms are located north on the resort and provide a partial view of the beach and surrounding sea side neighborhood. We hope you and your husband choose to stay with us on your next visit to Clearwater Beach.

title: A Hidden Gem
review: We chose the Sandpearl after reading Trip Advisor reviews when in fact we should have taken more notice of last years reviews ! The room was described as a having a coastal view when in reality overlooked a bin yard and a car park with a distant strip of beach. We could not sit on the balcony (where you could reach over and touch your neighbour ) Because of noise and smells from the extractor fans from the restaurant. We mentioned this to a disinterested front desk clerk and was offered a Gulf suite for an extra approx $1000. Housekeeping was a bit hit and miss,stocks of towels,water,tea and coffee not being replenished And had to be requested,also found the air conditioning overpowering ,waking most nights very thirsty. The resort fee of $25 per day includes a beach chair but…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for taking time to complete a review of your recent trip to the Sandpearl.  I am very sorry to hear the issues you experienced and that you left disappointed.  The resort is located on Clearwater Beach, which is an island to the west of Clearwater.  It is sourrounded on the east by Clearwater Bay and on the West the Gulf of Mexico.  Due to the location of the resort not all rooms are directly facing the Gulf of Mexico, but rather the view of the coastline to the north and south.  We do offer many rooms with Gulf Views but of course those rooms rent at  a premium.  We do feel that the price placed on any given room type or view is a great value due to the nature of the resort and location.    I am very sorry for the issues you experienced with Housekeeping as well.  We  provide extensive training to our Housekeeping Team and unfortunately it appears that someone fell short on delivering on our own expectations.  I will review your comments with our Director of Housekeeping.  I am glad that you enjoyed your time at Tate's Island Grill.  At your convenience and should you feel it appropriate please contact me at the resort as I would like to get additional feedback regarding your stay.  Regards, Eric Waltz General Manager

title: Beautiful resort, good for families
review: I had to attend to this Resort for a friends wedding.  This was the first time I have ever been to the West Coast of Florida.  All I can say is, Wow!  The Hotel was impectable.  It has the whitest beach sand I have seen outside of Cancun.The staff was friendly and helpful.   The rooms are a bit pricey, but I was blown away when they upgraded me to a suite, which included two balanies, one in the master bedroom and the living room.   I had arrived early around 11AM, since check in isn't until 3PM,  I went to the front desk just to ask for them to hold my luggage until I was able to check in. They said I could check in now if I wanted to.  I simply ask if I could get a room looking at the beach.  They said they couldn't, but said he would do me one better, by upgrading me to the…

title: Amazing
review: I had read all the positive reviews about this place, but for some reason I was not sure if we would like it here. When we arrived we were really impressed by how luxurious this resort is. We were welcomed with champagne upon check in. Check in was quick and the staff extremely friendly.  We had a Mandalay Bay suite with a "gulf" view. They are a little generous with the term gulf view because this had a partial view of the beach and mainly overlooked the bay. My complaint about this room was it actually mainly overlooked the air conditioning units which were very loud. For this  reason we couldn't keep our balcony doors open overnight. Also, the balconies at this resort are laid out in a very strange pattern that leaves no privacy and do not lend themselves to spending time…

title: Nice stay but beware of hidden charges.
review: Dear DeepestBlue22,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts on your most recent stay with us. I am so pleased to hear that you enjoyed the resort and all of the amenities we offer. It sounds like you really enjoyed our spacious suite and furnishings. Our Mandalay Suites are located on the east and northern side of our resort which offer either a bayside view or coastal view looking down the coast line and surrounding seaside neighborhood. We appreciate your business and hope to welcome you back again soon.

title: Excellent beach location!
review: We booked this hotel through DHR.  We thought it was an excellent price at the time.  What they don't tell you when you check in is that they will charge you $25 per day as a resort amenity fee.  They don't even ask you to authorise it on check out.  They just charge your credit card and leave a receipt under your door.  When challenged about it they simply said that there was nothing they could do about it and DHR will have already informed us of the charge at the time of the booking.  We checked all emails and the booking confirmation and nothing.  I spoke to three different levels of their staff, even the resort manager and they refused to refund me despite there being no contract in place.  The charge is supposed to cover water in your room (big deal and shouldn't that be…

title: If Heaven was a place on earth!!
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very  much for taking the time to respond to your recent stay at the Sandpearl Resort on Clearwater Beach.  Please accept my sincere apology for you not being informed about the resort charges at the time of your reservation.  All of our third party booking websites should mention the charges at the time of making reservations.  Additionally, we should have confirmed these charges upon check in.  I will review your comments with our Front Desk Team to guarantee we do this consistantly.  Also, you mentioned breakfast.  While our breakfast is not inexpensive we feel that it is a great value as the quality and variety of offerings are the best around.  We also offer "Kids Eat Free" for our breakfast buffet which helps out families considerably.  If you feel it appropriate, please feel free to contact me directly at the hotel.  Again, thank you for staying with us.  We hope you choose the Sandpearl during your next visit to Clearwater Beach.  Regards, Eric Waltz General Manager

title: Great View
review: A wonderful luxury retreat on the beach. This hotel is a great place to stay with a lovely pool and hot tubs, beach fire pit, great restaurant etc. The only draw back are the extra costs when you get there: the resort fee, parking fee $20 and optional beach Umbrella fee's ($25), plus Beer $6.50 For the 3 days we stayed it was worth paying the extra as the hotel is gorgeous but it does add to the overall holiday costs which is a shame! Plus no breakfasts included!

title: The best pool in town!!!
review: Very nice property, very luxurious and a great pool to relax and have some fun while in Clearwater!! The staff are great and they will treat you like a king!!!

title: Luxurious and still comfy for families
review: Dear Lebdude,  I am so pleased to hear that you and your family had such a wonderful time staying with us here at the Sandpearl Resort. We hope we are able to welcome you back again soon.

title: Great but.......
review: We've been to the Sandpearl twice now, and we rarely go to the same place twice.  Its attentive service, beautiful property, great location, and well maintained rooms make us feel spoiled.  The food at Tate Grill on site is very good, and you can eat there or get pool deck service.  We love the zero entry part of the pool, perfect for our small kids and the activities desk even loans out some pool toys.  The powdery sand beach was clean with some lounges and umbrellas, although they are located a good distance back from the water because the beach is so deep.  The activities desk also puts out toys and games, such as hula hoops, soccer nets and balls, and bean bag toss.  One night, the hotel had an inflatable movie screen in the pool and s'more roasting activities.  One downside…

title: Best Hotel in Clearwater Beach
review: Dear Nikkibo77,  I am so glad to hear that you and your family had such a wonderful time here at the Sandpearl Resort. It sounds like your children really enjoyed our pool deck and the different children’s activities we have available. We appreciate your business and look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

title: Beautiful Beachside Resort
review: Just got back from a 4 night stay.  Perfect weather and will come back.  The property is kept very clean and as busy as they are they are able to do a good job of keep up with maintanance.   Drinks and food were pricey, no surprise.  There is a reason the two or 3 resturants next door to the hotel are packed. Great food and reasonable prices.   I would only stay here if I had the gulf/ocean view room or direct gulf view.   The noise and views from the other rooms would not be my idea of a nice vacation.  A few compliants:  I read so many people talk about the glass of champagne offered upon check in.  They forgot to offer me one!  I could have used it after the traffic jam into town.  I allowed the staff to bring my suitcases and carry on up to my room.  Took 3 calls and almost…

title: Great Location on beach.
review: Great hotel for visiting Clearwater. Superb location on beach and close to shops.  Room very clean and tastefully decorated.

title: UNBELIEVABLE
review: Dear HolidayGod, I am glad you enjoyed staying with us at the Sandpearl Resort. It sounds like you really enjoyed our resort and the local area.

title: family of five
review: Was staying at a resort in St. Petersburg, Sirata which produced inferior rooms and worse service so one morning at 1 a.m. decided enough is enough. The only hotel that had rooms available was SAND PEARL, CLEARWATER BEACH, FLORIDA...CHECKED in at 1 a.m...unbelievable service...room very nice...decided to stay an extra day and upgraded myself to a suite...gulf view with balcony. Hotel staff found out it was my birthday and sent chocolate covered strawberries to the room....so decided to stay another day. Would be difficult to find a better hotel with view, service,quality of food, great room service and unbelievable staff.  Victoria was awesome at the front desk...and Nick in the starbucks cafe outstanding...what can I say...wish I could stay there forever

title: Great time
review: Dear Mentorman52,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your most recent stay. I am so glad that you found our staff to be so wonderful. I am glad that we were able to share in your birthday celebration! We hope to welcome you back again soon.

title: Just Beautiful................
review: We just got back from the Sandpearl and thought it was a great place for a family vacation. Our children are 7,4,2. We thought the one bedroom suite with kitchenette and washer dryer made our vacation luxurious and convenient. In the room the kids enjoyed the oversize bathtub and shower.  The pool and the beach were terrific and the kids loved the s'mores at in the evening. The restaurant (tate's ) in the hotel was very good and reasonably priced (for a hotel) and there were two very popular restaurants across the street as well as a CVS. The hotel was very busy which meant that it was necessary to go to the pool around 8am to reserve your pool and beach chairs for the day ( which maybe a problem for some but was not a big deal for us). I found the staff to be very helpful…

title: Great experience!
review: Outstanding service at the Sandpearl. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Best of all, the entire Phillies team was there for a banquet during Spring Training. The poolside service was fast and efficient. Would definitely go back here, the location right on the beach was perfect.

title: Incredible Staff, Fun Resort, Beautiful Beach
review: Dear My3boysbbn,   We are pleased you enjoyed your stay with us and found our poolside service to be fast and efficient. We appreicate your business and look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

title: incredible service
review: Just spent four days at the Sandpearl--should have stayed way longer!  The staff are all great---they are professional, friendly and played a huge part in creating the resort experience. From the beach, to the pool, the restaurant to the front office, everyone was fantastic.  The resort is fun. It's well designed, maintained and appointed. The public areas are manicured and the facilities are everything we could have wanted.   The restaurant was a cool bonus--we didn't know it had such a nice restaurant. The food was great and dining room was elegant.  This was our first time at Clearwater Beach. The beach is beautiful--silky white sand with plenty of beach and warm gulf water...and, of course, picture perfect sunsets.  We look forward to coming back sometime soon.   Special…

title: Clean, Very Friendly, Upscale Resort
review: Dear Whecks,  I am truly happy we were able to accommodate you and your family during your most recent stay. I am glad you enjoyed our restaurants and our picture perfect sunsets.   Thank you for taking the time to express your gratitude as it was a pleasure working with you. :) I hope to see you and your family again soon.

title: Best Hotel I have ever stayed in.
review: The service at the sand pearl was the best I have ever experienced.  The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful!  Everything was well thought out and they do everything to make your stay there as easy and enjoyable as possible. I was not looking forward to this trip but was pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was and how beautiful the beach was.  The food was good but could be better.

title: sandpearl or hyatt?
review: Just spent 5 nights at the Sandpearl.  This was our first trip to the SP and the Clearwater area.  We were debating between the Hyatt and the SP.  The hyatt is very nice and new from the outside and has large rooms BUT it is not on the beach.  To get to the beach from the pool, you have to take an elevator down and cross the street.  This was a deal breaker for us. The SP is fantastic all the way around.  The rooms, service, pool service, pools and facilities are on par (or very close) with Ritz Carlton.  The pool charis with the sun shades are great and very comfortable with daily live acoustic music.  The beach is right outside the pool area and we went back and forth all day.  The SP beach is one of the best I have been on.  Clean, pure white powder sand and about 300 yards…

title: Green Resort-On the sand
review: Dear Clarkgriswold817,  Thank you for your kind comments. We appreciate your business and I am pleased to hear you and your family thoroughly enjoyed your stay.

title: Truly Amazing!!!
review: Stayed here for our anniversary. On the quieter north end of Clearwater Beach this hotel is a stunner. This is the re-invention of the grand old lady, The Clearwater Beach Hotel. The views are amazing either beach or intercostal side. Service is great from check-in to check out. On top of all this, it is a Green Resort, Platinum LEEDS certified. You can even get a tour of all the green practices.

title: Very good hotel, will be back
review: Dear Seashark7,  Happy Anniversary! I am pleased the Sandpearl Resort was able to play a part in creating a memorable anniversary for you and your significant other.   Thank you for highlighting our LEED certification as we are very proud to be a green resort.

title: One my best vacations ever
review: This was our third trip to the Sandpearl and we absolutely love it everytime!  The accommodations are lovely and top notch, but what really sets them apart is their staff.  We always feel beyond pampered by the staff at the Sandpearl.  My employer sends us there every January for an annual meeting and I get the pleasure of working with Lynne Grant and Larry Eddy to put this event together every year and they make my job so easy and quite enjoyable.  Honestly, they make everything go so well that it makes me look good, when really I had very little to do with it, they are the ones that work so hard for us.  I highly recommend the Sandpearl for any event, vacation or friendly get away.  You will not be disappointed!

title: Great Experience
review: We went to the Sandpearl Resort in September, We took our Kids ages 8 and 9. I thought they were going to be bored as mine are easily bored and very picky about what they eat. Needless to say we had a great time and a wonderful experience all around.

title: Great place...loved it!
review: Dear Jennessisa,  I am so glad that you and your family had such a wonderful time at our resort. I am pleased to hear that your children were entertained and were able to find meals to suit their taste.

title: Nice Resort and Very Helpful Guests for Activity Advice!
review: Hotel was great, a little on the expensive side, but we were only there 2 nights.  Awesome view of the beach, comfortable beds, good food and great staff. Within walking distance of many restaurants and bars.

title: Nice hotel...
review: Dear Mya B,  Thank you very much  for staying with us, we appreciate your business and hope you are able to visit with us again soon.

title: Disappointing start
review: This was one of many trips to Clearwater Beach for my family and me.  We have 2 small children, and they enjoy the beach immensely!  The staff was friendly, very helpful, and it is what you would expect from a "higher-end" resort.  It is pricey; but, if it is affordable to you, I believe it is worth the cost!  The beach was absolutely lovely!  (That being said, it's not hard to please toddlers on a beach!) My husband and I found the stay to be quite relaxing and enjoyable also.  However, we did not like that valet was the only option for parking.    Fitness and activity are very important to our family.  While traveling, I like to exercise and enjoy various fitness options.  The bikes were fun (albeit an extra and exorbitant cost in our opinion) and the beach provides for lovely…

title: Fabulous Resort/Beach/Customer Service
review: We just returned from a week at the Sandpearl Resort on Clearwater Beach.  What a beautiful property on the most amazing and perfect beach!  We hated to leave.  The resort staff were all very welcoming and helpful - we never wanted for anything......and in the few instances we needed something - the staff was always instantly available. We stayed in a one bedroom condo - on the 8th floor - it was roomy and had all the comforts of home.  Room service was prompt and the food was great.   The atmosphere was relaxed and serene - we loved the live music at sunset at the beach bar.  Crazy wonderful and soooo soothing at the end of the day.  The beach at this resort is one of - if not the most - beautiful I have ever been to.  The sand is like sugar and stretches beautifully to the…

title: Close to Clearwater Aquarium/Reviewer is VERY picky traveller
review: Dear Wellseasoned55,  It is so wonderful to hear that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us at the Sandpearl Resort. It pleases me to know that you found our staff to be very accommodating and attentive.  I am glad that your enjoyed our pool and beach area and found it easy to locate a pool lounger at your leisure. It sounds like you really enjoyed the amenities we offer at the Sandpearl and we look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

title: My "happy place"
review: We visited Clearwater to take our kids to see Winter the Dolphin.  The hotel is a 5 minute drive from the aquarium.  We arrived late afternoon.  Room ready immediately.  Check-in quick and smooth. Drinks provided on check-in...nice touch.  Room was clean and nicely decorated. Had  2 queen room.  Room had sleeper sofa too so we had plenty of room (2 young kids/2 adults) - we typically get suites so we can "spread out" when we travel but only one night here so selected basic room.  Bathroom a little weird - everything a little high, even for my 6'2" husband. Very tough for kids to use sink because the vanity was so high. I had to hold my son (3 1/2) up to wash his hands everytime...ughh!  Potty and tub side high too.  Beach beautiful and beachside restaurant had great service. …

title: Lovely Resort Hotel with some weak spots....
review: Dear Mamalevine,  Thank you for sharing your experience about your most recent stay. I am pleased you found the room to be spacious for you and your family. I apologize that you were not able to enjoy your salad at dinner, I do hope you shared with us that you did not care for the dressing so that we could provide you with an alternative dressing or entrée. I am also sad to hear that you were not able to enjoy the resort after breakfast the day of your departure, we do offer restrooms poolside and an outside shower to rinse off for any guest that wish to remain on property after checkout.

title: Great hotel/resort.
review: I have never wrote a review before; however, thought I would as I have been using Trip Advisor quite often lately. I have traveled all over the world and can truly say this is my favorite place. We have been staying here since 2007 and come as frequently as possible as we leave 4 hours across the state in Southeast Florida. Eric, the manager, is truly in the right profession. There is not one thing you will find wrong with this place; if you like perfection, then the Sandpearl is the place for you.

title: Good, could be great
review: Overall this is one of the better Florida resorts we have stayed at.  It wasn't at all tacky and managed to be fairly relaxing despite being a busy weekend.  The pros:  the beach is fantastic (but you have to pay for beach chairs, see in the cons), location in Clearwater is good, clean and very comfortable rooms, quiet, great views of the sunset from the balcony and top rate facilities.  Carrita dining was good, some reviewers have said pricey but same $ as other places there.  The cons:  You do pay a $25/day resort fee that doesn't include beach chairs or the bicycle rentals (an extra $25 each).  The poolside loungers are included in the resort fee, but you do share the facility with the 'beach club', meaning that people not staying at the hotel compete with you for pool…

title: Nice place with some problems
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time for writing a review of your recent stay at the Sandpearl.  I very much appreciate it.  I am glad that you enjoyed the beach, room and Caretta's on the Gulf.  In your review you did mention a concern with the Resort Fee.  The intent of the Resort Fee is to add enhancements to your stay to make the stay even more enjoyable.  The Resort Fee includes many things however you mentioned beach chairs and bicycle rentals.  The chairs on the beach are included in the Resort Fee however the umbrellas are rentable at a fee of $25 (the umbrellas include 2 chairs) as there are a limited amount.  Additionally, we do have bicycles available for rental however included with the Resort Fee is one complimentary bike rental per day.  The Beach Club is something that we offer for our local guests.  As the pool area is private you must be a Beach Club Member to enjoy it.  We have a very limited amount of Beach Club Members (under 50) to guarantee that there is no impact on our Resort Guests.  On any given day we do not have more than a dozen members joining us.    Again, thank you for taking your time to write the review.  If you would like to speak with me regarding your visit I would appreciate the time.  Hopefully we will see you again soon at the Sandpearl.  Regards, Eric Waltz General Manager

title: Incredible resort! Magnificent views, friendly staff.
review: I just got back from the Sandpearl and overall it was a good trip. I thought the service all around was great. Everybody was really helpful and friendly. I would have rated it as "good", but not very good. Here are some issues that I had:  1. First and foremost the wireless internet never worked at all for me. They told me it was a router problem and it was never corrected. I own a business and need to be connected at all times. The internet is included in the $25 resort fee and it is not available. Their business center consists of two old computers with encryption problems and a printer. At least I was able to print out my boarding passes. I know people go to a resort to relax and not work, but we all don't have that luxury. I would advise upgrading the business center…

title: Beautiful hotel and location
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review of your stay at the Sandpearl Resort.  I was very happy to hear that you thought the service was great and everybody was helpful and friendly.  Please accept my apologies for the issues  you experienced with the wireless internet.  While as a whole our internet service is reliable unfortunately there are times issues due occur.  Regarding the business center we have acted upon your comment and are in the process of replacing both computer terminals and adding 21.5" screens.  As perhaps you might know we are a LEED Certified hotel.  One of the requirements for this presitigious recognition is guaranteeing that the property is non-smoking.  While we value all of our guests we do make sure that all smoking does not occur withing 25 feet of the building or around the pool deck.  We do have designated areas where our valued guests can smoke and that is on the boardwalk area by our Pool Bar, Tate's.  We do provide beverage service in this area.  Again, thank you for your feedback. If you would like to speak more in depth regarding your stay and feel it appropriate please contact me at the hotel as I would like the opportunity to speak with you.  Have a great day.  Eric Waltz General Manager

title: Been around the world and loved the Sandpearl!
review: The Sandpearl is a fantastic resort in Clearwater! Everyone who works there is so accommodating and helpful! We can't wait to go back.

title: Outstanding Service!
review: The hotel is beautiful, convenient, right on the beach, and has wonderful restaurants and facilities. (I used the fitness center, but not the spa)  The heated outdoor pool was really nice and the gradual entry side (no steps - just a gentle incline into the water) was great for my infant daughter. The food at both in-house restaurants was great - particularly at the Tate Island Grill - which is between the pool and beach seating - a great place to have a drink and watch a child either at the pool or on the beach near the chairs.  (I would highly recommend getting the blackened grouper sandwich - outstanding.)   But what really impressed us was the service. Not only was the service excellent at individual areas of the resort (room service, pool attendants, restaurants) but there…

title: Great resort
review: Dear Ed L,  Thank you and I am so glad that you not only enjoyed you stay but found our staff to be so friendly and accommodating. We truly strive to provide all of our guests with a great experience. We will see you soon!

title: Returning to SandPearl
review: Beautiful resort -friendly helpful staff-right on the beach--I'll be back and have already told my friends about this special place

title: Beautiful hotel, grounds and view
review: Dear Debbie Framingham,  Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your most recent stay. I am glad you found our staff to be so friendly and helpful. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

title: Romantic Hotel On A Beach To Die For!!
review: I visited this hotel last Feb. with my daughter and granddaughter. This time my husband and I went for a week of R and R. This has it all. The staff could not be more friendly and thoughtful. This is a small luxury hotel where you walk out on the lower level of the hotel and have a swimming pool and are than on the beautiful white sand beach. Quiet area of the beach. Took a drive down toward  St. Petersberg and just were trying to find any other places that might work for vacations and like Sandpearl the best. They have good food but there are other places to eat around the hotel. I would have to say we had a one bedroom and great location but did find at times that the noise or wind was something we could hear. But never is there a perfect place but this comes close.

title: Absolutely love this hotel.
review: This was our second stay here. Great spot on and access to the beach. Wonderful sunsets. Pool and service is really good. Room, large and comfortable.

title: Great beach location
