I have stayed a few times in the past at various Clearwater Beach hotels, and this time it was a toss up between the latest two hotels, the Hyatt Regency or the Sandpearl, and boy i'm i glad i picked the latter. The Sandpearl in my view is on the best part of the beach,far enough from pier 60 without being too far away from the centre of things, the Hyatt is not directly on the beach with a road separting it. The check-in at the Sandpearl was effortless and the glass of champagne on arrival was a nice touch. My wife and i had booked an ocean facing room (552) which was large enough, with one double king…

title: Great Resort, needs some work
review: I have visited this spot on the beach many times before as it was the Clearwater Beach Hotelwhich i loved, i got married their so it holds a lot of very special memories for myself and my family. i was very excited about the new resort of the Sand pearl as i had expected my glass of Champagne on arrival which i thought was a lovely touch which was my first dissapointment, it was not offered, we enjoyed drinking the cocktails around the pool and as we were on holiday for a week did not mind that the prices were high, the drinks were delicious and the food throughout was very tasty. i was very dissapointed that people were smoking around the pool when they were supposed to only smoke beyond the black railings that led on to the beach and while the nice chaps were on hand to give…

title: The best vacation I have ever been on!
review: The sevice at the Sandpearl was great! The staff members were all very kind and helping. The locaton was the best part of it all, the resort is right on the beach. It was also right on the corner of a little town that had surf shops, restaurants, ice cream parlors, and a CVS. Right in the town is also a pier that you can go to, but at night you can go to the end and watch the beautiful sunset. The restaurants in the town are great, but my favorite place to eat at was right in the resort itself. Tate grille/ bar is between the pool and beach which is very convenient for lunch and dinner. It had amazing sandwhiches and beverages! However, the resteraunt inside the hotel, the Caretta on the Gulf, was very expensive and did not have a big variety of food to choose from. The rooms…

title: Nice, but hidden charges
review: Dear NewJerseyBilliam,   Thank you very much for staying here at the Sandpearl Resort. We are so please that you and your family were able to enjoy your vacation as well as our pool and beachside restaurant, Tate Island Grill. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

title: Gorgeous Resort
review: I enjoyed my stay in Clearwater, but wouldn't return to The Sandpearl. The resort itself was nice; good facilities and comfortable rooms. The problem was hidden costs. There was $25 per room per day resort tax and $25 per umbrella per day for use with the sun loungers on the beach. This was the general theme for use of most of the hotel and wasn't obvious when I booked.   The overall service was mixed. One day we were banned from the pool and beach so aerial photos could be taken, and checkout was automatic and charged to my card without discussion or any personal touch.  I think a hotel of this quality (and cost) could do better.

title: Nice Hotel, very noisy bars located oposite
review: We just got married there 4/15/11 and it was the best experience ever. They were so accomedating and took care of absolutely everything. The rooms, lobby, pool, spa, lounge, grille and everything else is absolutely beautiful. Our families couldn't stop raving about our wedding. The service was great and staff was so friendly. View was amazing! We just stayed in a standard king sized balcony room and it was gorgeous I can only imagin what the suites look like. I couldn't imagin giving this place a less then perfect score. We definately hope to be back in the future! Thanks Sandpearl!

title: Beautiful property located on the beach
review: I have been visiting Clearwater since I was a child and thought it would be the perfect place to go for great beaches, great food and great accommodations for a long weekend. I did a bunch of research and found this place. We were greeted by great employees who were more than pleasant. Upon check in we were asked if we wanted champagne, what a nice surprise. At the time of our trip there was the oil crisis in the Gulf happening and the staff was very quick to reassure us that the water and seafood was safe. Our room was gorgeous and very spacious. The balconies were nice and offered a view of Clearwater Beach. The pool was large and there was always a surplus of beach chairs. Drinks/food poolside were tasty. The resort is located near the end of "the strip" but it is within…

title: 4 star hotel in 2 star town
review: Dear Packrats0828,   Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay with us. It sounds like you had a wonderful time and created some very special memories here at the Sandpearl. Congratulation on your engagement… please contact us if you are interested in having a wedding here, we offer some fabulous event space. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.

title: Outstanding Service
review: Or to be fair to the locals, a great casual beach town with one expensive hotel. If you have to go to Clearwater Beach or surrounding area, the Sandpearl is the best place to stay. Hyatt, which would have been my second choice, looked ridiculous with first 6 or so floors for parking, Then pool on 8th floor. They must live in the elevators there.  Sandpearl is a nice enough hotel but you typically find hotels like this in towns with many fine dining choices and at least one store where someone over 25 years old can find a pair of pants. Most Clearwater beach stores are for T-shirts with tacky sayings and flip flops (Sandpearl tries with it's own store but is small with the typical Tommy Bahama and Vera Bradley). Restarants were not easy to come by but we did find a few surprises.…

title: Everything about the Sandpearl Resort was awesome.
review: Dear Michigantraveler3,   Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences of Clearwater Beach and the Sandpearl Resort. I am so glad you enjoyed your our accommodations. I apologize that you did not find the area and the local restaurants favorable. We hope you and your family were able to enjoy time spent together.

title: AWESOME
review: This resort was superb!!  Great location, comfortable rooms, beautiful beach are all assets, however, the biggest asset is the customer service.  Every employee we encountered was helpful, friendly and eager to please.  I can't say enough positive things about the staff.  They were able to provide outstanding service without being pretentious.  Shout out to Kyle at the pool.

title: loved the location
review: we stayed at a very nice hotel down the beach but we will certainly stay here next trip based on our experience at the beachfront resturant "tate". we couldnt have asked for a better way to watch the sunsets.

title: It was wonderful,excellent customer service and wonderful atmosphere.
review: Dear Flee2thecle,   Thank you for your response. We are glad you enjoyed your time here at the Sandpearl Resort and our lovely sunsets from our pool and beachside restaurant Tate Island Grill.

title: Nice resort
review: We stayed for 7 nights and this was our 2nd year staying here. The staff made us feel like royalty. The concierge was very helpful and knew the area well. The resort is very clean and relaxing, sitting on a beautiful beach. The resort is on Mandalay Bay which offers many wonderful restaurants within walking distance and close to Pier 60.

title: Exceeded Our Expectations!
review: Dear Bmhowe1,   We are so pleased that you and your family thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us at the Sandpearl Resort. We appreciate your business and hope to see you back again next year.

title: Our Family Holiday
review: Very nice resort. Right on the beach. The rooms were clean and very well kept. The food at the grill and restaurant was very good. The only negative point was that our balcony was over the roof of their conference center and the noise of the fan was very loud so it was difficult to stay out there. But who goes to the beach to sit on their balcony?? Great drinks at the grill while the sun set in the gulf. Will be back for sure.

title: Underwhelmed
review: I expected much more for the money. I agree with some of the other reviews, room is very average. Bathroom doesn't even have separate shower and bath, which you'd expect at this type of resort. Coastal view for us was a view of the a/c units and a dingy motel and their dumpsters. My room rate ended up literally being $80 more per night because of resort fee, parking, etc. The beach is very nice, but be careful with beverage/food service. Read your bill carefully, they may charge you other peoples drinks if you don't. Also, 18% gratuity is already added to beach/pool service bill but a tip line is still added for you to fill in.  One more very important thing, the rooms walls are paper thin. Can hear everything on both sides of us. Very uncomfortable.  It was like pulling teeth…

title: It is rare when the cost matches expectations
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at the Sandpearl Resort.  We truly appreciate all feedback, both good and bad, as it helps our team achieve its goal of 100% Customer Satisfaction.    In your review you commented on the room type you received.  While all rooms have terrific water views, there are room that face the coastline and bay of Clearwater rather than the Gulf of Mexico.  These rooms are priced accordingly due to the view that is received.  You also commented that during your time with us you visited our beachside restaurant, Tate's Island Grille.  I assumed that your bill was incorrect when it was presented to you.  For that I am very sorry.  I am also very sorry that we were not able to grant you a check-out later than noon.  March is our busiest time of the year and in order to guarantee that we have the rooms cleaned in time and to our guests expectations, late check-outs sometimes are not possible.  We normally do our absolute best to grant late check-outs if at all possible.  On a positive note, I was please to see that your Housekeeping Service and the service you received at Caretta's on the Gulf was great.  Again, I am very sorry for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay.  I will personally address these issues with the team.  If you find it appropriate, please feel free to contact me directly to review your concerns personally.  Thank you, Eric Waltz General Manager

title: A Great Hotel
review: I stayed at the Sand Pearl last weekend booking rooms with only a week to spare. I was familiar with Clearwater Beach being one of the best but had never been to the Sand Pearl. The room costs are right up there with the Ritz, Four Seasons etc so I had to swallow heard when I heard the number. We were dedicated to go and thankfully were not dissapointed. I must be honest I was looking for a reason to be grumpy about the the high cost but could find little reason to complain. As has been posted, the staff is always available and responsive in the most courteous of ways. The facilities are beautiful with a lively cafe located on a very nice beachside pool area. The workout facility was one of the better hotel facilities I have seen. The hotel was sold out so everything was busy…

title: We found our place in Clearwater
review: Dear Breeze19, Thank you for your response. It sounds like you and your family really enjoyed your time here at the Sandpearl Resort. We hope you are able to visit with us again soon.

title: NOT A RESORT!
review: This is a very good hotel in a great beachside location. From the pool to the white sand in a matter of yards. The rooms are clean with comfortable beds and everything one could want. The resort fees include the use of bicycles as well as entrance to Clearwater Aquarium. I was there for a conference and the facilities and food were excellent. I would not mind holidaying there although it would be a little expensive I fear. An ocean view room would be superb, mine was partial ocean and partial hotel grabage bins, so that was disappointing, but all in all this was a great hotel in a grand style.

title: Beautiful hotel and view, missing a few things that could easily make it perfect
review: We stayed at the Sandpearl March 18-21 2011. I had done alot of research and many thanks to everyone for posting their reviews which were very helpful! The photos posted by others are very accurate.   The hotel is beautiful. Beautiful lobby with a grand piano that plays itself, so very nice atmosphere upon entering. Very easy checkin. I had read about people who were offered champagne but we did not see that.  I am not sure if that is only for certain room types or certain times of day. We had mentioned that it was a birthday celebration and I had seen that in some cases for special occasions they sent up chocolate covered strawberries, but we did not receive anything special. We valet parked when we checked in, but also asked about the free self parking lot. They definitely do…

title: Great Hotel, Great Location Great Time!!
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for writing your review of the Sandpearl.  It sounds like you had a great time in the Clearwater area and were able to take advantage of the other great things in which Clearwater has to offer besides the Sandpearl Resort.  For the most part I was very pleased with your observations and comments.  It is the goal of the entire team to take every opportunity to create memorable experiences for each and every guest and it appears that we were able to do that for you and your family.  With that said there were a couple of items that concerned me.  The first of which was the speed of service at our beachside restaurant.  I will review your comments with  the food and beverage team and focus on improving in that area.  While we were in the middle of our busiest season of the year we should have done a better job at providing the service in which you should expect.  You also mentioned the issue with the access and billing of the wireless internet.  We provide wireless as part of the Resort Fee with no extra charge for moderate bandwidth usage.  For wireless with the additional bandwidth that is needed for streaming moview or music, there is an additional fee of $9.95 per day that needs to be approved by the pc user prior to acceptance.  I apologize for the confusion with this.  We are looking into our current Wi-Fi options to find one that is better suited for our guests.  I also apologize for the other communication issues you experienced.  We review these comments on a regular basis.  I will surely do this with the team.  Again, thank you very much for your feedback.  If you would like to speak in person, please feel free to contact me directly.  Regards, Eric Waltz General Manager

title: Decent hotel, mixed staff, silly resort fee
review: I will describe from check in to check out.  Check in went flawlessly.  Staff were courteous and friendly.  Our luggage was delivered promptly to our room.  We had a bay view with 2 queens.  The room wasn't large but extremely comfortable.  32" flat screen, comfortable beds, with turn down service, very clean and inviting.  Internet connection was fine. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to most amenities.  The pool area, Tiki Bar and beach are excellent.  Service staff here were great. The breakfast is excellent.  We ate at the hotel dining room 5 mornings because of the view, service and food quality.  About $63.00 with tip for 4 people. Valet service was excellent.  I would call just before leaving the room and out of 8 calls the car was waiting every…

title: This was such a great resort with beautiful  pool and beach!
review: Dear BarnsterOrangeville,  We are so pleased you had such a great time here at the Sandpearl Resort. Our restaurant does have excellent views with floor to ceiling windows and our delicious breakfast is a wonderful way to start the morning. We are glad you were able to extend your stay with us and hope to see you again.

title: Complete Turn-Around from 2008
review: The Sandpearl is located on a gorgeous beach in Clearwater Beach.  Rates are at a premium and the building still looks and feels pretty new.  Rooms are very average in size and the bathrooms on the smaller side for a newer resort.  You are paying for the location on the beach more than the rooms.  Many Orlando hotels offer better rooms.  Staff was decent and for the most part friendly.  Service at the outdoor eatery was very slow but the check-in/check-out process was excellent.  Valet service was also good.  The resort fee of $25 is silly when you are paying this type of rate.  The "free" internet service included in the resort fee is only 384K.  If you want real high speed internet it's another $9.99 a day.  The pool is on the smaller side, so things like free towels at the…

title: What a great place...
review: I am writing this review while we are still at the Sandpearl.  We have enjoyed our stay so much that I didn't want to wait until we got home and forget to write one.  From the moment we drove up the service has been exemplary.  We returned from a cruise and had scheduled to stay at Sandpearl to catch a few days of Phillies spring training before heading home.  We arrived at the hotel at 11:30 am and were sure we would have to have them hold our bags until our room was ready.  Well, much to our surprise we were checked in immediately, given a glass of champagne, and in our room before noon.  I had mentioned to the receptionist that it was our 35th anniversary - within the hour they delivered 6 of the most gorgeous (and tastiest) chocolate covered strawberries I have ever had. …

title: Very nice hotel, balcony wasn't really a balcony
review: Dear Grammyandgrumpy,   Thank you for such a positive review. We are pleased we were able to part in your 35th wedding anniversary celebration. Thank you for your comments on how friendly and professional you found our staff and your recognition of one of our finest bellman, Tony. We hope you found your last few days to be just as enjoyable as your first and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

title: Exceeded Expectations!
review: This is a very nice hotel and one we would probably stay at again.  Only one disappointment: I was under the impression that all rooms had balconies and if not a gulf view (for extra $) then a Bay view.  Since we planned to be out a lot, I didn't pay extra for the Gulf view but expected at least a balcony that would hold chairs and look across the island.  Our balcony was about 1 foot deep with no chairs, and it overlooked the airconditioning unit on a lower roof.  Otherwise, the hotel was a great choice -- location was great (in town but not noisy, on the beach), and the room was very nice.

title: Awesome!
review: Dear Daisyday284,   Thank you for your response. I apologize you were not satisfied with our balconies. All of our rooms have a furnished balcony with the exception of our Bayside rooms. These rooms either have no balcony or an unfurnished walkout balcony. We do have a supply of chairs that will fit on these balconies upon request. I am glad that overall you were pleased with the room and the resort.

title: Great hotel - great location - great views
review: We stayed at the Sandpearl the first week of March and had a great time. We rented from an owner (the top two floors are privately owned) from VRBO. Our unit was on the eight floor and had two balconies with views of both the gulf and the intercoastal. The suite was one bedroom with a full kitchen and was gorgeous! The resort itself in my opinion is comparable to top resorts (and I've stayed at places like Four Seasons) as far as how they make you feel pampered. One thing I noticed is that everything was so clean (the pool, the bathrooms by the pool, the overall hotel facilities). The pool was very enjoyable, not too crowded and it was easy to get a chair of your choosing without having to get up at the crack of dawn like some resorts.  The location of the hotel was perfect as…

title: Perfect Hotel
review: We stayed at the Sandpearl for one night with our two year old son.  We stayed in a one-bedroom suite that included a full kitchen, living area, master bedroom, and large bathroom.  There were also two balconies.  Wonderful!  We requested a crib ahead of time and it was in the room upon arrival.  Everything was spotless and very luxurious.  We ate at the beachside restaurant, Tate's.  They accomodated us with a high chair for our son.  Wonderful view of the beach and sunset.  Can't say enough about this hotel.  Most likely the best that we have stayed at, including Four Seasons and The Ritz Carlton at various locations.

title: Excellent hotel
review: Dear K020,   Thank you for your wonderful compliments. We are please you and your family enjoyed the resort and found it to be very luxurious. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

title: Beautiful resort on spectacular beach
review: I travel 40+ weeks a year on business and have stayed at many 4 diamond hotels and would rate this hotel as excellent - brought my wife and 2 teenage kids for a weekend stay for fun - Service is excellent & staff is friendly (gives off the high end feel without the stuffiness) - Rooms are modern and very clean - Other areas of the hotel (lobby, pool, etc...) are also very nice - Hotel is right on a beautiful beach - Local area has a nice "local" beach feel to it and found the restaurants to be pretty good  Would highly recommend this hotel

title: Exceeded Expectations
review: Dear Rams19881993,   We are pleased you and your family enjoyed your stay here at the Sandpearl. It sounds as though you found our resort atmosphere to be casual elegance. We hope to welcome you back again soon.

title: Lacking Customer Service???...I Think Not!!!
review: I was here with my husband for a business meeting and could not have been more pleased with the accommodations and service.  We were welcomed with glasses of champagne - a very nice touch.  Our room overlooked the pool and the beach.  I did notice that rooms facing the opposite direction did not have nearly as good a view, so it's worth inquiring about room location when booking.  The room was extremely spacious and comfortable.  The wide, white sand beach is right there.  It's great for walking, sitting, sunning.  We didn't try the water for swimming, but it looked good.  There's a great little restaurant next door, Clear Sky Cafe, that I would highly recommend.  The only down side is the cost - very expensive.  And then they add a resort fee and a parking fee.  Seems to me…

title: perfect resort in every way possible
review: This resort sits on clearwater beach facing gulf of mexico. Hotel is walk out to beach. The beach is perfect with soft white sands. Hotel has excellent customer service with fast and reliable assistance. Parking is vallet, which adds $20 per night, but autos are retrieved quickly to front door. Most activities, family friendly and other, are simple to locate and are within walking distance. Palm Pavillon eatery north of resort should be avoided. Bad customer service. I would suggest the free nightly sunset celebration on the pier, and eco boat tour. Consiure service is available durring day hours, and always ready to hand out advice. Our family cannot wait to return. We cannot find any reason to complain, and recommend to any traveler wanting an escape from "reality". Perfect…

title: not for me
review: Dear midwestgetaway,   We are so pleased to hear that you and your friends found our resort staff to be so helpful and reliable. We certainly strive for all of our guest to have a pleasant and memorable vacation. We look forward to welcoming you back to the Sandpearl Resort soon.

title: The Sandpearl Resort is an awesome vacation getaway!
review: The Sandpeal Resort's first impression was faboulous.  The doorman and ambassador welcomed us and knew exactly what to say, inviting us in the vip room and offering champaine.  They claimed we could get information and services 24-7 and they would love to help us.  Ha!  Once we got to our room, that went right out the door.  We wanted to go to the grill next to the resort, I had just purchased two drinks, went back for two more and they were closed before 7:00 p.m.  Also, we had questions about dining services in the area and the ambassador said she would check into it.  Well, there was no follow-up for us.  I could go on and on with several other examples of the lack of help or genuine concern, but I think you get the point.

title: Top shelf resort.
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for taking the time to give us feedback on your recent stay at the Sandpearl.  While I was glad to hear your arrival experience was positive I was concerned regarding the other issues you experienced throughout your stay.  We pride ourselves on customer service and it appears that we did not meet your expectations.  For that I am very sorry.    You mentioned that the grille closed promptly at 7pm.  We should have guaranteed that you were made aware that the grille was closing prior to your return to the bar.  I will discuss this with our team.  Additionally, if you requested information regarding the great local restaurants that Clearwater Beach has to offer we should have guaranteed follow up.  I will review your comments with our Ambassador and Concierge.  You mentioned that there were other items as well.  If you would not mind contacting me directly I would like to hear your other issues so that we can share with the team as that is the only way in which we will continue to improve.  Thank you, Eric Waltz General Manager

title: Not a Wonderful Place to Stay
review: From the moment we checked in to the time we checked out, we were treated like royalty.  The staff could not do enough to make our stay enjoyable.  They even apologized for the bad weather (which was still way better than the 5 below at home).  The only thing that was not top-notch was the fitness center; although there was a fair amount of aerobic equipment, there were almost no free weights and the room was extremely cramped.  We will certainly be back next year.

title: A year on, still the best
review: We're back to Clearwater Beach a year on and back to the Sandpearl hotel.  The hotel was as good as it was the last stay.  It's the best hotel on the strip, with the best hotel/martini bar.  This is mainly down to the terrific staff who are very reliable and friendly and go out of their way, including the great bar team and the folks who clean the rooms - unsung heroes.  A few comments for the senior management:  1. the food at the bar was really average quality - not hot and not very nice  2. i have a huge problem with anywhere charging a resort fee as they do here of $20 a day.  It's mandatory and it's a semi-hidden charge.  If you want to charge this, mark up the room rate at the time of booking.  Doubly frustrating at the Sandpearl is what you get (or don't get) for this…

title: Amazing!!!!
review: We went there for our honeymoon and it was amazing!!!! It was perfect for a romantic weekend...the beaches are beautiful, staff friendly, food amazing, rooms perfect. I also recommend going to Calidesi Island.... Great place to relax and go shelling.

title: Why stay anywhere else on Clearwater Beach?
review: Dear badidea223, Congratulations on your wedding! We are pleased you chose to stay here at the Sandpearl Resort for your honeymoon, and we look forward to celebrating many anniversaries with you.

title: wow!!!
review: Absolutely loved the Sandpearl!!  You can read all the positives from other reviews here (about the resort and the beach) -- they are all correct.  In addition to all those, a special "thank you" to the Sandpearl staff which went above and beyond to make our trip memorable.  Prior to our arrival, I indicated that our trip was needed for some very specific reasons and the Sandpearl not only put us in one of the best rooms, but also sent chocolate covered strawberries to our room.  This was very appreciated and made us realize just how special a place this is.  In fact, during the entire trip, the Sandpearl staff could not have been any nicer.    Cannot ask for a better location either -- steps away from 3 of the Frenchy's restaurants, including the Rockaway Grill right next door…

title: Top Notch-Unbelievable on all Accounts!
review: Dear Goohiostate,  We are pleased your stay with us was so memorable. Our staff really prides themselves on making sure our guests feel welcomed. We look forward to your return visit with lots of sunshine.

title: O M G
review: One of nicest hotels I've ever stayed at. Everything from the food, service, staff, and room was simply sensational!!

title: What a great hotel!
review: Dear luv2golfDenver,   We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay here with us at the Sandpearl Resort. We hope to see you again soon.

title: Champagne and Beach - Perfect
review: Might not be the cheapest hotel in the world, but definitely worth the money. We were greeted on check-in with a glass of champagne, so got off to a great start! Rooms are all new and spacious - even an ipod/iphone dock by the bed. The hotel restaurant Caretta is excellent and location is great - close (walking distance) to other bars and restaurants in Clearwater. Only downside was that we did not have a gulf view room - the hotel wasnt full, so they could have done so. However, we didnt ask to be moved and perhaps they would have moved us if we would have asked - but we were only staying for 2 nights so it wasnt a big issue. Pool is lovely - very warm and hot tubs are great. All situated right on the beach, so great views. One thing to note - there is a daily resort fee which…

title: Great vacation stay!
review: Dear kelly_f_81,   I am glad you enjoyed the resort and local area. Caretta on the Gulf, our signature restaurant, is a four diamond restaurant and has floor to ceiling windows which allow for great views of the gulf while dining.   Our resort fee includes a variety of amenities for our guest that include, wired and wireless internet access, twenty-four hour business center and fitness center, in-room coffee and bottled water, nightly shoe shine, unlimited local calls, pool and beach towels, and bicycle rental.

title: Best place in west florida
review: What a wonderful way to start out - champagne and a hot towel. Everyone working there was so polite and really welcoming. The room was a side-view over the pool with a good view of the beach too. Dinner excellent, brunch the next day superb. Absolutely recommend. Will be back. Wish we could live there!

title: EXCEEDED OUR HIGHEST EXPECTATIONS
review: Put simply this is the nicest resort my wife & I have ever stayed at. This includes resorts that cost quite a bit more. The entrance & lobby were beautiful. The staff extremely courteous & the valet service was great. (I personally would like to park my own car & I wish self parking were an option ...that may be my only beef, but we are probably the exception in that we are from middle class Midwestern families & not used to being spoiled by valet.)  The pool was huge & right next to a boardwalk (made of treks) on the beach. A great touch was the fire pit right on the sand with seating & food service available. In the evening it gave the grounds a great atmosphere especially considering there is also a lit up waterfall.  The building is a unique blend that is modern & open yet…

title: New Years 2011 @ the beach
review: Dear brianfromCincy,   We are thrilled you and your wife had such a wonderful time at the Sandpearl. This truly is a beautiful location and we appreciate your wonderful comments. The Sandpearl offers two options for parking, valet or off-site self parking. Now that the secret is out, Caladesi´s white sand beaches were rated America's Best Beach in 2008.

title: Everything wonderful, except sleep.
review: My husband and another couple drove from Orlando to this beautiful resort on New Year's eve 2011 for a relaxing and lowkey pampering weekend.  After years of hosting parties, we thought we would just enjoy being pampered this year.  The weather cooperated, and  although far from hot, it was pleasant enough to sit out by the pool and beach, and that is exactly what we did after experiencing a no fuss check in.  After a few drinks by the beautiful, heated pool overlooking the gulf of mexico we went to our very comfortable rooms and readied for the dinner at their restaurant.  Althought the ambiance and live music was great, the food fell short of my expectation for the "set menu".  I won't get into a full meal review, let's just say that it was ok, but our waitress was wonderful,…

title: New, relaxing, clean, comfortable, had courteous and friendly staff
review: Dear Isabel56,   Thank you for your positive reviews. It sounds like you and your husband started off the New Year wonderfully at the Sandpearl Resort. I am glad you were able to enjoy some time at our beautiful spa. Our Sunday brunch is from 11:30am-2:30pm and offers a larger selection of breakfast and lunch items, in comparison to our breakfast buffet that starts at 7am-11am. Happy New Year and we hope to see you again soon!

title: Beautiful resort, all the amenities, amazing views, truly spectacular
review: The Sandpearl is a great resort that I have visited 3 times now.  We most recently went for a 3 day getaway around New Year's.  As many have said, the location is excellent and you can walk to many restaurants.  We found the service to be top notch.  We had a gulf view room with a balcony, which was awesome.  We spent a lot of time in the evenings on the balcony.  The refrigerator was good for keeping some beer and wine in the room.  The only possible downsides that I can mention are that there are not enough chairs at the beach and/or the pool, so that can be an issue.  Most of the chairs near the pool were in the shade.  Also, I find that soundproofing between the rooms is a real issue at this hotel.  We had someone on one side that was a night owl and had roaring laughter…

title: AMAZING beyond words!!!!!!!
review: I had looked into a lot of hotels and read many reviews while booking our 1st family vacation.  I orginally booked through the Hilton, and lets just say I was very pleased with the decision I made!  The Hilton doesn't compare to the Sandpearl in the least....very run down and almost dirty looking.  One pool was closed and their pool area doesn't stand a chance in comparison to the Sandpearl. We arrived with a warm welcome and were swept away to a private check-in area with sparling juice for the kids and champagne for the adults.  We put our belongings in our room and couldn't wait to walk around and look at this stunning resort.  Everything here is in excellent condition ,and it looks as though it opened the day before we arrived.  The staff and grounds crew do an amazing job…

title: AMAZING resort in a beautiful location!!
review: Dear Hate2FlyMN,   We are so pleased you had such a wonderful time here at the Sandpearl Resort. I apologize that the weather was not as warm and sunny as you had hoped. Our pool is heated to 83 degrees but it can be quite chilly getting out, especially with the cold weather we have had! We look forward to seeing you again soon.

title: Beware of the cancellation policy
review: I booked two rooms at the Sandpearl to celebrate my birthday weekend with my parents and family. I couldn't have asked for a more perfect resort for my celebration! Everything about our stay was top notch - from the minute we walked into the gorgeous front lobby, until we checked out. The check-in process was very personalized, and we felt SO welcomed with the champagne and individual attention.   We had a Jr Suite in a corner overlooking the Gulf. Even the walk in shower and garden tub in our bathroom had a view out to the beach and the Gulf. The bed was very comfortable with a great assortment of pillows. The living room with a sofa bed gave us enough room to have my nephew stay with us. (He HAD to stay when he saw the amazing view of the Gulf of Mexico from our balcony). My…

title: Amazing Mini Honeymoon
review: Dear EvieDMn,   Thank you very much for a fantastic review of our resort. We are so glad that you had such a wonderful time here and were able to create lasting memories with your family.

title: Absolutely amazing
review: We had a trip planned to Clearwater to visit family, but had to cancel two + days before the trip. I was unaware, or perhaps had forgotten, that this hotel has a 72 hour cancellation policy. I gave them over 48 hrs notice, but they still charged me $235. Note that the ratings of cleanliness, service, location, rooms and sleep quality were based on a stay at this hotel last year.

title: Overrated. Surprisingly mediocre service for a "resort"
review: I pulled in to the SandPearl about 2 pm on a Friday afternoon - prime check in time. I had to wait over 5 minutes in my car to get even get to the door for valet service. When I got to where I could unload my bags, I had all six of them out of the trunk and my family ready to go before a valet even greeted us. We took our own bags inside and found a counter that looked like check-in but were directed to another room to check in. There was only ONE person doing check-ins - remember, this is 2 pm on a Friday. I finally went back to the first desk where there were now two people standing around and said "you have got to be kidding me, only ONE person checking people in? And you call this a resort?" They offered me some excuses and a glass of champagne but they had already blown a…

title: Fantastic Resort!
review: Dear RenoBret,   I apologize for the first impression you received of our resort and for your delay at valet and at check in. We actually have two areas for our Guest Services, our VIP reception room and the front desk. At the Sandpearl, all our guests are important, for our afternoon and evening arrivals we direct our guests to our VIP reception room for Champaign and apple cider. This allows our guest the opportunity to relax and learn about our resort and the amenities we have to offer. In reference to the room size, our traditional guest rooms are a standard 400 square feet. We also have junior suites and one and two bedroom suites ranging from 500 to 1685 square feet. Again, on behalf of the resort, I apologize that your first impression was not a favorable one.

title: Super Sandpearl
review: My wife and I celebrated our 10th Anniversary here and it could not have been better. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like VIP's. Anything we needed, just ask. The entire staff went out of their way to make you feel welcome and appreciated. Champagne and a cool towel at check-in, Complimentary chocolate cake at dinner for anniversary (amazing), turn down service, etc......We left the resort only one time for dinner (mistake), the food here is fantastic. The most impressive to us was the fact that the waiters and bartenders remembered our names from 1 night to the next. They really seemed more like friends than servers. Last but not least, the sunsets are breath taking. Standing on the powdered sugar beach, smelling the salt water and feeling the tropical breeze,…

title: Words cannot express...
review: Dear Condor36,   We are so pleased you and your wife had such a wonderful time on your tenth wedding anniversary here at the Sandpearl Resort. Our staff takes great pride in getting to know our guest and we are thrilled we were able to help create some wonderful memories. We look forward to visit with us next year for your eleventh wedding anniversary.

title: Paradise
review: This hotel is The Daddy ! Right on the beach, pool is lovely, staff very helpful and polite.The best sunsets ever ! We had a Gulf view suite, worth the extra..view amazing. Do not stop here if you are on a budget, stop here if you want luxury ! The sand is like flour ! weather was sunny and clear, saw Dolphins once in the sea ! Dennis at the poolside bar could not do enough for us.I know they work on tips, but he would go out of his way to get you a cold drink, just when you needed one.Had breakfast over the road at Clear sky, best pancakes..better that I Hop and only $5, .Did 2 weeks at Disney...shattered...then 5 days to recover here. After nearly three weeks, we still did not wan't to come home ! And if you going soon...Morgan Freeman is staying there ! There for another…

title: Heaven on the Gulf Coast
review: Spent 7 days at the Sandpearl Resort for business and pleasure last week of October. My International trade assocition (IAHTM) held our annual conference there.  Could not have asked for a better venue. I have stayed at many top hotels in the U.S. and Canada but this one topped them all.  Begining with the unique check-in, the service was impeccable. The facility was everything it advertises and then some.  Can't say enough about how courtious and cooperative staff the staff was. This included making last minute arrangements for a wedding ceremony held on the beach by one of my colleagues.  The location also has some of the most beautiful sunsets you'l ever see  The Sandpearl is Heaven on the Gulf Coast!!!

title: Great Hotel
review: We stayed there last Xmas and are going back this year. The Sandpearl is a hidden gem. The hotel is beautiful and in a great location. The rooms are spotless. The beds and pillows are comfortable. The pool area is clean and very relaxing. The food and drinks buy the pool are above average. The restaurants in the area are fantastic. Cooters down the street has all the crab you can eat on Tuesdays. Frenchy's across the street has a great grouper sandwich. Clearsky cafe has a really good breakfast. The hotel has a Starbucks  for your morning cup of coffee.The hotels restaurant is beautiful but rather expensive really good food. Large T.V in the bar area. The beach has beautiful white sand  great for a morning walk. Walk out to the pier great for sunrise or sunset.Try the Segway…

title: Absolutely Amazing On All Accounts
review: Upon arrival we were met with a glass of champagne.  We had requested a room with an ocean view but upon checking in they asked if we'd like a (free) upgrade.  Of course we accepted.  Once the check in process was completed we thought they'd send us upstairs to our room, but instead they led us to the honeymoon suite, which wasn't even a suite at all, but it's own building entirely!  It was absolutely amazing.  They gained points in my book for the upgrade, alone.  The hotel was clean and in wonderful condition.  The staff was extremely helpful.  The location can't be beat.   I highly recommend The Sandpearl for a stay in Clearwater.

title: The best of the best
review: On a scale of one to ten..This place is a 10,000..  There is no better place in all of Florida to stay especially on the west coast.  I don't even know what to compare it to in the Clearwater area.  The Sand Pearl is in a class all by itself with all other resorts  just wishing they could compare..Stay here one time  and your hooked for life!!

title: the best at clearwater beach
review: We have stayed here several times and have never been disappointed.   Very friendly staff,  large, clean, comfortable rooms ,nice balcony, large bathroom with very clean soaking tub. Great pool area, very relaxing .  Little pricey but to us worth every penny.  Can't wait to stay again!!

title: Wonderful resort
review: Stayed here for a week at the end of Sept, absolutely wonderful all round. On arrival the check-in experience was so welcoming VIP check-in area which was accompanied by a glass of champagne and a very informed overview of the resort and locality.  The room was very comfortable, with a great balcony overlooking the pool and beach. One minor point - the shower is over the bath, for a 5* hotel would expect a seperate shower. Otherwise the room was very good.  The main areas of the hotel and the pool area were fabulous. The staff who manned the desk where you collected towels didn't seem very happy - hard to raise an acknowledgment and smile from them however the staff at the pool restaurant and drinks service were very attentive and pleasant. We dined at the pool rstaurant for…

title: Beautiful hotel and great resort except our balcony faced onto air conditioning and furnace
review: 1st the good points - Suites are beautiful.  great space. completely equipt.  Very clean and well serviced.  great location, top end of the beach so you can walk for miles away from the crowds at the other end of the beach near pier 60. Pool area was comfortable and loads of beds to be had.  Pool itself was also quite nice.  Can get busy with kids though. Restaurant on the beach served lovely food.  Nice to eat while feet are buried in the soft sand. Now for the bad stuff.  I found the pillows very hard.  So hard my ears hurt when sleeping on my side.  You get a load of pillows on the bed.  Tried them all and my head still hurt the following morn.   Our partial sea view was there and that was lovelly, however, looking down from our 7th floor was massive air con unit buzzing all…

title: Wonderful, relaxing hotel directly on the beautiful, white sand beach.
review: I attended a conference in this hotel.  The service was amazing.  I especially liked the glass of champagne everyone in my party was offered when we arrived.  They let us check in early, which was great since we didn't have anywhere to go for 4 hours.  There was a resort fee, but it included your basic internet and 2 bottles of water a day, among other things.  We were told we would get a "bay view" room when we made the reservation, but we were pleasantly surprised when we opened our door and saw that we had a great view of their georgeous pool, the white sand beach, and the gulf beyond.  The beds were very comfortable and the room had a flat screen HDTV.  We especially liked the turn down service and chocolates on our bed with the "Pearls" of wisdom.  We didn't rent a car, so…

title: An excellent luxury hotel perfect for honeymoon
review: We are from the UK mid to late 30's, We have family in the clearwater and new port richey area. And wanted to combine our honeymoon stay with 4 nights at a luxury hotel. The sandpearl is situated on mandalay avenue and is ideally located by frenchys rockaway grill and some music bars and restaurants across from the hotel. The magnificent lobby and internal look of this hotel cries out luxury and opulence. The outdoor swimming pool and jacuzzi area is outstanding ! and the view of the Gulf of mexico is stunning. You must insist on having a full gulf view facing room(pay the extra!)  Yes the hotel is slightly more expensive than its contempories but worth it . with bar bills and restaurant bills(cost was £1,000 for 4 nights ) Carretas their restaurant wit its oewn ceviche sushi…

title: Beautiful, elegant, peaceful, relaxing!
review: Cannot say enough about this resort. It was the best vacation we've had in years. My husband, who is very fussy, is asking me when we are going back! That in itself is a great big vote! The resort is elegant. It is right on a beautiful stretch of beach. Great restaurants are within strolling distance. Can't wait to go back!

title: Wish we could have stayed longer!
review: A beautiful and outstanding hotel. The beach is beautiful and has a lovely log fire and chairs on the beach to watch the sun set! Nothing to complain at!  Great restaunts withing walking distance, good shops and lots to do!! I would stay here again and again!  We stayed for 2 nights whilst on honeymoon! We went to Busch Gardens and Adventure Island waterpark whilst here and would recomend both!   Our room had a sea view.  The only thing I didnt like were the amount of dragon flies around the balconies, i didnt want to sit on the balcony becuase of this.  But had the most softest squidgest bed!  But that didnt upset the stay, the only thing i got upset at was LEAVING!! i didnt want too!!  I can't wait to come back and stay!  STAY here if you go to clearwater, spend that little…

title: Phenomenal paradise-- second to none
review: Just came back from a 4 day vacation in a Caladesi suite at the Sandpearl with a 2 year old and 4 year old. What can I say....it was perfect. The pool and whirlpool were beautiful and immaculate, the beach is right there and just incredible, big fluffy beach towels provided, great service, beautiful lobby,wonderful suite with washer, dryer, everything you need. Tons of awesome restaurants nearby, ate at the Clearsky beachside cafe two mornings for breakfast which was wonderful, the palm pavilion for lunch, Frenchy's for a dinner, got to see fireworks off the pier, close to pier 60 and all attractions. Nothing but convenient. Almost hesitated to write a review because I want to keep this place all to myself for the future! Kudos!  They do need to upgrade their business center--…

title: Gorgeous Hotel with beautiful amenities
review: The hotel is brand new and finely appointed.  The service was great, and hotel staff friendly.  Location is wonderful on a large stretch of sugar white beach.  Walking distance to restaurants and bars.  Spa was also very nice...small, but adequate.

title: Wow!!!!! Newest and Nicest in Clearwater
review: I stayed at the Sandpearl for a conference in the Clearwater Beach area. I was there with my wife and 2 children (ages 10 and 12). All I can say is that it was BY FAR the nicest hotel in the area. It's new, so the rooms are larger than most of the other hotels. The ammenities are fantastic and the service was excellent! I plan to stay only at the Sandpearl when I go to Clearwater Beach.

title: WOW - A taste of Paradise.
review: We took a two night break out of our typical orlando holiday & This hotel was amazing. Book a room facing the Gulf coast & your breath will be taken away everytime you look at the view.  Hotel Spotless, Service impeccable, we had a 2 bedroom suite that was just perfect. Restuarants very good, breakfast pancakes were the best i've ever tasted. Swimming pool is lovely & the beach is fabulous. Rented jet skis for 60 bucks an hour (on the beach, not hotels) & the dolphins rode up to us & sprayed us. Truly fantastic. Spa enjoyable.  If you really want to spoil yourselves & be pampered then book the Sandpearl it really is a lovely hotel especially if you enjoy the finer things of life without the snobbery of it all & family friendly. Our 3 teenage Kids loved it & so did we a wonderful…

title: Great wedding reception venue
review: As the title states this is the hotel we chose for our wedding reception and wedding night. The Sandpearl has a feeling of casual elegance that my wife said reminded her of the Mandarin Oriental hotels. The hotel receiption is very attentive and friendly. Bellmen and valets are available to help with your car and luggagge. One negative is that there is no self parking and you have to use their valet parking. During check in you are offered a glass of champagne to start your vacation. The rooms are large and clean with great toiletries. The color of the resort is a nice butter yellow that adds to the warm calming feeling. All of the usual perks such as an iPod clock radio and flat panel TV are also present. Oh, and buy they way if you have a view room there is the Gulf and beach…

title: I can only say Fantastic
review: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and it was worth every penny.  Great staff, amazing location and wonderful views.  Would definately stay here again.  Didn't eat in the 'proper' restaurant although we would thoroughly recommend both the hotel's Tate Island Grill the and the Clear Sky Diner just across the road.  Both offered great food (loved the Grouper Sandwiches and the Burgers) and were reasonably priced.    Some people have mentioned the lack of privacy on the balconies, but unless you plan on a bit of nude sunbathing its not an issue.  We spent plenty of time sat on ours without feeling overlooked or uncomfortable!  All in all, if you want a bit of luxury this is the place for you.  It may not be as cheap as some of the other hotels, but I guarantee you won't…

title: A must stay in Clearwater Beach
review: From the moment you arrive you just feel it. This resort gets it and as such you get service levels and product second to none in the area. Food is phenomenal and amenities abound. Great beach with a fire pit for that special end of day glass of wine. Worth every penny and hope to return soon.

title: Nice Resort on Gulf Coast
review: Just got back from a quick weekend stay at the Sandpearl Resort--my husband had a business trip and I tagged along.  It was a really lovely place to stay--we had a balcony room overlooking the ocean (definitely worth paying extra for an ocean view).  The room was very clean, the bed wonderfully comfortable, great having a mini frig, and a nice sized working desk.  The room itself was spacious as was the bathroom.  The deck was a real treat, and we enjoyed relaxing out there with a glass of wine enjoying the view.  The lobby was attractive and the pool area was lovely (landscaped very nice) with plenty of cushioned lounge chairs.  Right outside the pool area was the beach, so you had your choice to hang out by the ocean or the pool.  The waiter service out in both areas was a…

title: American Express.....Don't Leave Home Without It
review: Some of you may be too young to remember the Karl Malden American Express TV commercials, but I'm sure AE had resorts like the Sandpearl in mind. Parking, mandatory valet no choice $16.00 per day....resort fee no choice $15.00 per day for daily USA today and St Pete times on the weekend, daily bottled water, internet access, beach towels and gym. With all the fees and expensive pool side drinks there is one other thing I would like to  say about the Sandpearl. WE CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!!!!  Service is beyond excellent. Need to heat up a leftover from dinner at 2am stored in your in room fridge, but no microwave....darn! Call room service and someone will be up to your room in minutes to take your dish down to the kitchen re-heat your item and return to you...no fee. The…

title: Best in the area but expensive
review: Clearly a very fine hotel, the best in Clearwater beach.   Great staff.  Excellent beach and pool area.  Very expensive but you decide if it is worth it.  The one thing that did crack me up was the mandatory $15 per day "resort fee".  For that you got COMPLIMENTARY water (2 bottles/day), a newspaper (St. Petersburg Times - arrrrgh), internet access, and bathrobes.   So much for complimentary - I guess they though we wouldn't figure that one out - hummmm.

title: This is what a luxury Resort should be!
review: If you want a luxury Resort and a great location, then this one is for you. From the minute you walk in, you are surrounded by a friendly and helpful staff and luxury decor all aroun. The rooms are fabulous especially one of the suite's (well worth the upgrade to ocean front) the restaurant is first class and 5 star. The oceanfront bar with a beach fire pit is a nice end to a great day! Who wouldn't want to sit by a beautiful fire pit and listen to the waves and smell the ocean air. This is the most romantic resort I have found in Florida. You will be glad you booked this one!

title: Very Nice West Florida Resort.
review: I recently stayed at the Sandpearl for a 6 day vacation with my family.  I've enjoyed many Florida resorts in the past, including the Marriott at Marco Island and (formerly) Luxury Collection (now Marriott) Resort at Signer Island.  The Sandpearl is a welcomed option on the West Coast.  Not a large resort like the Marco Marriott, but nicer beach and immediate area than the East Coast Resort at Signer Island.   Overall my wife and I were pleased with the Sandpearl and plan on visiting again.

title: Ready for 5th star. This is the BEST
review: We just stayed at the Sandpearl  for 4 nights. The experience was from start to finish a great one.: Arrival: Construction at the entrance, didn't interfere with excellent and courteous valet service Checked in at noon and had no problem getting in our room. Although it was off season and hotel was fairly empty, I have rarely experienced an early check in at any level of hotel.   Room: Went for Gulf front, worth EVERY penny, I was not bothered by what others have complained about, the lack of balcony privacy. (What the hell would they have done out there if they had privacy anyway??) Room super spacious, spotless, fluffy abundance of towels, quality toiletries. Great wet bar/coffee station, nice HD TV, tons of pillows, 2 bottles complimentary Dasani water daily ( good luck…

title: A truely hidden gem of highest caliber!
review: We had the 1 Bdrm Suite with 2 balconies on the seventh floor. Amazing sunsets over the white sand beach! Amazing room with granite in the kitchen and bathroom. Exceptional and expedient staff. We loved the frozen grapes they served poolside! The breakfasts and dinners we had at “Caretta on the Gulf” were without fault at the 5 star level! The only issue we had in the 5 day stay:  the grilled Tuna was cold when served for lunch at “Tate Island Grill” by the pool.  Aside from this minor issue, we loved our time there and will always remember Clearwater Beach with fond memories.

title: Fantastic resort with wonderful staff
review: From check-in to check-out in this lovely resort hotel, the staff were incredibly courteous and helpful. Sandpearl sits on a great beach and provides very comfortable sun- loungers on the beach as well as around the pool. Rooms are very well appointed with great beds and pillows for a good sleep. Only ate at Tates Grill but the hotel has a well-recommended fine dining restaurant. We ate out in the evening and took breakfast at the Clear Sky Beach Cafe, next door, great food and great value.

title: Exceptional in every area
review: This was my first stay at the Sandpearl Resort and the first hotel that I've ever felt the need to write a review for.   Within seconds of our arrival, my wife had a glass of champagne in her hand and we were sat down to check into our room at a very pleasant and comfortable check in area. First impressions were that it was a very well maintained and beautiful resort.   The room was spacious, spotlessly clean with a stunning view of the pool, beach and gulf of Mexico. We had a small balcony which was perfect for watching the spectacular sunsets.   Almost without exception, every member of staff we dealt with was friendly, helpful and seemed keen to ensure that we had a memorable stay. I can't speak highly enough of the staff.  The pool / beach areas were great with some lovely…

title: Great location, great hotel, shame about the extra charges!
review: We stayed at the Sandpearl from 9th - 16th August 2010 for the third week of our honeymoon. We were originally booked in at the Longboat Key in Sarasota but due to maintenance work during our stay, we decided to move to the Sandpearl. After visiting Longboat key we were glad we picked Clearwater as the beach was alot nicer there. The hotel is situated on a lovely part of Clearwater beach, to the North. The white sand was often deserted and gave a prime view of sunset each evening. Upon arrival we decided to ask how much an upgrade would be and after looking at both a Junior Suite and a normal gulf view suite, decided to pay the $500 to upgrade. I was quite persistent about having a room on the north side as the hotel jutted out nearer the ocean on this end. Our junior suite with…

title: great location, excellent staff cracking beach, but the pool is too small
review: this hotel is not 5 star, but it comes close, lovely setting excellent staff, and the food is excellent. Where it lets itself down is in a pool area over populated, crammed with sun loungers and which gets noisy in the peak season. If your staying try and get a few facing the sea not the side of the hotel with extractor fans below, makes the balcony redundant due to the noise. The bar staff are great in the main hotel bar, and the overall service very strong. If your going for a walk on the beach turn right when you come out the hotel away from the town its gorgeous quite and uncrowded.  bar/ Restaraunt frenchies with live music in the evening and pool tables kept our teenagers and us amused its right beside the hotel, ryans was very good for atmosphere service and the food, as…

title: fabulous hotel, fabulous staff
review: Stayed at Sandpearl Hotel, Clearwater, absolutely beautiful hotel on the beach.  Valet parking and resort fees $30 dollars a day, outrageous and compulsory!  Hotel fab, hotel meticulously clean,  staff were delightful particularly Dennis the bartender.  Kids loved it pool open til 10 p.m., room quite small but all we could afford!  Would definitely recommend for families but not for couples as too many kids! Restaurant fantastic but quite expensive.

title: Classy, relaxing, and in a perfect location
review: My partner and I stayed at the Sandpearl for a little getaway weekend this month, and it was quite the experience. Location-wise, it occupies prime beach-front real estate about 500 yards from Pier 60 and the cluster of restaurants in the area. The front desk, concierge, and valet staff is first-rate professional, offering champagne at check-in and all of the other first-class pampering one would expect of a hotel in this class. Lobby is airy and artful, and overlooks both the pool and beach beyond. We had a king-bed, Gulf front room on the 4th floor, which included a balcony with room for two chairs and a small table - perfect for watching the sunset! Room was furnished nicely with dark wood, flat-screen TV, chaise lounge, and bed (i thought the mattress was a bit on the soft…

title: Rude Spa Staff
review: While staying at the Sandpearl Resort for the July 4th weekend I was spoken to very rudely by one the spa staff members. I was extremely dissatisfied by the spa receptionist's tone while my wife was making a purchase in the salon. The spa receptionist was very unprofessional and condescending. I strongly believe there is a right way to talk to people and she must have missed that part of training. I immediately reported the incident to management whom did not even offer an apology. To me, it felt as though the manager didn't care and seemed to dismiss the problem. This unacceptable customer service really ruined what I had hoped to be a nice weekend.

title: The Sandpearl provided us with a fabulous, restful vacation.
review: The Sandpearl is everything I could ask for in a resort hotel: Clean, friendly and helpful staff, beautiful view, posh room, great pool and walk out to the beach.  The restaurants were a bit expensive, but the quality of the food was worth it.  I would have like to have seen more vegetarian options.   There was a mix-up with an activity we had planned through the hotel and the staff more than made up for the mix-up, so much so that I feel embarrassed about all they gave us to amend for their mistake.  Only one drawback:  The frozen drinks at the pool weren't really all that well made.  My favorite spot was the fire pit in the sand.  I'm ready to go back.

title: This is a great place to stay on the beach!
review: The Sandpearl Resort is a great place to stay on Clearater Beach.  The rooms were a little small and the balcony was tiny.  However, the room was spotless and had all the amenities that we needed.  Our room was very quiet and the bed was comfortable.  The pool is AWESOME!  Chairs were comfy and have nice shades attached to them.  I still think about the frozon grapes and lavender scented frozen face clothes they bring around.  If you are looking for a place within walking distance to Pier 60 and the restaurants this is the place to stay.  Not too much in the way of good shopping on the beach.  But, restaurants are very good.  Sunset Sushi at the Sandpearl was delicious and a great deal!  Definitely would stay here again!

title: Gorgeous  but had some issues
review: First, this place is wonderful!  We can't wait to go back.  However, we did have some issues that if didn't have the vacation would have been perfect.  First and my biggest complaint.  Check in is after 4:00.  Ok, we got there at 3:52 - you'd think no big deal.  Well, we were given our key at 5:35 and then only because I agreed to put away the dishes that had just been started in the dishwasher.  They did suggest we go eat dinner and it would be ready when we got back.  We were 10 hours from home.  After being in the car all day, we wanted to clean up and relax.  Second, for little kids - - there wasn't much they could watch on tv.  When you came in at night, or while it was raining it would have been nice to have something for my 5 years old to watch.  Sure, you could buy…

title: Great stay- love to come back.
review: After reading all of the reviews, wasn't sure what to expect. This hotel is great. I travel all over the world staying in 4-5 star hotels, and this place is excellent. The service is excellent, the rooms are very nice, although the patios on the bay side are very small. We loved the pool and beach- renting a cabana was easy and very cool- especially when it rained, which happens almost every day. The servers around the pool were great. The hotel restaurant was very nice, but the food wasn't great for the price- lobster was overcooked and rubbery, the halibut was dry and no flavor. Tates bar and grill at the pool had great food and excellent service. We loved Frenchies next door for lunch and casual dinner, we loved Bobby's Bistro behind Beachcomber's for a great dinner.…

title: Beautiful, convenient hotel
review: Beautiful hotel from the artwork to the pool area to the beach. Comfortable, large room (We had a 5th floor gulf view and it was spectacular!). Great bath items. Beach is wonderful white soft sand. You may use hotel beach chairs (umbrellas are for rent) in area nearest hotel or go on down (large beach) to public areas. Within easy walking distance to pier and many restaurants and shops. Pier has arts and craft booths from about 6:30pm to 10:30 pm. Check them out - lots of fun! Clear Sky Cafe right next door has good food and very reasonable prices-breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Brown Boxer restaurant across the street has good food and is casual with live music and sports bar feel but are quieter areas as well. Marina is near pier with many boat excursions. Kai-Lani has nice…

title: GREAT HOTEL RIGHT ON THE BEACH,AND THE MOST EXPENSIVE !!
review: Its nice the staff are very friendly , very nice touch checking in, they take you to a private room with a glass of champagne , the front entrance is strange you have to drive up the ramp and do a U-turn, and no automatic doors to enter the main building, would look much more charming and inviting if they had glass doors so you could see how beautiful it is inside, rooms are excellent , nice balcony, although ours had a view of the dining room roof air conditioners , not as promised  a gulf view, the AAA  four diamond CARETTA  restaurant  was way over priced, the service was really slow , and the food just OK , however the sunday brunch is much better value , the pool is nice with a beach type shallow end for children, ,at $250 a night makes it  by far the most expensive hotel…

title: Heaven on Earth
review: My daughter and I had the pleasure of staying at the Sandpearl for two nights.  The staff were amazingly helpful, especially Michael at the front desk, and Dennis by the pool.  There was no cream in the room for coffee.  I called about it and it was there within a few minutes.  Any thing that I needed handled was handled quickly and efficiently.  I have never slept better in a hotel than I did here.  We are going back in a few days over the 4th of July weekend.  I've made several calls to the Sandpearl in planning our upcoming trip back.  The staff have been so helpful.  Once again Michael has gone above and beyond to help me with my trip details.  Kathryn the hotel ambassador was been a wealth of information and a big help also.  I continue to be impressed by the desire of the…

title: Nothing special!
review: Its a nice place, but when you encounter staff thats condescending and fake, is it really worth your hard earned dollars?  The pool is average sized and tends to get crowded.  The beach access is nice and they offer activities.  The bed and pillows were comfortable and  room service was nice.  The front desk area / reception and restaurant help - not so nice!  Its like you're bothering them.  I won't stay here again.  Another thing worth noting - check out is at 11 am and late checkout is 12.

title: Piece of Paradise
review: We received such great service before we even got to the hotel.  Check in was even nice learning about all the resort had to offer and greeted with champaign for the adults and sparkling apple juice for the kids.  We took advantage of the spa with an excellent massage.  Carrettas, their fine dining, was everything you could hope for from the sushi being outstanding to the filet and salmon.  The beaches here are gorgeous and there is absolutley NO OIL in sight.  This was great with or without kids.  There is the beach, lots of shops near by, crafts at the pier, ping pong, big checkers, yoga, etc.  Memories were made to last a life time especially while we sat by the fire pit at night time in the big chairs.

title: Spectacular resort, our top choice for any beach vacation!
review: Highly recommend the one-bedroom suite, we stayed for a week and were in heaven.  Loved the kitchen and washer/dryer, and the 2 balconies looking at both the beach and the bay. The service is the best in any hotel we've seen, and the resort facilities were great - huge pool right by a fabulous power soft sand in the adjacent beach with weekend water sports, 2 great restaurants so bathing suit dining during the day and fine dining at night or 24 hr room service, live music on weekends, smore's and a fire pit.  The location is perfect, stores and restaurants walking distance. Walk down the beach to Pier 60, and dolphins swim right up near the pier!  It was our 2nd trip, this time longer, and we still hated to leave.

title: Upscale and reasonably priced on the beach
review: Went to the Sandpearl for a quick 4 day getaway as a couple.  The rooms are really nicely appointed and soundproof; very important to us for a relaxing getaway.  All of the staff was nice with a lot of attention to detail without being "stuffy".  We felt welcome and that the staff appreciated that we were there.  Loved the piano "player" who was always playing in the Lobby. Stayed in a gulf-view room with a nice balcony; definitely recommend it even with the slightly higher cost due to the fabulous views, especially with the sunsets.  This was our first trip to Clearwater Beach since we usually head to the Caribbean for the beaches.  This beach was fabulous.  Huge; gorgeous white, soft sand.  We took LONG walks along the beach twice a day and never ran out of walking space.  We…

title: Had the best time in a local area!
review: While staying here I experienced excellent serivce.  From check-in to room service and everything in between.  All the employees are very friendly and welcoming.  The set-up of the resort is amazing and easy access to the beach with a private clean pool area.  The sunsets and sand on Clearwater beach are breath taking.  Everything is so clean and beautiful.

title: Luxurious
review: The staff were always very attentive and very professional. Should definitely be rated five stars as the service, cleanliness, beautiful rooms equipped with HDTV and balcony with sea views(for extra charge).  We had a free upgrade with views of inland and the sea. Champagne at reception was lovely and the staff were very welcoming. Location is perfect right on the beach and within walking distance from a bars, shops and restaurants. Drinks are overly expensive at the Beach Bar and Food at the Beach Bar would not be recommended after all the complaints they i had when i was there.  This hotel like many other hotels have a resort fee of $15 per night and they only have valet parking which charges $16 per night. The place is out of this world and can't wait to go back again in the…

title: Service Needs Improvement
review: In general, during our entire stay at the SandPearl Resort we felt a sense of disinterest on the part of staff in making guests feel welcome. Most staff members we encountered gave the impression that they were not happy to serve guests and continuously provided minimal effort. The SandPearl Resort promotes itself as an upscale resort and spa and the hotel facilities and its decor and environment certainly match that description. However, if the Sand Pearl expects to compete with the likes of The Ritz Carlton, for example, it is extremely important that all staff members receive additional, extensive guest services training and management should make service the utmost priority.

title: Again, another great visit!
review: We stayed at the Sandpearl over Mother's Day Weekend. We are Tampa locals and just love the short half hour drive to the beautiful beaches of Clearwater. The hotel was very busy with weddings and locals. Once again, they did a great job- service was seamless, restaurants were great. The beach was packed and there were alot of non-guests trying to use their pool. But they had hotel guests wear wristbands to identify themselves and outside 'pool crashers' were evicted. Some guests complained but we didn't mind. This made for an enjoyable time as there was enough space at the pool to accomodate all of the guests. They also don't allow 'chair saving' that happens at other hotels with pools. The frozen drinks were great.  We had Brunch in the restaurant- it was busy but the service…

title: Amazing!
review: We stayed here for the 2nd week of our honeymoon and chose the hotel because it seemed luxurious, and because of its location. The website and brochures don't do this hotel justice, it is beautiful! The scenery is gorgeous, the hotel itself is immaculate and the staff are very attentive without being overbearing. This is by far the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in and I would not hesitate to go back, I would just like a little more disposable cash next time!! The hotel is expensive, especially for drinks, although we discovered that drinks in the Caretta restaurant are substantially cheaper than at the Tate Island beach bar (both part of hotel). Sadly we didn't discover this until our last night! On the subject of Caretta, I highly recommend eating there at least once, the…

title: check room allocation!
review: enjoyed this hotels position and general level of service, restaurant Caretta on the Gulf was lovely with brilliant view of sunset while dining and friendly staff. The most irritating service was from the Tate Island Grill at beach when even just for drinks you could sit for some time whilst staff folded napkins inside despite having spotted you waiting.  One major drawback was the allocation of side gulf view room (via british airways holiday booking) we had room 411 - 4th floor which indeed did give us a side gulf view but balcony overlooked air conditioning/venting units for hotel property below and the noise/smell from same precluded sitting out at all.  Our friends had one further up corridor which missed this but overlooked trash bins, so would advise bookers to check…

title: Sandpearl Carretta horrible service‎
review: My family ate at the Carretta restaurant at the Sandpearl Resort on Clearwater Beach.  The food was mediocre for the price, but the service was unprofessional.  When we asked to sit at one of the empty tables in front of the windows overlooking the beach, we were told, "they are reserved".  No one sat at any of these tables while we dined.  Later research reveals that there is no reserving of window tables.

title: Best vacation ever
review: We went to Sandpearl last year using our credit card points and were not sure what to expect. I actually made my decision based on the reviews. It was totally worth it. Best beach and best of everything was the service. From the front desk to the housekeeping everyone was so helpful. Definetely will go back. NO COMPLAINTS

title: This place is a well oiled hospitality machine!!
review: We arrived to a BEAUTIFUL hotel and doormen to help with baggage. At check in we were greeted with chilled champagne and cold water for the kids. The rep. was courteous and informative. Every aspect of this hotel is beautiful from the lobby to the views while wating for the elevator! Our 2 bedroom suite was phenominal! The kitchen was clean and stocked with all the utensils we might need. Housekeeping offers impeccable SERVICE!  We were traveling with small kids ages 3 and 2 and to not have to worry about cleaning up their every little oopsie was vacation enough!  This hotel made our stay a no think process, every staff member was very hospitable and ready to assist.  I WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK!  For that reason I did not take alot of pictures of the property because we will be…

title: Nice dinner
review: Setting was more impressive than the menu, but still a great evening in a beautiful setting.  Food was somewhat rich and heavy for our tastes.  Walked around afterward and just took it all in, gorgeous place.

title: Luxury Unlimited
review: Stayed for several days first week in May. What's hot? The pool area was our favorite spot. Service was excellent and amenities plenty. Tate's restaurant on-the-beach was to die for. Beautiful sunsets, reasonable priced food, superb service, laid back atmosphere; - just perfect. The formal restaurant and bar also to die for. Location location location...fabulous. What's not? Lots of extra fees like taxes, resort fees, and valet service fees just make sure you know what the full price will be. Not too much high end shopping near by.    I would recommend to anyone over the Hyatt or any other close by resorts! We'll do it again in a minute.

title: BEAUTIFUL Place....HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!
review: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Sandpearl. It was FANTASTIC!!!! Right from the moment you get there you are pampered. We stayed in a king gulf view room. It was clean, spacious and not so bad views either. The bed was soooo comfy! The room was cleaned daily, plenty of towels and stuff. We ate at the pool side restaurant, delicious..love the home made chips. The drinks by the pool and beach are the best. We also at at Carretta's...FABULOUS meal!!! worth every penny!!! We went to the spa for as couples massage....huge thumbs up!! I can not say enough about how we loved it here. Don't listen to the bad reviews!!! They must be super super picky people because there were NO issues here!!! We came home relaxed and refreshed. We are looking forward to going back again soon!!!!…

title: Spectacular Sparkling New Beach Resort
review: I stayed at this resort over spring break, and was truly stunned by the beauty of the place. We were met at the front door by an attendant that brought us warm hand towels. Then, a lady on staff offered us complimentary champagne, and sparkling cider for the youngsters. The Check-In was easy and quick, and we greatly enjoyed our stay. Our room had water views over the Clearwater harbor which was very pleasant.
