The room was also beautifully decorated, and had a kitchen and living room, complete with a dishwasher, washer/drier, and dishes. Everything was sparkling new and clean. Outside on the hotel grounds, there is a beautiful pool, and then the private beach. WOW! It was gorgeous! There was also a ping-pong table, and deck games near the beach, along with a nice little lawn for…

title: Prompt and exceptional service. Luxurious, relaxed eco-friendly environment.
review: Booked our stay through hotels.com, on which we had requested a king bed and then found out, upon arrival, that the description of the room was incorrect. Once notified of the mistake, the front desk not only corrected the bed, they moved us to a Gulf-front room. Would recommend spending the extra money to stay in Gulf front accomodations. The views are amazing and the balcony was perfect in the evenings. Rented an umbrella on the beach and had fast, friendly food and beverage service all day. The perfect escape.

title: The Best Vacation Ever!!!
review: I just came back from the most wondeful  vacation I have ever had.  The Sandpearl is the place to go if you are looking for relaxation and beautiful scenery.  I upgraded my room to gulf front view which was well worth the price.  The location of the hotel would by far make it the best place to stay in clearwater.  We walked up to the Hyatt that was a few blocks up the street and that was a disaster area.  The Sandpearl is far enough down so that people that are visiting the beach are not going to be right in front of the hotel and it seems that most of the partying crowds stay up towards the Hyatt end of the beach.  All the employees at the hotel were wonderful and helpful and the pool is incredible. The only thing I didnt like was that it closed at 10pm.  Considering there is…

title: Beautiful hotel, beautiful setting, few blips
review: My husband and two children (ages 4 and 18 months) stayed in a deluxe gulf-front 1BR suite. It was a corner suite, and wa quite large, about the size of a well-appointed apartment. There was plenty of room for the pullout bed and full-sized crib in the living room, with space to spare for a play area (and that doesn't include the dining space).   We had a fantastic view - gulf front rooms have more balcony privacy, since that part of the hotel juts forward more than the other areas (i.e., compared to gulf view rooms).  If you've researched the hotel, you know about the resort fee, valet costs, etc.  The front desk was awesome...the check in associate even gave our daughter a faux pearl necklace to welcome her (smile).  My husband and I had dinner at Caretta on the Gulf for an…

title: beautiful beach, nice pool, bad bed
review: i stayed here this weekend for a friend's wedding. valet parked the car ($16) as that seemed to be the only the option. was greeted very nicely, bags taken by valet and delivered to my room while i met friends by the pool. check-in was quick, i was offered champagne which was a nice touch. the room was basic. nice view. paid $249 a night (wedding rate) plus $15 resort fee and a bunch of taxes. the bed was awful. i could feel the springs in the mattress. the bedding and pillows were nice, but the mattress really needs upgrading for this kind of place. my only other complaint was that the pool was not heated. usually not a problem, but water did not warm up. beach was beautiful. there are bars and restaurants in walking distance. i had breakfast at the hotel one morning and it was…

title: Sandpearl losing its lustre
review: We've stayed at the Sandpearl three years in a row and have always enjoyed its laid-back elegance.  But I think this year may be the last -- while there have always been a few blips, this year I found it's not worth the money.  There are two main issues.  1) The housekeeping is atrocious -- never replaced basic items like toilet paper or coffee and we had to constantly request items.  The room wasn't ever properly cleaned - grimy fingerprints everywhere from guests long gone.  It's worse than some cheap roadside motel.   2) The pool area is out of control.  There are people wandering in off the beach, lots of people drinking in the pool, and toddlers have taken over the whirlpool -- and these little kids eating and drinking in the tub -- yuck.  When guests are paying top dollar…

title: Loved it
review: The hotel is in prime location, close to restaurants and shops and right on the beach.  Beautiful rooms, cleaned well daily.  Beach is gorgeous.  Only downside, a bit cramped around the pool area, a bit difficult getting sun loungers.  Concierge do a fantastic job, so helpful.  Breakfasts were good and lunch at the Island Grill (pool restaurant) enjoyable.  Another good place for breakfast was a restaurant just outside the hotel (can't remember name).  The hotel is rather expensive but you get what you pay for.  We tend to eat out in the evenings and we found some great restaurants walking distance.  Spent 10 days here followed by 4 days in Key West.  Absolute bliss and would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent place to hold your beach destination wedding!
review: We held our daughters' wedding at the Sandpearl on April 17th, 2010. I had to plan the wedding from Minnesota and our daughter and her fiance' live in Oklahoma.Tanya Clark was assigned to our wedding and helped us organize the most magnificent wedding ever. She was able to help with vendors and decor.The resort is beautiful and the beach is pristine. The staff was excellent, professional and friendly. Our guests raved about the food and the decor in the ballroom. 90% of our guests came from out of state and they truly enjoyed the Sandpearl experience.

title: really nice experience
review: Aside from a weird check-in procedure, this was a great place for a business meeting. After traveling across the country, I just want to get to my room, not have a drink with the check-in person. Besides this small complaint, I loved the on-site amenities, bar, beach, etc. Great room. Would love to go back for a meeting or with family for some R&R.

title: Mixed feelings about hotel
review: Pros: Bellman,Valets, Pool / Beach Staff(Beck & Blaze) & Todd- The concierge, Kids Club counselors couldn’t be nicer & do enough.   Caretta of Gulf & Tiki Restaurant had great food and service. Room had great view and comfortable beds.  Cons:  Maid half cleaned room each day. Found the front desk cold & unwelcoming.  First 3 days not enough chairs by pool & they had no control of people coming off the public beach & using pool, chairs & hotel faculties. I would expect when you pay $500.00 a night you don’t have to fight with non hotel guests using the grounds. Staff was clearly aware of the issue of non hotel guest using grounds. I would think by now they would have a better system figured out so there guest are not bothered or there stay disrupted by this. With that said the…

title: A few disappointments, but ok overall
review: My husband and I booked a gulf front room for the week of April 5th. I emailed the resort a week before to request a room on a high floor. Upon checking in, I was disappointed that we were on the lowest floor possible. Also, due to the set up of the resort, the gulf front rooms are actually pool front rooms. So, if like me, you appreciate the nature sounds of the beach and gulf, you're out of luck. Instead, all you can hear is the music from the restaurant, the many shrieking kids in the pool and the artificial waterfall they've installed. Ugh.   I confirmed with the front desk that this was indeed a gulf front room, and asked for a room on a higher floor to get away from some of the noise. They were able to move us one floor up, which I appreciated, but why didn't they give us…

title: Very impressive property with fabulous beachfront location
review: Just returned from Spring Break at the SandPearl on Clearwater Beach.  We were pleasantly surprised to see this property is at least as nice as the pictures on the website.  The service was outstanding, the room was roomy and comfortable (luxurious bedding!), the amenities were abundant, and you cannot beat the beachfront location.  The sand is powder-soft and pure white.  The kids especially enjoyed cooking s'mores at the beach firepit.    The pool and hot tubs are very nice with lots of nice padded lounge chairs, most with cabana tops.  We did have problems sometimes finding a chair if we weren't down there early, but I guess that is to be expected during spring break.  We always eventually found one.  There are lots of beach chairs as well.  We loved the frozen grapes and…

title: Loved our stay!
review: I picked this resort based on reviews on this site and was very happy.   The negatives...$15 resort fee...$16 valet parking fee.  I was aware of this ahead of time so really shouldn't list this as a negative but would be happier if they would just include it in the price.  Very convenient to some of the best restaurants.  Loved Crabby Bill's, Frenchy's and Bobby's Bistro...all recommended by the staff at Sand Pearl.   The pool and beach were perfect (as long as you are willing to spend the money for a pool cabana $200).  Chairs were saved very early in the morning with most of them not used most of the day.   The service at the cabana was great though...thanks to Noah!  The staff at the beach were great...went out of their way to find chairs and umbrellas for you.   One negative…

title: Absolutely perfect in every way!
review: We just returned from 4 wonderful days and nights at the Sand Pearl. Everything was absolutely perfect...they have an abundance of staff who are all eager to help you in any way they can. We were there over our March Break, and were told that the hotel was sold out. Even so, we never encountered any lines, waits, or inconveniences. We attribute this to the fact that the resort employs an abundance of wonderful staff...everyone was so lovely, polite, and helpful. We never passed a staff member that did not ask if we needed anything. Wow. We were taken to the VIP check in area immediately upon arrival and given champagne (sparkling cider for the kids).  Our car was valet parked and our luggage brought up immediately. (Note there is a $15 charge per day for valet parking, but they…

title: Beautiful New Hotel
review: We recently stayed for four nights at the Sandpearl. The arrival was smooth, got there before lunchtime and had a nice check-in with champagne and washcloths. We were able to be checked in immediately, which is rare for hotels. The staff from that moment on was professional and went out of their way to be sure you were enjoying the stay. We were very impressed with all of the staff, especially Eli, the Caretta server, the Caretta bartenders and Tate servers at the pool. Our room, a junior suite gulf side was great. Our balcony was private but I can totally understand the other complaints since most are side by side.   The spa is on par with the best you can find. Joanne gave the best facial I have ever had, and I returned for more services during my trip. Spa is also not…

title: Absolutely Wonderful!!
review: Came here expecting a relaxing, enjoyable vacation and that is EXACTLY what we got! Visiting from DC with grandma/grandpa and our two little boys. WOW the staff here gets it. They are professional from the door and bellmen to front desk to check-in to poolside. Every employee and member of their team treats you with kindness and service and truly seems to CARE if they are helping you to make the stay better! Restaurant is fantastic but accomodating for the kiddos. Pool is lovely and perfect for families RIGHT on the beach, by the way but enough distance to keep the beach scene seperate. Sherry in the boutique was beyond helpful, kelly in the spa did a great job and Amir at the front desk took care to extend our stay an extra night with no trouble or somplication. The gentlemen…

title: Luxurious and delightful hotel
review: I spent a week here in March 2010.  I expected a lot as the room was expensive . With the exception of one or two minor items it met all expectations.  The room, a 1 bedroom  gulf front suite on 7th floor was to the standard  I expected. It was gulf facing so although balconies are not private I did not feel I was being watched as some people have mentioned. It is a shame that the balconies are not more private.  The state of art coffee maker was a waste of time, we tried 2, neither brewed decent coffee. A shame when clearly that was not the intention.  There are 2 good bars and 2 restaurants. All had a good atmosphere and we thought the drinks were keenly priced. We ate in the  outside Tate Grill  twice and would have used it more if the weather had been warmer. There are lots…

title: What an Oasis!
review: We had an outstanding stay at this very relaxing and upscale resort!    We were there for Blue Jays Spring Training and relaxation, and the hotel delivered.  The amenities were first class, and the beds super comfy.  The onsite restaurants were great, and having the in-room fridge for continental breakfast items along with complimentary coffee for the in-room coffee maker was convenient.  The staff was very attentive, although one minor issue was that concierge staff on two occasions cut me off to assist others while they were serving me!  The beach was incredible, and the sunsets were amazing (we had a pool front room).    The resort did not seem very busy, which we really liked.  On the Saturday night there was a wedding with a little noise coming from the celebration on the…

title: lux at the beach
review: I had such a good time with my family. My husband and I usually do SOBE. This time we needed a slower pace because of older parents and kids. The rooms were great. Sheets and bed quality were fantastic. My 6 year old neice requested a nap because the bed was so soft.  Pool area fantastic. I like new properties...I still remember the lavender ice washclothes given out by the pool. Food and drinks where good. If you are tight on funds...do not stay here. If you want to invest in a great family memories and treat yourself at the same time. This property is for you.  I believe this property is to good for Clearwater Beach...

title: Exceptional Customer Service
review: We stayed here for a wedding and had a wonderful time. From the minute we were greeted in the lobby and offered cold cloths for our hands to wipe away the stress to the cool champagne offered to us. Catherine was always there for any questions and treated us like family. The food and rooms were wonderful. The view and the atmosphere were very special and we felt that way the entire visit.

title: THE FIRST & SECOND TIMES WERE CHARMS.
review: Sandpearl you've done it again.My wife&I stayed here in '07 two months after they opened for 3 nights.Our only mistake was, it wasn't long enough.We made it 5 nights in '09.If you like a groomed white beach,beautiful pool,incredible jaccuzzis,luxurious rooms with top notch service stay here,and thank me later.The resort really shines with service.It makes you feel pampered,and appreciated.Large pit fire on fall nights doesn't get any better after a "tough" day of ocean,pool,or walking that  Clearwater beach sand.Oh,the frozen grapes served with a cool drink poolside is a nice touch.Speaking for all guests of this resort who thoroughly enjoy it from top to bottom.There are no hidden fees.The Sandpearl site clearly breaks it down for you TT&L.Also,Gulfview means sideview looking…

title: Wonderful
review: We spent a week here around March 1, in a sixth floor king room overlooking the swimming pool complex, beach and Gulf of Mexico. Paid in the low $300's a day, which supposedly included a discount given me at the time of booking.  Resort is well-located, good restaurants within walking distance. Views were spectacular. Room was excellent--good size, comfortable, well equipped, nice bathroom. We had a small but usable balcony. Public areas were grand. They have two computers for free internet access. Staff was superb. Very helpful. The hotel is pretty new and looks brand new. Restaurant was great. There were downsides. The coffee maker in the room was worthless, the TV tuner was balky, and you can't park your own car, you have to pay $15 a day for valet. Plus they have one of…

title: Hotel heaven
review: This hotel isn't cheap but it's worth every penny, we had a fantastic time and would definitly go back again. Check in was smooth, the valet took care of our car and bags while we were checked in we were given a glass of champagne which was much needed after a long drive. We paid for an Ocean front room and the views over the pool and beach were great and the sunset was lovely. We went for room service, food was delicious and in fact we didn't eat outside of our hotel for our entire stay which isn't like us as we normally like to explore but it was so good we stuck to room service or the bar grill. The staff were fantastic, Kit and all the bar staff were very friendly and approachable and the front desk/concierge staff helped us with numerous requests. Unfortunatley on our…

title: Disappointing -premium rates difficult to justify
review: I booked a 3 night stay at the Sandpearl, primarily because of the positive reviews I've read in Trip Advisor.    The hotel was clean enough (no complaints there); but what else would you expect by paying the premium prices charged (not including the $16 / day parking AND the $15 / day "Resort Amenity" fee).  I must admit, however, the lobby is quite charming.  Unfortunately, we didn't sleep in the lobby.  Upon check-in, we were graciously offered a no-charge upgrade to a gulf-view room.  This room was situated on the north side of the building, and offered majestic and sweeping views of loading docks, dumpsters, and bird-dropping covered rooftops of neighboring restaurants.  Be cautious, therefore, of any "gulf view" room.  I doubt I'll return to the Sandpearl.  Despite its…

title: Wow
review: My family and I stayed here after spending two weeks in Orlando doing the parks. We wanted a week of relaxation and boy did we get it. On arrival we were taken to the checkin area were we were upgraded to a room overlooking the pool and straight out over the beach and ocean. The pool was great, however you had to be quick if you wanted to get the chairs next to the pool. One morning having woken up very early I thought I would sit on the balcony watching the sea and early mornning runners and from about 07:00 people were getting towels from the towel desk and reserving their chairs, mind you not appearing back at said reserved chair for many hours latter. That said there were enough Chairs to go around. The children loved the pool and the fact that from the hotel room they could…

title: The best hotel in the area and much better than it appears on its website
review: The Sandpearl is a good, if expensive hotel, but definitely the best hotel within 20 miles - the best hotel in the Clearwater/St Pete/Tampa area.  As long as you don't mind paying premium, then it's the only option for you to stay at.  (The new Hyatt has only just opened the week we were at the Sandpearl but, while it's only 10 mins walk away, it's not on the beach (over a busy road) so again i'd go for the Sandpearl, which is right on the beach).  It looked a little tired on the website pictures but that is not the case.  It's a very well kept, very clean, efficient hotel.  The staff are all very friendly too.  There are some nice design touches: the bar is beautiful and the bathrooms stylishly designed.    The grumbles are few.  We paid extra for a full gulf facing room but…

title: great time
review: spent spring break there with the boys. food was great. room got upgraded to suite by using IPREFER. had great time. was recvering from back surgery

title: Almost Perfect
review: My husband and I are local Pinellas County residents, and decided to have a last-minute weekend getaway to the Sandpearl (we went there for lunch, but packed a few items in case we felt the urge to stay for the evening).  We had a delicious lunch at Caretta-- the best local sushi you can find-- even the California roll is made with fresh lump crabmeat, and the yellow fin sashimi was delicious.  My husband had the chicken salad wrap, which was good, although the Caretta Club (he usually gets) is better (chicken salad wrap is a little heavy on the mayo if you're trying to be healthy).    After lunch we decided to see if there were any rooms available-- we were greeted again in the lobby by the "hotel ambassador" (nice, friendly lady with short blonde hair, didn't catch her name,…

title: Beautiful Resort - Would definitely stay again!
review: We just got back from Clearwater and we've always trusted trip advisors suggestions. I couldn't wait to write to let everyone know what a great resort this is. It reminded me of Cesears style casino, without all the noise. Staff was very attentive. The only downside I can think of is the $15 daily resort fee. Valet parking. Great walking area, so no need to use your car that much.

title: Wonderful
review: Great hotel.  If you are planning a trip to the Gulf Coast this is a great hotel for your vacation. The staff at the hotel are very helpful.  The rooms are very clean.  Great location for enjoying an evening stroll to some great restaurants.  The beach is awesome!

title: great time at sandpearl
review: this is my first visit to clearwater and the sandpearl resort , but i must say it was really great experience,  from the moment we got there the staff were very friendly and helpful and made our stay memorable,   we had a great time and i am considering on coming back soon.

title: Awesome Stay
review: We had a awesome 4 night stay.  Excellent service,  great facilities and awesome food.

title: Excellent hotel, great location.
review: We only had one night in this hotel, using it for somewhere to stay enroute to Tampa airport. The next time we visit Florida we will be sure to stay longer.  The staff were excellent. We had a very good meal in the hotel's restaurant. I highly recommend Sandpearl Resort.

title: Lovely hotel, but pay 16$ for valet parking og 15$ in resortfee
review: I stayed with my family for four days at this nice hotel in november 2009. It is very nice and clean, but the staffin the reception is not very seviceminded The rest of the staff were very pleasant. I thougt it was irritating that I couldn´t  take towels at the pool like in other hotels, I had to deliver them back before getting new ones. That is not okay for a hotel in yhis price.  The room was very nice and clean with a great view.  I really am unhappy about the resortfee and the valetparking.

title: Amazing, Amazing, Amazing!
review: This was our second stay at the Sandpearl Resort having stayed in 2008 - this time was for a four night stay at the end of our holiday.  The Sandpearl is truly an outstanding hotel; the location is excellent, the decor both in public areas / rooms is gorgeous (high end but relaxed), the pool and beach are both wonderful and the service is fabulous.  We had a Gulf View Jr Suite on the 5th floor - a lovely room right on the front of the hotel overlooking the beach / Gulf.  The bathroom opened out on to the bed & lounge area which was lovely for chilling out and soaking in the tub with a view!  The room was spacious and had two flat screen TVs - one for the 'bed' area and one for the sofa / lounge area.  The room also had a balcony with seating - amazing both when you first wake up…

title: Don't mistake Sandpearl Residences with Sandpearl Resort
review: We inadvertently had reservations with Sandperal Residences whcih is righ tnext door to the Sandpearl Resort.   Sandpearl Residences are mostly for people that maintain their condos for themselves.   A few rent out and it is a very quiet, practically empty property.  The pool is not for small children as the depth begins at about 4-1/2 ft.    We were under the impression that we could use also use the pool at the Sandpearl Resort next door which had a great pool, hot tub, cabana bar, music playing, fire pit, etc.    We were told we could not use those facilities even though we were staying at another Sandpearl next door.   It was a huge disappointment as there were lots of people, kids and fun going on at the Sandpearl Resort.    Would stay at the Sandpearl Resort but not the…

title: Sandpearl Resort - Sheer Bliss
review: We have recently come back from two lovely weeks staying at the Sandpearl Resort on Clearwater Beach.  My husband and I are lucky enough to go on holiday to lots of lovely places in the world but this was without doubt one of the nicest places location-wise we have ever been.  Our Travel Agent recommended the Sandpearl as he had visited it last year and told us how lovely the hotel was - we were not disappointed. Even though at first we thought that the price of the stay accommodation only was a little high it was worth every penny.  From the moment we walked into the hotel we were very impressed by both the staff and the décor.  We were taken to the reception area and were given a glass of champagne each which was very welcoming after our long flight and the two hour car…

title: Lovely hotel, good restaurants off-site
review: The Sandpearl is a lovely hotel with plush rooms. We had a gulf view suite which had a bath-tub that opened out onto the room...very nice. Staff were helpful and our overall stay was very relaxing. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant Caretta on the Gulf which, although, expensive, produced a fantastic meal. Other good resturants nearby are Frenchy's on the beach for lunch (next door to hotel, on the beach, turn right) and Island Way Grille for a fab dinner (5 min cab ride away).

title: Great hotel with a badview- know the room type you choose
review: We have just returned from a 1 night stay at the Sandpearl to recharge after a long business trip.  I chose this resort over hotels 1/4 the price for its location, amenities and spectacular view.  The hotel was excellent - great rooms, facilities and staff. My only criticism would be the Room I received and its view.  I paid for a gulf view.  and I got 20% gulf view and 80% shipping dock/parking lot.  They told me I should have upgraded to Gulf Front view from standard.  The hotel was only at 20% occupancy after IDA struck and I still got a bad view.  Rooms were stil very nice though.  On a different note, I didnt even have to go to the business center to print my boarding passes.  Alician the conceriage did it for me over the phone.

title: FIRST CLASS
review: This is one of the best Hotels I have stayed in, Excellent  Service From Andy on concierge.Only Thing was that the Dining restaurant was expensive and and service charge $15 a day a little anoying but we had known that before we went so that didnt spoil it. One Tip Sea Fishing off pier 60 Very Good.  Enjoy !

title: No better place to recharge your batteries
review: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Sandpearl to recover after a full on week at Disneyworld. The hotel was excellent - great rooms, facilities and staff. My only slight criticism would be the eating options, if you are perhaps on your own the fine dining restaurant would be great but with two young children it's expensive and not practical. The pool bar offers food but it's only really lunchtime menu. That aside there are some great surrounding restaurants.  The beach is unreal and the weather was great. It wouldn't suit a two week family holiday as there is not enough to do but for a 5 day sanctuary to re-charge it was fantastic.

title: A unique experience - the best
review: I had the unrivalled pleasure of staying at the Sandpearl Resort last week  for 7 days. Never have I experienced a place where the smallest details are paid attention to. The place has such a friendly and relaxed atmosphere that I have never known anywhere else.  We arrived early at the resort and were not able to check in immediately. However, before long our room was available. Even though it did not have a sea view or balcony the views of the Clearwater Beach area were excellent. The room itself was extremely clean, well designed and very comfortable.  The staff were very keen to help and even drove us to excursion departure points that were literally a five minute walk up the road as part of the service.  Every evening we would return to the room and find that besides the…

title: First Class
review: I just completed a four night stay at the Sandpearl and have nothing but good things to say. Attention to detail is the most noted feature. This is an upper end and expensive property. I was part of a group and got a great rate. Aside from not having a beachfront view I was happy with everything about my stay. Should you have the opportunity to stay here, I think you'll be satisfied.

title: Great stay at the sandpearl
review: stayed for 10 days at the end of may booked via vrigin great rooms, not much noise transfer couldn't accomdate our request for a double and two singles and wanted megabucks for an extra fold down bed, but doubles were large enough to accomodate 2 kids with a bit of rearranging  good pool, superb beach, both very safe for the kids superb seafood in the main restaurant on the a-la-carte and did a good job of making our wedding anniversary special. other restrurants OK but understaffed at peak times and expensive.  loads of great local places to eat if you want cheaper options, especially for breakfast. fire on the beachside in the evenings by the bar a great place to watch the sunset with a beer. staff helpful and friendly. quieter during the week but gets very busy at weekends  -…

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: The Sandpearl is beautiful!  The rooms are gorgeous.   The pool is a bit small.   The restaurants are overpriced with only mediocre food.  The staff definitely needs to become a little bit more friendly - they must be the "stuffiest" employees I've ever dealt with.

title: WOW !
review: Stayed at the sandpearl for 4 nights in a one bedroom suite with our two children. The hotel is First class when you enter the lobby you know youve done well ! ! Our suite was on the 8th floor top of the hotel with a fabulous view , Everything in the suite was excellent it ticks all the boxes for a 5 star resort !! We could not fault this hotel everything is of a high class and has a great relaxed atmosphere the staff are all professional and friendly the service was always to a high standard. The staff and hotel are very child friendly which is often hard to find in a high class resort ! Our children especially enjoyed the smores evening by the firepit logan made sure everyone had fun taking part in this well done.  The Sandpearl resort is def worth its 4 stars it could show a…

title: A slice of heaven
review: The Sandpearl on Clearwater Beach is one of the most beautiful resorts I have had the pleasure of visiting. The staff, the mangement, and the full support team were nothing but the best! Stuart, the General Manager, is a true professional in every sense of the word. The grounds were captivating. The decore, furnishings, and art work simply impeccable. My stay in October gave me some of the seasons best weather. I recall a moment when I stood on the balcony and a warm tropical breeze surrounded me. Heaven. The food was delicious. I have no complaint. How can I? I will be back. Lovely indeed. I usally stay in Marco Island. No anymore.

title: Everything we could ask for and more
review: I wanted to treat my 83-year old mother and show her just how special she is so I looked for a very special place for us to go. The Sandpearl was absolutely the best choice I could have made.   From the minute we drove up to the door, we knew it was different. The valets were right there and helped us with the car, someone was always there to open the door for us and the registration process was like no other we ever experienced. The champagne and cool towels to refresh us were just lovely!  The best part was how everyone at the front desk, the restaurant and the Concierge picked up on cues that me and Mom were here for a very special time. Their spirit of friendliness and impeccable service were a feature of this hotel as much as the beautiful pool and beach and the outstanding…

title: Great Girls Trip
review: The Sandpearl was a perfect choice for our recent girls' trip! The resort was super clean and perfectly upscale.  The staff had great service!  Dennis, our waiter at the pool was awesome!  I had a terrible cold and he asked if I felt better each day and offered me warm tea and tea bags to take back to the room.   The beach and pool area were beautiful, and everything we needed was within walking distance...no need for a car.  Our suite was roomy and comfortable and the views were amazing! I just got back from an all inclusive trip to Mexico, and this trip was a lot nicer!  Signing off on all my food, drinks and spa services was a breeze and the price was about the same as I would have spent on all inclusive.   Everything was awesome, I will be back!

title: Fab.U.Lous.
review: We stayed in a gulf view room overlooking the lagoon-style pool and beach. The rooms are excellent, beds comfy, granite-top bathroom counters with plenty of space, nice balcony, quiet even with children at the resort.    We didn't use the wet bar, but did use the mini-fridge. Service at this resort is outstanding! They know you by name and go the extra mile to make sure you are happy. The activities desk has towels, fresh cold water for you as you enter/exit beach area. We rented a beach cabana for $20 half day - came with a small table and fits two lounge chairs with plenty of leftover room. The pool chairs have a flag to raise when you are wanting a drink or service. The pool is clean, warm, and spacious open until 10 p.m. Soft beach music is playing from morning til evening…

title: A first class experience in a beautiful resort.
review: My husband and I celebrated our 15 year anniversiary by spending three nights at The Sandpearl. It went beyond our expectations. They upgraded our room from bay view to partial ocean front. The pool was fabulous. The room was clean and comfortable. I took a pilates class in the morning which was fun. This is not the place for bargains. We paid $20 each day for beach chairs and an umbrella close to the water. The food, drinks, and extras are expensive but we felt it was worth the splurge. I highly recommend this place for an upscale, relaxing beach getaway. They helped arrange a limo service to pick us up and take us to the airport which was wonderful. Renting a car would have been much more expensive and not needed at all. Many things are within walking distance. I would…

title: Worth every penny!
review: Absolutely love this place. It was clearly the nicest place to stay in Clearwater Beach and one of the nicest places I've ever stayed. Absolutely wonderful staff and very family friendly atmosphere. I loved that we could walk right out to the beach whenever we wanted and the beach was definitely the best beach I've seen. We loved hitting up the Starbucks each morning and enjoying coffee on the patio. Oh, and the HDTV in our rooms was a plus.

title: You'll never want to leave!
review: My husband and I stayed for a week at the Sandpearl Resort with our toddler in July. What an incredible experience! The hotel is gorgeous, the rooms are clean and spacious. We ate at both restaurants, where we were graciously received, even when our son threw all his food on the floor every single day. The service was beyond top notch, and the spa was luxurious and peaceful, with an incredible masseuse and awesome facialist. We plan to stay there every year!

title: Great Florida Resort
review: We spent a weekend in Clearwater and really enjoyed staying at the Sandpearl.  The rooms were clean and furnished nicely and we were even given an upgrade to a gulf view room.  The moment we entered the hotel we were taken to the VIP room for check-in, where they offered us champagne.  The check in staff was very professional and we were able to get in to our room at noon.  From there, I got a pedicure that was excellent.  The spa facilities were quite nice and relaxing.  The pool area was great and there were plenty of chairs.  The poolside grill had great food - the grouper sandwich was outstanding - very fresh!  The weekend we were here they had the offshore boat races going on and the hotel did a fantastic job of keeping out beachgoers who were not guests.  There were a few…

title: Once again Sandpearl delivers!
review: This is our second stay at this fabulous resort.  September/early October is a great time to visit the area as it is very low key and the beaches aren't crowded.  Throughout the stay the staff was knowledgeable & friendly and always provided great service.  We ate at Tate's for lunch every day at the pool, and both the close Frenchy's locations (I dream about the fried grouper sandwich when we're not in town!).  We didn't make it to Caretta on the Gulf this trip but found it to be wonderful last time.  If you're in the Clearwater area, nothing compares to this resort!

title: Buyer Beware!!!
review: Aweful,t hat's all I can say. Service was rediculous! i OVER PAID for a room & then got treated like I was below them. I've never been treated like this in mylife & then we complained & were again treated like we were the idiot! We are the idiot for wasting our $$$$$ staying here.

title: Outstanding Vacation at the Sandpearl!
review: My wife and I stayed at the Sandpearl Resort in Clearwater, Florida, for a one-week vacation early in September 2009.  We had never visited Florida's western coast before but were intrigued by descriptions our friends gave us of the beautiful beaches and calm gulf waters.  I chose the Sandpearl primarily based on TripAdvisor reviews and the hotel's web site.  I was looking for a luxurious resort that would provide my wife and me with some stress-free relaxation.  The Sandpearl exceeded our hopes!    First of all, the service was outstanding at every level, including the front desk, the concierges, the restaurants, the valet parking, the cleaning service and maintenance.  In general, the staff was genuinely friendly and exceptionally responsive, doing everything possible to make…

title: Beautiful!
review: I took my wife there for her birthday and had a great time. It all started at check-in where we were greeted with superior service.  We had a beeautiful room with a balcony with a partial view of the ocean as well as the harbor. The pool area was beautiful as well as the cabana we rented. Dinner was excellent. We can't say enough.

title: EXCELLENT STAY
review: Only had the pleasure of staying at this resort for one night and must say that it is truly top notch.  Compared with that of other beach hotels, the price is comparable.  The only downfall is the incidentals that you cannot avoid..... $15 hotel service charge (for bottled water in the room) and $15 per night valet charge. Food at Caretta was outstanding as well as the service.  Cannot beat the firepit on the beach at sunset which appeared to be open until late hours for all to enjoy.  Extremely romantic setting and definitely a 5 star resort!

title: Great resort but  fees at the end not pleasant
review: Went with husband and 4years old daughter.Loved it.My daughter loved the beach .The sand and the ocean are exquisite ,very warm ocean and the most beautiful sand .Food around was not the best  but we were able to go to Publix (grocery store) which is a mile away. The biggest inconvenience for us was that  the hotel does not provide sun umbrella and chairs by the beach...only nearby the hotel itself. So i have to walk about quarter of a mile to get to the water from my chair,with little kids it's impossible to do-you have to be near the water at all times.Next time i would bring my own! Complimentary waters "Dasani" are provided for free every day but i guess only if you opt for housekeeping,we didn't and we never saw the water except we had to go the receptionist the ask for…

title: Ok, but could be improved
review: You know, like in highschool some people get solid B, only a tiny bit below A, while others try very hard just to get B (wiggling on sharp edge almost to falling back to C grade). The latter is how we feeling about Sandpearl resort.  I don't know why and how Sandpearl get their 4 stars, but I surely missed few important points: The mattress and sheets in room we stayed (single king bed) while was spotless white, was hard and sheets there not as soft as one would expect at 4 stars resort. The coffee machine and coffee in room there really bad - stay away. Pool was somewhat decent sized, but far from that I'd consider large for size of hotel, was during day filled with screaming kids and even louder adults, but the real downer was fact pool and hot spas are closed at 10pm :( !!!…

title: Hidden Costs
review: Lovely hotel right on the beach. Staff very friendly and food lovely. Only gripe was that when we went to check out we had an extra $200 to pay made up of $15 per day 'resort fees' and $16 valet parking per day. It wasn't the money, it was that we were not told about it and it was done quite slyly

title: Loved Everything about it!!
review: This place was great!! The  Prettiest beach I've ever been to. The pool was amazing, great clean hot tub. Very friendly staff. The only thing they get you on is the $15 extra a day for resort amenity fees and $16 a day for valet parking. But besides that great.

title: Heaven on Earth!
review: Stayed for 5 days at the beautiful Sandpearl Resort at the end of July.  We had a 2 bedroom Sandpearl Suite with a gulf view . There were 7 of us ranging in age from 16 to 66.   From the moment we walked into the Hotel and heard the Steinway playing in the background, I felt relaxed and pampered. Our arrival was late, but it was no trouble for the bar staff to make us some scrumptious burgers and flatbreads- and after that first late night, they remembered us, and knew what drinks we wanted! The suite was beautiful, and extremely comfortable -bed soft and pillow top, good quality bedding, huge bathrooms with jacuzzi bath and seperate shower and Washer and Dryer in there too [this was okay to freshen things up, but not as big as a normal washer or dryer -more than adequate for…

title: Very nice - but pricey
review: We stayed at the Sandpearl resort from August 18 through August 21st for a short trip to see my college aged stepdaughter.   We were met at check in by the concierge, as the two check in counters were busy.  We were handed a glass of champagne to occupy us until check in.  The check in process was quick - and we were given the keys to our gulf front room.  The room was very clean and overlooked the pool and the sand.  The beds were very cushiony and soft - to my husband's liking, but as I have back problems, I prefer my bed firmer. As we arrived late on Tuesday, we went to the Tate Grill for dinner.  Large portions - good, but not great food.  We were very disappointed in the 'frozen' drinks we ordered, as they were very watery, and we couldn't tell the difference between the…

title: Loved the resort - beautiful decor - scenery exquisite!
review: We only got to stay one night but we shall return for a couple days getaway trip another time. We got upgraded to gulf front on arrival. Nice large suite with balcony to sit on for early morning coffee or to watch the sunset at night.   So nice to stop down at the pool for a 30 minute swim, a drink and a bit of reading and have a place to be able to sit for a few minutes. So often you see people leave towels early in the morning "claiming their territory" for the entire day whether they are there or not. So nice to see this place values their customers' and handles the situation so reasonably.  The artwork all around the lobby and pool area is unique to the SandPearl. Christopher Sill is the artist - and I had to buy notecards in the tiny gift shop that featured some of the…

title: Flawless
review: This is a beautiful hotel on a beautiful beach. From check-in to check-out my entire stay was exceptional. The pool is large and spotless, with ample comfy lounge chairs. Poolside service was quick, convenient and friendly. The nightly bonfires at sunset were an added bonus. This hotel was worth every penny.

title: Different
review: We stayed 1 night Saturday August 8 for our 10 yr anniversary. Overall nice place, the grounds, the beach. In my opinion, a bit overpriced. The drinks, dinners. The breakfast buffet $39 pp, wow. Alot of different fees added onto your bill as well. The one complaint we had was the lounge chairs by the pool. Never seen this before, we found our seats, hung out by the pool for a bit, then went for a walk and swim in the ocean, then had a bite to eat. Maybe an hour and a half. Got back to the seats, everything was gone! our phones, towels, etc. Went to the desk, and they said if you are gone for more than 45min we take your stuff???? I said how do you know how long we were gone, they said we watch! I told them, people were coming in off the beach and using the facilities. No guard…

title: never again
review: let me preface this by saying we got married at the sandpearl on 8-08-08.  we had a really great experience then.  there were a couple hiccups - but the resort had not even been open a year yet, so we let them go.  all in all last year - a great time.  everyone loved it.   we came back this year to celebrate our anniversary.  they could care less.  nothing special done.  i have been to much less caliber hotels that will at least acknowledge a special event.  let alone a special event that occurred at their hotel!!  when we reserved our room back in june, i spoke w/lourdes in reservations.  very nice lady.  there was a special on iprefer's website - 2 breakfasts and a $75 resort credit starting at $261.  we booked a gulf front king for $369.  i received a confirmation number and…

title: Extrodinary Hotel
review: We just returned from a 4 night stay at Sandpearl Resort.  Our experience from arrival to departure was flawless.  Upon arrival we were greeted with champaign and the kids with sparkling cider.  Our room was not ready so we were upgraded to gulf view at no additional charge.  We received turndown service in our room every night while we were at dinner which was unexpected but greatly appreciated.  They have a private beach area which is full service (bringing drinks/food when you raise your flag).  Poolside they walked around with frozen grapes and lavendar infused cold towels.  Only downside is the pool closes at 10pm every night with no exceptions.  They only offer valet parking but it is worth the extra and they are very quick getting your vehicle.  All staff was more than…

title: Truly a Gem
review: Just returned from an incredible 14 night stay at Sandpearl with my husband and adult son.  Vacationing in Clearwater for the past 20 years, we have finally come across the best place on the beach. From the moment we entered and were greeted by friendly staff members and champagne, we knew we would love our stay.  Perfect place for R&R by the pool or walks on the best white sandy beach dolphin watching and amazing sunsets.  Hotel is spotless!  Enjoyed starting our day with breakfast at Caretta on the Gulf - Hostess Josephine will greet you with a smile and server Elizabeth is the best!  No need to leave the hotel - enjoyed lunch/dinner at Tate's grill or back to Caretta.  Starbucks coffee available in their Marketplace cafe.  Lounge serves up drinks and sushi menu.  Only…

title: A very service oriented hotel
review: I have never gone out of my way to write a review about a hotel, regardless of good or bad, but I decided to write a review about this hotel.  I stay in a lot of nice hotel but this one was quite impressive.  Every person that I came in to contact with was perfect, sweet and accommodating to no end.  The hotel was beautiful, the bed and linens were cloud like, the pool and beach were gorgeous, the food was plentiful and delicious.  I couldn't imagine that anyone could complain about this hotel.  It was a pleasure to stay there.

title: Awesom
review: We would highly recommend this hotel.  First class.  Service, food and hotel are wonderful.  It has an awesome pool and beach.  Very clean and well kept hotel. Only 1 year old.  From main entry steps to the pool then walk right out to the beach.  Theres cabanas for familys with young children.  Can't say enough good things about this hotel.

title: Excellent!!!!!
review: My title says it all, this hotel was brilliant. Although I marked value as 5 out of 5 this was because we got a cracking deal from Virgin Holidays (£152 for 2 nights for everyone!!!), although if you booked with the hotel accordoning to their in-room info, it was $2900 a week. We decided to break up our fort-night in florida with a few days at the beach. Because we had already booked to weeks in orlando we would have paying extra for nights in clearwater and this is when we got a great deal from Virgin Holidays. The hotel was faultless as far as I am concerned, it was spotless, staff where curteous, the pool area was great and led straight onto the gulf of Mexico, the beach was spotless and the sand was white. All in all I wish I could have stayed for longer and will definitely…

title: What a Brilliant Place!!
review: My husband and I cannot wait to revisit the SandPearl with our family.  Its the perfect environment to recharge your batteries.  I don't think you can find harder working people in Clearwater Beach.  They go out of their way to ensure you are satisfied.   The whole purpose of our vacation was to lounge at the pool and beach with a few day outings.  Every afternoon we would come in from the beach/ pool with drippy soggy kids and get everyone cleaned up to go for dinner.  By the time we came back housekeeping had the bathroom spotless and beds turned down.    That wicked chef bakes fresh pasteries every morning and provides you with a complimentary basket of assorted treats.  I pratically inhaled them.  A couple of times we got a little sloppy and left valuables about and they…

title: It was ok
review: We had booked 5 nights at this resort as a break at the beach during a theme park trip to Orlando. It was OK but I was expecting better. They started on the wrong foot when we arrived, bit of a wait to unload the car as busy. When I went into the hotel NO ONE at reception!! Someone appeared and was excellent but a hotel of this price should never have an empty reception desk. I noticed the same thing on another occcasion when we were leaving. Room very good. Pool ok but really too crowded. Again for the price I didn't expect not to have a bed by the pool.Better once weekend was over. I would say nice hotel but avoid weekends. Also headline rate is added to with 'resort fee' of $15 a day per room and $16 for parking.There is a spa I didn't use it. Could do more to entertain…

title: Sand Pearl "Clearwater Beach - Best"
review: The hotel was exceptional and was only surpassed by the professional staff that abound.  At every turn we were greeted by staff members eager to assist.  Having traveled quite a bit, I have rarely felt more at home and at easy with the friendly environment that embraced us at every turn.  In fact, I witnessed an in progress security response when several local youths accessed the pool area uninvited.  It was a matter of seconds before security engaged and removed the unwanted element in a discreet manner.  I would highly recommend a stay, but be prepared for looks of disappointment on the faces of your family when it is time to leave.    PJD

title: All I can say is WOW!
review: What an amazing place to stay.  Fantastic service, polite staff, phenomenal food and drinks and gorgeous amenities.  My husband, myself and our 15th month son stayed in a junior suite overlooking the gulf for one weekend and we were blown away.  The room was impeccable and clean.  The people were friendly and honest and the service was top notch.  The private cabana service was worth it, if you can grab one. We were so impressed that we will stay every time we visit our family in Clearwater! Thank you Sandpearl!

title: Watch for the add ons
review: This is a lovely hotel.  The staff are attentive, friendly and have a sense of humor.  The hotel was clean, and the grounds well kept.  We went for 3 nights, just to recharge our batteries, and the stay did the job!  However, when booking, we were not advised of the resort charge, or the valet only parking.  This adds an extra $30+ to the nightly rate.  We did ask for the resort tax to be dropped, as we had not been informed of this at the time of booking.  It was dropped.  The spa is an additional fee, and 18% gratuity is automatically added to the bill.  I normally leave 20% gratuity, but if they want to short change themselves then that's fine with me.  But, I would have expected to have been able to use the facilities in the spa, at no extra charge, and just paid for any…

title: Beautiful rooms, great location
review: I was put up at the Sandpearl as part of a recruiting thing, so I can't really comment on value.  What I can say is that it occupies a very wide and beautiful stretch of Clearwater Beach, so location is fabulous.  Also, the place was recently redone and the lobby is outstanding.  The pool was a perfect temperature and I love how it was designed.  Rooms were lovely, but again aesthetics ruled over comfort.  The couches were not comfortable, so my boyfriend and I ended up lounging in bed when we were in the room (I'm not really complaining!  But still...).  Also, the beds weren't very comfortable.  They weren't bad per se, but I felt a little relieved to leave the place and return to a much more comfortable bed.  Given the price of the room (we were put up in a Mandalay suite), I…

title: Loved The Sandpearl
review: This is a fantastic property - right on a quiet stretch of beautiful Clearwater Beach - great rooms - lovely pool which we thought was very safe for our 5 and 7 year olds - poolside food good although service was sometimes slow but always  friiendly - main restaurant was fantastic both for breakfast and evening meal - would highly recommend this hotel for all travellers and was a real tonic following the exertions (though enjoyable) of Orlando.

title: Great Stay at the Sandpearl
review: My husband, myself and our 3 year old stayed at the Sandpearl May 2008.  Everything about the hotel was wonderful.  We had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen.  It was very clean and beautifully decorated.  The beach was combed every morning making for a wonderful smooth beach with no rocks!  Wonderful beach for collecting seashells early in the morning.  Our meals were very good.  Pricy hotel but worth it in my opinion.  We will be back!

title: Absolutely Loved It
review: My girlfriend and I take a girl's trip around the same time every year.  We always do a lot of research, because we want total relaxation and some nightlife as well.  Some trips have been better for this then others.  The Sandpearl was amazing and met all of our requirements.   Great spa.  Great service. Great drinks.  Great beach.  Great pool.  Great time.    Loved the fact that almost all the restaurants in Clearwater have live entertainment at night.  That was so fun.  Eat breakfast next door. I can't remember the name of it, but breakfast was really good.

title: What a great place.
review: We went there for a conference and and had reserved a regular Bay view room.  For some reason, as I was traveling with spouse and recent high school garduate son, I upgraded our room to a Junior Suite.  What a difference.  Slightly larger room with a balcony.  Great amenities with a staff who were very polite and answered every question or request.  Great restaurant on site with a super bar.  Pricey, yes, but worth every penny.  Other places to eat bracket the hotel (Frenchy's and Cityscape), both very good and reasonable.  Great beach frontage and a manicured beach.

title: Beautiful and gracious
review: When we arrived after a long car trip we were personally greeted at the door and whisked to a reception room to check in.  Treated with cool lavender scent towels to refresh, and champagne.  Definitely a cut above the usually fight with the front desk people to receive the requested  room that we have experienced at other hotels.  All was in order in the room.  Everything was great...all of the service excellent, without being stuffy.    The food at the hotel was reasonably priced, as were the drinks and beach umbrellas.

title: We want to go back
review: If it weren't for busy schedules, we would have been back there already.  Wife and I spontaneously decided to travel to the beach for a weekend in April 08.  We wanted convenience since we were only had time for a 2 night stay.  We chose Sandpearl after using this site and others when gathering info.  We booked over the phone with the hotel.   We flew into PIE, and it wasn't long until we were picked up.  The Escalade provided more than enough room and comfort for my wife, 9 month old son, mother, and I.  The driver was very friendly as well.  The pick up was arranged through the hotel when we made reservations.  We made it to the beautiful Sandpearl, and I was a little disappointed that there was nobody to carry our luggage at the time.  It wasn't a bother, but it would have…

title: Very good, worth the money.
review: I recently stayed for 4 days at the Sandpearl and found the place to be excellent. The rooms were spacious and very well furnished and the view of the beach and ocean 10/10. Food in the hotel was also lovely, well prepared and fresh good quality. Just a word of warning, the top rated restaurant on trip adviser, and i forget the name is next door and all i can say was WOW! That is probably the worst meal i have ever eaten. The food was terrible, the service worse and to be given my main course whilst in the middle of my starter the cherry on a very big inedable cake. I kid you not our meals were discusting. I nearly returned to the place to take a picture of the creation i was given the next day as seeing was believing! But decided i would not waste my money. If i ever ventured…

title: Highly Recommend
review: This was a fantastic hotel. Very beautiful, modern, and elegant without the pretentiousness of other high-end hotels. We rented a pool cabana for the afternoon one day and would suggest to anyone looking to do this to reserve it ahead of time for there are only 5 and they are rented out quickly. We also enjoyed getting a cabana on the beach and being able to raise our flag when we needed a wait staff person to order drinks or food. The room was very clean and beautiful, the hotel grounds were gorgeous, the staff was very friendly. We will definitely be going back.

title: Great, great and more great
review: My family and I just returned from Sandpearl and we had the best vacation ever.  The service was outstanding and our room was extremely clean.  We had no issues at all.  E-mail me if you  have specific questions and I will be glad to help you out.

title: Good...But NOT great!
review: We stayed at the Sand Pearl for four nights in mid May as a last minute replacement for a trip to Playa Del Carmen.  Check-in took twenty minutes due the to the guy checking us in not having the right password for the computer.  I was actually in disbelief at how long it took him to get this fixed.  Tried not to make it a huge deal, but annoying none the less.  I was a lot more upset however when the housekeeper mistook a shopping bag as trash and threw it away, It had my wife's 40th birthday present in it.  I contacted the front desk right away.  There was a lot of "pass the buck" going on.  We spoke to numerous people and the follow through from the management was a joke.  I was finally told to buy another on and send them the reciept for reimbursement, no offer for anything…

title: Perfect stay & wedding at Sandpearl
review: Perfect stay at the Sandpearl May 14 through May 17!  We had a wonderful corner room, gulf front jr. suite.  Two big wondows, 1 overlooking the beach and the other looking over the pool.  Valet went above & beyond!  Tanya Clark, our wedding coordinator did great!  Check in, with champagne, went quick and smooth - staff very sweet!  The pool was perfect with very responsive bar service, frozen grapes, plenty of chairs and towels and yummy chicken quesdillas!   Dennis was our favorite pool bartender!!!!!!!!!!!  He even got to bartend at our wedding and did a fabulous job!  I could go on and on, but as I said before, PERFECT is the best way to describe our stay and the resort!

title: Exceeded Expectations
review: Me and My Significant Other stayed at The Sandpearl May 14-17 2009.  I have to say the hotel is Fabulous! The Room, Grounds, Staff were incredible. There is a "Fire Pit" right of the Beach that the holet lights every night. The Sunsets are incredible too. Please ignore any Bad Reviews.......This place is Awesome! I normally stay at 5 Star resorts (Ritz & Four seasons) and i enjoyed this More. Great Service and Up-to-date modern Decor.

title: Heaven on Earth!!
review: If you're wondering where you should stay in Clearwater Beach... This hotel was perfect! Decorated beautifully and all views are gorgeous.  Staff was so friendly and helpful. Beach is pristine.  We enjoyed every minute of it, and we were there when it was cloudy and rainy!!  Doesn't matter it was still great!  We ate at local hangouts: Frenchies (lunches), Clearwater Sky (great food! 3-7 Happy Hour and half price foods... can't beat it! Great breakfast too!), Mandalay Grill (crabcakes!) and Crabbie Bill's) great seafood!  Relaxed on the beach in the hotel chairs and watched the sunset view and dolphins swim by.  Found the most beautiful shells I have ever seen (and I grew up in Fla!).  Lots to do in walking distance. I would highly recommend it, and will definitely return.

title: Great hotel- great beach- will stay here again!
review: Pros: The hotel was beautiful!  We joined “I PREFER” right before we went and it was definitely worth it- we showed our card at check-in and was up-graded to a Jr. suite with corner view (pool and ocean!)  I would want this exact room again!  Had a refrigerator, which was great to bring back left-overs.  Lovely large bathroom with deep tub and separate shower.  Room was spacious and beautifully furnished.  The best place to eat was the bar area by the pool- we liked the fire-pit at night.  Cons: The bed linens were not worthy of such a nice hotel- VERY thin and scratchy (like paper); they were not comfortable.  The spa was very pricy and breakfast was expensive at the restaurant.  My huband felt like the private area of the beach was small, expensive chairs to rent,  with no…

title: Lovely Hotel with a few niggles
review: We stayed here for 4 nights beginning of May, arrived on a Sunday and it was packed with weekenders, Concierge said that we would not get a sunbed if we went to the pool as was very busy! Hotel was at full capacity, but thankfully Monday morning came and it was alot quieter! The rooms were ok, balcony very small and no chairs to sit out looking at the view ( we did have a bayside room) bathrooms small with a curved shower curtain so the water went everywhere and the towel rail kept falling off.  We had a tired toddler who wanted to go to bed, so tried to order room service, but was told our choices were no longer on the menu which was in the room as it was out of date, so ended up ordering an omelette as had little choice to offer!  They had not updated the new room service…

title: Very nice hotel...but don't get too excited
review: We just returned from staying at the Sandpearl Resort for 2 nights for a wedding held at the hotel.  My overall impression was favorable.  The building is new.  The staff is young and friendly.  One of the staffers told us that they are trying to work on a 5 star rating. Here where they need improvement.  1.  The food served at the wedding was mediocre at best.  What a shame!  The restaurant serves a great breakfast!  The food, at dinner, was not very palatable.  Very disappointing.   2.  The configuration of the bathroom is downright goofy.  What is with the doors?  We stayed in the Junior Suite and the sinks are in the same room as the toilet/shower.  This only allows one person at a time to use the bathroom.  We are a close family but that stretches the limit of our…

title: A long weekend in paradise
review: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at the Sandpearl.  The resort was wonderful, the staff was attentive and the views were incredible.  We enjoyed every aspect of the resort, from the cabana service and casual lunchs to the upscale dining at Caretta.  We also enjoyed sitting on the patio with a glass of wine watching the sunset.  The resort was extremely crowded on Saturday but there was plenty of places to escape for some alone time.  Our only complaint was that the bed was hard and uncomfortable.  We will definately head back but maybe during the week to avoid the crowds on Saturday.

title: Disappointed with the Sandpearl
review: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Sandpearl, and I have to say we were disappointed.  Although the resort itself is beautiful, some of the staff were downright snobby.  However, the valets were exceptional; very friendly.   In  addition, there was mildew in the shower and some of the bath towels were frayed.  In this economy,  an upscale hotel, such as the Sandpearl,  needs to pay attention to detail and ensure friendly customer service, showers free of mildew, and towels in good condition.  I don't think that it is too much to expect.

title: What a Fantastic Hotel!!!
review: We just spent 4 nights at the SandPearl Resort!  What a fantastic Hotel!  The staff was friendly and attentive and went out of their way to make sure everything was just perfect.  The room was clean and beautifully maintained, and the maid service twice a day was spectacular!  We have stayed in many high quality resorts including the Ritz Carlton Naples Florida and I have to say they were absolutely right up there with the Ritz!  The hotel restuarants did a great job, the food was great and the prices for being in a resort were not much more than what you are going to pay out on Mandalay Drive.  My only complaint was the price of alcohol, very expensive for cocktails and beer and wine.  We will be returning to this resort in the very near future.

title: The Secret Is Out!!!
review: I've read in the news that Expedia has ranked the Sandpearl Resort #8 in the world's best resorts list...Personally I've always ranked them #1...Now that the whole world knows my secret, my favorite hotel will now be booked solid for years to come!..  Sincere congratulations to the staff at Sandpearl for achieving this prestigous award..Every employee I've ever met there has always delivered outstanding customer service...Everyone from the GM to the valet staff have demonstrated a committment to excellence...Kudos to everyone including Elshan, Karen, and everyone else who have made my stays there a memorable experience...  Mike Molinari (Gmanmm)...Palm Harbor, Fl

title: THE SANDPEARL IS FABULOUS!
review: After reading many negative reviews, my family and I were quite nervous about staying at The Sandpearl, but decided to take the chance. After my marvelous stay I am curious to see what negatives reviewers saw, because to me it was perfection. I have stayed in many world-class resorts, but felt at home at the Sandpearl. We arrived late at night and were very tired. The valet was friendly and handled everything: parking our car and transporting our bags. It was great. Then, we could enjoy the beautiful brand new lobby. The rooms are absolutely beautiful: they are clean & new, plus spacious and beautifully decorated. The bathrooms are great, as well. We were upset we did not have a great view, but when the sun was out we could see the ocean, which was very scenic. The pool is…

title: Beautiful resort.....unfriendly service and atmosphere
review: We stayed at the sandpearl resort from April 4th -April 11th. The resort itself was very beautiful..........very much an understated elegance..........but the service from several staff members was quite snooty and downright unfriendly. We had a beautiful 2 bedroom suite overlooking the gulf and while the maid and turndown service was terrific the folks at the front desk were qquite stand offish every time we had difficulty with our room keys which happened nearly every day. Our family has 3 older teenagers ( a pair of 16 year old girls) and an eighteen year old boy and any time the kids were asked to interact with the staff or ask for help/directions,etc the staff was very rude. At one point a resort worker in the pool area asked my daughters for their room number and last name…

title: Great location--beautiful pool--exceeded our expectations!
review: Just got back from a 3 night stay with my 17 year old daughter.  Here's my thoughts... the Pros--the check in was impressive, as the valets were very helpful, and the sit down check in area was impressive.  We weren't used to that kind of treatment at the cookie cutter hotels, so it was real nice.  They allowed us to pre-check in at 10am, so we could head to the pool, and then they called us when our room was ready.  Our room was spotless--flatscreen tv--decorated beautifully--more than large enough.  You can tell this resort is only a few years old.  The pool area was the best--grounds landscaped great--the good "sunny" spots filled up early, but we opted to sit on the deck area anyway which was right off the beach, and also used the chaise that actually were on the beach. The…

title: Better than expected
review: We stayed for only one night at this resort and really enjoyed our stay.  Our room wasn't ready when we arrived and we were upgraded (without asking) to an ocean view room.  WOW, what a view.  The sunset from our room was really spectacular.  Room was clean and spacious.  The service is excellent and staff was generally friendly all around.  This is very much a family hotel so don't stay here if listening to kids play in the pool will bother you.  My only complaint would be the food at the nicer restaurant (I forget the name) was mediocre.  We actually stopped ordering after our appetizers arrived because the food really wasn't very good and severely over priced.  Other than that, wow, great resort.

title: Outstanding!!
review: The rooms, pool, beach, and customer service was outstanding at this hotel.  Don't think you'll find another hotel this nice in ClearWater, FL.    Went down for Phillies spring training and would recommend anyone to stay.. as it's worth splurging the money.   Although I was not with my family.. the resort was also VERY kid friendly, and the pool was great as there was alot of nice shallow ends.

title: Beautiful resort- fantastic service
review: Stayed at the Sandpearl for a conference in mid-Feb.- the place is brand new and spotless, on a beautiful wide beach, but the best thing is the staff and service.  They could not have been nicer or more eager to please.  Can't say enough good things about them.  I wasn't that thrilled with Clearwater Beach and the area around the resort- all t-shirt shops and cheap soueviner places but the resort itself is great.

title: First Class Resort in Third Class Setting
review: We booked the Sandpearl for our traditional Florida spring break vacation with our two teenage sons. The property is obviously very new and the rooms and the resort are luxurious and befitting an upscale tag. We booked a one bedroom suite which we found to be more than roomy enough for the four of us. The bathroom was oversized and while the kitchen was small, it was more than adequate for our stay. Our master bedroom was separated a living area where our boys slept on a pullout queen sleeper sofa. We asked for a Gulf view room, and we were assigned a north facing room which indeed had a Gulf view  but also overlooked the property's airconditioning facility which was noisy and ruined the enjoyment of sitting on the outdoor terrace.  The best thing you can say about Clearwater…

title: Most pleasant, courteous staff we have ever had at a vacation resort!
review: My wife and I just returned from a five day stay at the Sand Pearl Resort.  We couldn't have been more pleased.  The property was well maintained and beautifully landscaped.  The rooms were clean and spacious.  Our room was decribed as an "Ocean View" room and by the description on the Resort's website, we thought we might have a small area of ocean front that we might see.  We were very surprised to have a great view of the pool and an almost unobstructed view of the beach and ocean from our balcony.  There was a variety of food sources on the property and numerous choices off property in the town of Clearwater Beach and other nearby beache towns that offered an excellent variety of seafood and almost any other cuisine you might want.  The spectacular sunsets were an added…

title: Great if you're looking for sun, sand and relaxation
review: The Sandpearl Resort is a gem within a gem of a town.  It's hard to describe the ideological change that a luxury resort like this brings to the small town atmosphere of Clearwater Beach, but it offers the discerning visitor a wide variety of options for food, entertainment, and leisure activities.  You get the best of everything...from luxury service and facilities to local flare that can answer any craving you might have...be it entertainment or food.  The Sandpearl's size is perfectly suited for those who want that total resort package...not having to leave the property during their entire stay, while fitting into the small town feeling of Clearwater Beach.  Keep in mind this is not Miami Beach, but it is the perfect small town on one of the most spectacular beaches in…

title: Beautiful hotel, a little pricey with the $15 resort fee daily & $16 valet parking fee daily
review: This hotel was very nice, but I think the $15 resort fee daily & the $16 valet parking fee daily is a little much. The staff was nice,hotel is quiet,not for anyone that is rowdy. Our room was kept clean, nice view of the marina across the street. I'm not sure if I would book again,but the pool,exercise room, jacuzzi were first rate. My husband & I are in are early 50's & this was okay for us. The business center was nice to use while we were there with 2 computers with high speed internet.

title: Beautiful hotel, beautiful beach
review: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Sandpearl where my husband had a business meeting.  The hotel is relatively new and lovely.  You're handed a glass of champagne at check-in, a great way to begin a stay.  The room was spacious with a fine view of the Gulf and bay as long as you stood back from the sliding doors to the verandah.  Out on the verandah, there was a not so fine view of the loading dock and dumpsters.  There was also a lot of noise, presumably from the exhaust system of the restaurant.  There were even more complaints from folks who had rooms facing the street, so room location is an important consideration when staying here.  The other thing I found curious for such an upscale hotel was the room servicing.  Some days the room was cleaned promptly in the…

title: Highly recommended for families with young children
review: We were delighted with our stay at the Sandpearl. The staff are welcoming and courteous; our room (one bedroom suite) had the largest bath our girls had ever seen; and the pool was ideal for young children. We will return; and we are recommending the Sandpearl to all our friends up north.  We recommend the Clear Sky Cafe next door - not as lively as Frenchy's but very friendly service and decent food.

title: Heaven with a perfect location!
review: First off, we were supposed to stay at the Sheraton Sandkey. That didn't meet our needs and we had our travel agent find another resort...she found "Heaven", the Sandpearl! The staff was incredible. The pool was fabulous and so were the rooms. I can't say anything bad at this hotel. I would live here if I could! The bellmen were great with the doors, the car and great to look at :)  We had flag service at the pool for drinks and food. Just a great place. I don't want to ever leave. #1 hotel in my book. I've been to a lot of places in the country and out...this is fantastic!

title: nice comfortable hotel
review: Sandpearl Resort is pricey but in excellent condition, has very personable staff and possibly the top restaurant in the area.  We took a 1 bedroom apartment that included a kitchen and dining room table that we didn't use but was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was quite large with two sinks and a hot tub. The bedroom had plenty of space and lots of closets. The living room had a comfortable sofa and wide screen TV. There was a strong sound of wind blowing under the hall door but wasn't heard from the bedroom.  For a resort, the facilities were limited. The pool was lagoon style, not good for lap swimming, and there is a spa and gym. The beach is wide and good for swimming. There isn't much else to do nearby and nearby restaurants were barely adequate for people used to…

title: A Place to feel Pammpered
review: My husband and I travel a great deal for both buisness and pleasure. My husband had a 2 day  buisness meeting which was held at the Sandpearl. We decided to go several days earlier and have a mini vacation.  First of all we have stayed at Ritz Carltons that did not have the standards of the Sandpearl. From the time we checked in we felt as though we got personal service. Everyone was friendly,professional and helpful. We are already planning to have the the meetimg there again next year We could not find a flaw or critisism. . The rooms are clean,spacious and comfortable. The dining room menu could be better by having a little more variety but over all it was good. Our guests could not believe how perfect everything was.      As for the spa, best massages we have ever had! We do…

title: Words cant really do this resort justice!
review: I had recently came back from a four night stay at the Sand pearl in Clearwater; I was traveling with my two year old daughter and my husband.  From the moment we arrived at 11am we were greeted by the friendly valets.  Our room was ready and we had received a glass of champagne and sparking apple cider for the baby, it was a wonderful touch after being on a plane for three hours.  The lobby area is very beautiful and clean, there is a little coffee place that serves starbucks coffee.  The staff is very friendly...from the cosiege to the front desk clerk everyone had a smile and was happy to help in anyway you might need.   Our room was very clean, it had a flat screen TV and the king size bed was very comfortable; I was amazed that we had a rate of $161.00 a night with taxes…

title: Good but not great hotel
review: I am staying here for a conference and while the property is nicer than most in the area (I live here), there were a few things I found wrong; burned out light bulbs in the room, elevator was down for a day, there was a whistling sound coming through the door (I had to put a towel blocking the air to quiet the sound).  The staff was friendly and the bathroom was nicely decorated.

title: Clearwater Oasis
