review: The Sandpearl rated excellent because of its beauty, amenities and mostly the staff.  Upon arrival, you are greeted by courteous valets who assist you with your car, bags and the door!  We entered the lobby and were very impressed with the decor and the view!  Our room was very clean and offered a nice size bathroom.  The Sandpearl has a large pool and 2 hot tubs, plenty of cushioned lounge chairs and towels, too.  Sandpearl offers a workout room with 2 large flat screen TVs, weights, treadmills and a view of the pool and beach. The workout room is located in the spa area.  We enjoyed all 3 places to eat at the Sandpearl - marketplace for Starbucks coffee in the morning, the Tate Island Grill for lunch and Carreta's for dinner and breakfast.    The staff are fantastic - from the…

title: We had a great experience!
review: WOnderful, new hotel.  Nice beach area with plenty of lounge chairs and tables.  Can also rent the umbrellas or cabanas.    They will also serve you drinks out there too.  The activities table was good with toys to use and towel checkout.  You can gather around the fire at sunset.  Absolutely beautiful, and quick, don't miss it.  Room service was good, although they did bother us twice about 5 minutes apart one night to turn down our bed!   CHeck in was quick, with an offer of champagne to celebrate our arrival.   Hotel is located with easy walking distance of the pier (2 blocks) and lots of restaurants to choose fro  Overall, no complaints  Staff was friendly with everyone using our names.

title: Yes, Yes, Yes
review: If you are looking for the perfect place in the Tampa Bay area, search no further.  Just make your reservation for the Sandpearl Resort and feel comfortable that you have chosen the right place for  your trip.  My husband and I just returned from a long weekend there.  It is an excellent resort and has the best staff and service we have ever experienced....EVER.    Absolutely no complaints.

title: A nice stay
review: My family arrived at the Sandpearl after an extremely long day of travel and it was Thanksgiving to boot.  The gentleman at the front desk greeted us promptly and we saw him numerous times throughout our 4 night stay.   He was always gracious and warm.  We were offered champagne and were upgraded without issues.  NOTE- become an "I Prefer" member before your stay for a free room upgrade.  Our one bedroom suite was very spacious and very well represented on the website, so I was pleased.  Overall, this property is a very solid four star resort.  Few items worth mentioning: the valet was hit or miss, one time we collected our rental car and did not have small bills, so we told him (with real intentions) that we would get him next time, and he sneered "it probably won't be me, but…

title: Perfect stay!
review: A superb resort. We stayed in room 448 which was very clean and orderly everyday.The fees are a bit much(valet,Activity).Other than the fees all else was perfect.The staff was just incredible.Keep up the good work

title: Good quality hotel but a few niggles
review: Stayed for a week in mid December so definitely low season and apart from the weekend, the hotel was pretty empty.  The Sand Pearl is expensive and then there are  the added charges of compulsory valet parking @ $16 a day ( plus tips) and a   compulsory  resort fee of $16.75 a day.   The hotel opened in August 2007 so still a new hotel and the decor is good. It prides itself on its eco credentials. The bedrooms are well sized and the bathroom has a good space between the bath and the counter. The beds and linen are excellent but the sheets are only changed every 3rd day as the hotel says this is in line with its eco policy. The bath is good and deep but the shower pressure seems very low for such a new hotel. Quality bathrobes and slippers provided and generous sized…

title: Overpriced room for so-so stay
review: Hotel is nice because it is new. I can not say it is luxurious. We booked an ocean view room, which was a north facing room that overlooked the flat roof of the hotel restaurant and the public beach parking lot. Constant whir of the exhaust fans and the AC did not make the balcony worth using, nor would I have paid the higher price if I had known. Rooms are of average size, but large bath provides plenty of elbow room and counter space. Only parking is valet. Twice could not find our car and we witnessed a valet bring the wrong car to another guest and was indignant when the guest told him it was not his car. Staff is somewhat cool and doesn't seem eager to please. After spending an entire day on the beach and at the pool, we came in at 5pm to find our room not cleaned. The…

title: Gift Basket was Lost by Staff
review: Staying at the Sand Pearl for a company Christmas party. My Partner and I took a gift basket to the concierge to be dlivered to an associate in my partners company. We were told no problem.The next night at the party we inquired had they enjoyed the gift. They had no idea what we were talking about.When we inquired about the delivery of the basket we were given very poor lip service and lame excuses with NO offer to correct the situation except that they were working on it.Upon check out we were told after a second inquiry that the lady at the concierge desk was working on the problem and if we would give her a cell phone number she would call us within the half hour and tell us of the progress or what would be done. It is now the next day. There has been no phone call no offer…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: We stayed at the Sandpearl after a busy week in Disney and it was just what we needed.  We have stayed at many five star hotels and this is one of our favourites.  Staff were friendly and helpful, room was clean and very comfortable, and the beach is lovely !!!   We will return.

title: Very friendly
review: Had a fantastic stay, only bad points was the noise, music around the pool and conflicting music inside, also they used blowers everyday to blow the sand away, i didn't see the point of this as within hours the sand would be back lol  Food was amazing and i had a fantastic upgrade from the basic room, to facing the pool :)  I would say this was a good 4 star hotel

title: An oasis after Disney!
review: After 9 hectic yet superb days in Disney, we wanted a 5 star relaxing break on the Gulf.......and got one.   From the moment we arrived nothing was too much trouble. The valets, the front of house, the porters all were superb. It puts the UK standard of service to shame!! We even called for room service at 3am, milk for a 2 year old, and it came amidst screams at 3.02!! Do not worry about booking this place, it was all that we needed. The beach is fantastic, all that you expect. The area is a mixture of residential & hotels with a great feel. Restaurants abound, some good, get off the main drag for fantastic seafood &  ridiculous portions.  Take a drive up the coast towards Caldesi Island,Dunedin,down through Redington,Belle Air to Madiera Beach. The driving is easy. I wasn't…

title: Wonderful stay on the Gulf
review: We have had the occasion to stay at the Sand pearl on several occasions and each time have had a wonderful stay.  First the hotel is relatively new and is in great shape.  The location is excellent directly on the gulf.  While I find most of Clearwater beach to be a little on the tourist economy side, I have found this area to be very nice with a lot of work done in the area the last 5 years or so.  The beach is one of the best around with the sugary powdered sand.  The rooms are spacious and comfortable.  The beds are excellent with luxury sheets.  The rooms have plasma TV's and nice bedrooms.  We have always enjoyed the rooms.  The pool is nice and, yes, chairs are hard to come by.  I have found this to be a problem at many resorts.  that being said we never really have had a…

title: Not worth it
review: I stayed here earlier this month. The best service came from the valets. The room was dirty, hair in the shower and on the floor in the bathroom, toiilet scum, shower door leaked so the bathroom flooded with each shower, each day more towels would disappear when the room was cleaned so at the end I had only one towel and one washcloth. I had no cell service in my room. It was off season but they would not move me.  I called about the tv not working in the afternoon someone from engineering knocked on my door at midnight. I had 2 missed wake up calls. This is a mid grade hotel that is charging high end resort prices. I wish I had stayed at the HIlton next door it is wonderful. Never again here

title: Nice except for the noise-fest
review: It's 8:30 a.m. and we're sitting on our lovely balcony overlooking the beautiful Gulf of Mexico, sipping coffee and reading newspapers and enjoying the serenity of the morning.  Oh, wait - that serene morning has been ruined for the past half hour by the intrusive noise of leaf blowers below us, mindlessly being directed at that AWFUL sand and whatever...completely destroying the peacefulness of the hour with horrible noise pollution and the smell of gasoline exhaust.  The proporty prides itself on being completely nonsmoking, which is fabulous. What is NOT fabulous is all this commotion and exhaust.  I have a better idea:  how about good old-fashioned brooms which, granted, require a bit more effort on the part of the worker - but instill an infinitely more peaceful and…

title: Beautiful Yet Confusing
review: Ok, so I wanted to stay 5 star for a night in Clearwater and I had to be right on the beach so I figured I would try the Sandpearl.  I won't say that it was horrible but I can't say that it was amazing either.    We were allowed to check in early on the day we arrived without being charged extra, which was super handy.  The room was pretty, but not huge, or anything extraordinary.    It poured the night we stayed there and to get to one of their restaurants you have to walk outside.  We made sure with one of the staff at the hotel and he told us to grab some umbrellas at the concierge, but alas, there were no umbrellas left, even though it was a Sunday night and the hotel was a ghost town.   The pool was pretty and the beach was very nice.  There are restaurants all around the…

title: Very verrry Nice
review: Spent 4 days here with my newly pregnant wife and was very impressed. While it's a pricier hotel it doesn't feel like a penny was wasted. Upon arrival the valet was curteous and check-in very efficient and informative, although almost too informative since there are so many services available it's hard to remember, ha. The lobby was very elegant and the whole grounds for that matter were very pretty with a lot of light beige and white marble. We didn't get a suite but our room was spacious enough and had a fridge (which is worth using for things such as soda, and other beverages as the honor bar is most definately overpriced but, then again, they usually are, and there's NO vending machines so, take 1/2 block walk to CVS). Another nice thing was the HD (LCD) TV w/ full basic…

title: Gracious living by the Gulf of Mexico
review: We arrived in Clearwater with nowhere to stay and found the Sandpearl more or less by accident.  The staff were polite and friendly without being obsequious and the whole atmosphere seemed to belong to a more gracious era.  Admittedly, we were out of season and quietness suited us, and I imagine in season it becomes pretty lively, but it would be impossible for it to get too crowded on that wide, white beach....  Unfortunately we could only be there for one night, so we were unable to sample the spa or some of the other amenities, but to be able to stroll directly onto that incredible, empty beach, collecting towels as we went, watch the myriad birdlife, collect enchanting shells and swim in the Gulf of Mexico or, had we wished, in the beautiful swimming pool was simply magical.…

title: Top Quality Hotel!
review: Me and my partner recently returned from a fab 2 week stay at the very elegant 5-Star Sandpearl Resort in Clearwater Beach, Florida and would highly recommend it.   Upon arrival at the hotel, we were eagerly assisted by a uniformed car valet guy who was pleasant and professional and welcomed us to the hotel. Our car was subsequently taken away for parking and we had our luggage delivered promptly to our room upon allocation. Check-In was quick and efficient.  We booked one of their 1-Bedroom Suites on the top floor (8th Floor, Room 840) and were very impressed! The suite was over 800 square feet and was fully equipped and tastefully decorated. The kitchen had a full-size free-standing fridge freezer with ample room for all your food and drinks. There was also a microwave, oven…

title: My New Favorite Place!
review: Weekend getaway from the kiddies. Nice place. As nice as the Ritz Carlton. Booked it through I Prefer website and was upgraded to a Gulf Front View room. The pool was relaxing. Flag service poolside is great. Breakfast at the restaurant was pricey for a buffet but delicious. The cafe next door has music and outdoor dining and lower prices. The food is good there as well. If they're not busy, they let you buy a pass to the spa for $50. You can nap in the unisex jacuzzi area on the side by side lounges. You can use the steamroom and showers. We had a late flight so I got a seaweed body treatment. So relaxing. My husband got a deep tissue massage. When we were all moisturized and relaxed we ate an early dinner at the cafe next door and drove to the airport. Clearwater Beach is a…

title: Well . . . it looks pretty . . .
review: The hotel is really very pretty.  The lobby and rooms are nicely decorated and very comfortable and of course, the view of the beach is wonderful!  Outside of that, my stay was not very pleasant.  The number one most annoying thing about this hotel is the pool Nazis!  Everyday we were asked a minimum of two times if we were guests at the hotel, and then asked to prove it - It gets old QUICK!!!!  While the room appeared freshly cleaned, it was not in proper order for a guest.  The first night we stayed there, the alarm clock went off at 5 am!  It should be reset after every guest.  When we woke up later that morning and went to make a cup of coffee, we found an old coffee filter in the coffee pot!!!!  GROSS!!!   To top it off one of the remotes didn't work, when we call the front…

title: Really BAD as both a hotel and a resort
review: My niece was getting married at the sandpearl, so my wife and I decided to stay there.  From entrance to exit it was somewhat less than a 2 star in terms of service, although it was quite clean.  I have stayed in hotels on 4 continents, and well over a hundred in the US, and this is one of the worst experiences I have had.  We booked directly with the Sandpearl requesting early arrival.  After 7 hours of flight we arrived at 10:30 AM and were told that our room would be ready at 4 PM.  However we had been upgraded to a "gulf view".  The wedding was at 6 PM.  We left them my cell phone and they promised to call as soon as our room was available, and we went and sat in the lobby with our luggage and waited.  At noon we asked if there was someplace we could put our luggage so we…

title: Nice, relaxing stay with a toddler
review: My husband, toddler and I spent 7 days at the Sandpearl at the end of August. Our stay was pleasing, with really no complaints. The hotel is beautiful and clean. Everything still feels crisp and new. Service at the front desk and concierge is professional, if not borderline over-the-top. My family was made to feel welcome, with everyone fussing over our toddler and greeting my husband by name.    The pool is nice. Plenty of chairs, so no need to run down in the morning to claim a spot. One side of the pool has a beach entry, which is nice for little ones to play and walk into the shallow area.  The pool definitely became more crowded on the weekend, but not overwhelmingly so. The pool activity desk had some water toys available, but we bought our own at Publix. Private pool…

title: A couple of glitches, but great overall
review: Our 3 day stay at the Sand Pearl overall was quite enjoyable. It didn't start out that way as the room we were given after waiting at check-in was not as described in our confirmation. After advising the assistant front desk manager of our concern, he advised there was nothing he could do as the hotel was fully booked  (so much for our "I Prefer" membership).  After stewing for a while looking at our view of the hotel valet parking, we went down to the lobby to voice our concern.  Long story short Kaitlin Dalton came to the rescue with much help from a back room person whom we never met and found us a room which was quite satisfactory.  Although we had to wait an unusually long time for a bellman to assist us in our move, we were quite pleased  with the end result. …

title: Nice, Quiet Stay After Tropical Storm
review: We just returned from a six night stay at the Sandpearl Resort.  Immediately prior to departure we saw the negative reviews recently posted and were a bit nervous;  however, we ended up being extremely happy with our stay.  We have stayed at three different Ritz Carltons in Florida and we thought this hotel compared very favorably. I should note that we arrived at the hotel right after Tropical Storm Fey had hit the first time but before it swung around and hit again just north of us.  Talking to other people staying at the hotel, we learned that a large portion of the people who were staying at the hotel prior to our arrival left due to the storm and many others could not come or were delayed due to flight cancellations - so the hotel was not nearly as full as it was when…

title: A very pretty hotel, in a pretty setting, but not really a resort
review: We searched for some time to find a five star hotel in this part of Florida before coming upon the Sandpearl.  This was our first visit to Clearwater Beach, and the rating of top beaches was the draw for us.  The hotel is new, and does stand out from others in the area, although we felt the pool area and seating provided was small for a hotel of this size.  If you want a chaise with a canopy, then you must rise early, and set aside one, or you will be in the sun all day.  The staff is very kind, but the lack of training does come through.  There was no management to be seen, which stood out to us.  We felt that the choices of dining to be limited, the food and service only okay, and prices high for what you received.  We did enjoy having the Starbucks inside the hotel readily…

title: Getting there....slowly
review: After spending 9 nights in theOrlando area we were looking forward to some more 'grown-up' time. I joined 'I Prefer' beforehand and our check in was smooth, quick and we were upgraded.The fabric of the building is impresive. Beautiful foyer, nice pool area, proper, comfortable sun-beds, nice rooms etc. We had a very good time there, no doubt. However, it's certainly not cheap and for a hotel purporting to be 5* there were a few niggles. These included the staff training issues mentioned by other people on this web-site. While they were over zealous in some areas that didn't warrant it and actually translated into very junior staff over-stepping the mark they were insufficiently so in others such as  guests hurling a frisbee around the pool which actually hit me in the eye. Not…

title: 5 Star Hotel and Service All the Way
review: I honestly don't have the words to tell you how much my family and I enjoyed our stay at the Sandpearl. We were there to celebrate my husband’s birthday and the staff made our time there a true pleasure. Not to mention how beautiful and clean the hotel was.   We were greeted by a courteous check in staff and our room was beautiful. Everyone including the housekeeping staff was friendly and spoke to us. In fact every time I saw the housekeepers they talked to me and my son, gave us a smile and asked us if we needed anything. We have been to hotels and a resorts from New York to St. Tropez and the service wasn’t this attentive and personal.   The concierge was AMAZING. I believe his name was Andy. He was funny, nice and took the time to really listen to us. We were on vacation and…

title: hoped for more
review: After reading the reviewson TripAdvisor I evidently had too high a hope for my experience.  The setting is lovely, the beach is awesome!.  The restaurant was great and honestly, I had the best pancakes ever for breakfast.  The little things added up too much though. There was beer and milk left behind in the in room fridge which the bellman removed for us and the oncall housekeeping managers apologized for. The towels I had requested as extra before check in were not there but we were assured they would be delivered with turn down service that night.  The bathtub--looked great until you saw the debris ring around the top.    We did not get turn down service that night or the next or the next. Nor did we get a newspaper which was part of the resort fee. Poolside service was a…

title: 5 star from us !
review: After reading the bad review posted below we feel the need to put a few thing straight . This hotel has a strict security policy which as a paying guest is what you should expect . The Hotel , Pool & beach bar are wonderful ,in fact  so wonderful many people walking the beach visit the beach bar & sometimes get a bit familar with the place and try to use the pool etc , the staff are great at spotting non paying guests and ask them to leave & so they should , its not a cheap place to stay . The Location is perfect & the prices are justified as this is a league above the other hotels in clearwater . The only issue with this hotel is that it is not part of a big national chain like so many other hotels/resorts in the USA but this is what we liked about the place . if you have…

title: Locating this hotel in Florida was like finding a pearl in an osyter!
review: Knowing we'd be flying into Tampa, we went back and forth between staying at the Don Cesar in St. Pete and the Sandpearl in Clearwater....Beautiful and new verses old and magnificent.  The Sandpearl ended up being part of the preferred hotels like the Broadmoor where we stayed last month in Colorado Springs.  And top notch the Sandpearl was!!!  It was obviously decorated by a talented decorater.  The lobby had many sitting areas of unique chairs, couches, tables and fabrics.  There were 2 chess tables to ocupy your time.  The art all over this floor was amazing.  Especially behind the check in desk and Concierge.  There was a Steinway piano playing automatically to set the tone.  Out the windows were views of the pool, palms and ocean.  The beach here is very wide, fine and…

title: Stay From Hell
review: After a stay at the Sandpearl Resort last night, and receiving some of the worst treatment I've ever encountered in my life, I am almost forced to have to write a review to forewarn others of the unprofessional management. I am currently seeking an attorney to settle this matter....  After my sister's and mother's birthday both just passing, (my sister being 16 and my mother being 46), I decided to take them both to Clearwater Beach at Sandpearl for a little getaway. I'm a local and live in Tarpon Springs FL, but love Clearwater Beach, and being that Criss Angel was performing his last big stunt there, I figured it was a perfect time to go.   I arrived at the hotel about 11 in the morning with my best friend who would also be staying with me, along with a couple of my sister's…

title: fabulous and relaxing
review: My husband and I just returned from celebrating our 2nd anniversary (and also have a babymoon) at the Sandpearl, and we loved it. We booked a king size bed/suite with a gulfview, and it was gorgeous (both the room and the suite). It's probably not on the same level as a Four Seasons or a Ritz Carlton, but if that's what you're expecting, I have to say (and this is just an honest opinion from a fan of, and frequent visitor to, Clearwater Beach): dude, if you want THAT kind of 5-star, you need to be beach vacationing in Malibu, Miami, or wherever Brad and Angelina like to go. If that's the jet-set you like to be seen running with. But for Clearwater Beach, Florida? This is a first rate, luxury hotel and worth whatever you pay (though I suggest using AAA discounts when booking and…

title: Loved the Sandpearl Resort
review: The Sandpearl Resort was beautiful.  We stayed there from 7/17/08-7/23/08.  Check in went very smooth.  We arrived before the regular check in time and they allowed us to check in early being that our room was ready.  (I did ask for a complimentary upgrade and they told me they didn't have any rooms available.)   It is located right on the Gulf of Mexico.  The gorgeous pool is a zero entry pool which is great for the little ones.  The service at the pool was both wonderful for both drinks and food.    We ate at Carreta on the Gulf for the weekend buffet breakfast and during the week for the "menu" breakfast.  The food was wonderful but the service very very slow just to get your coffee or soft drinks.  We also ate fhere for lunch one day and once again the food was outstanding,…

title: A Really Great Hotel !
review: Having previously stayed at the original hotel for a number of years, we were abit apprehensive about what the new hotel would be like.   We had no need to, the whole experience was just great.    The staff were very helpful and supportive, and we would recommend the hotel to anyone.  I can honestly say we did not have one complaint.    The hotel is also situated in a very nice area, and the beach is just delightful.   Both my wife and myself will be going back hopefully, next year.

title: Sandpearl, a Quality Resort
review: This is the best hotel in Clearwater Beach. The hotel staff go out of their way to be helpful and courteous. Everyone is delightfully friendly.  The lobby and rooms are absolutely gorgeous. The air is extremely clean as they have a state-of-the-art air filtration system; no problems with allergies. The outside pool area is a wonderful place to sit and read. We were there on our honeymoon and had a great experience.  This is a place where you can be properly pampered. There are a couple of things to be aware of. First, there's a $15 a day "activities" fee, $16  a day fee to park your car, plus the tipping that goes along with getting your car. As we thought we paid for everything ahead of time, we were a little surprised at check-in that there would be these added expenses.  We…

title: Best hotel in Clearwater
review: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a wedding.  We live about 45 minutes away in Tampa.  The resort is new and beautiful!  I would say it’s the nicest hotel on Clearwater beach.  The location is great – right by Pier 60 directly on the beach.  Frenchy’s Rockaway Grill (a local favorite, known for their grouper sandwich) is next door.    We were upgraded to a suite (non-gulf view) and it was gorgeous.  The bathroom was HUGE and had a large Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, with two sinks.  There was a full kitchen, dining area, separate living room (with pull-out couch), a small washer and dryer and two flat screen TVs.  I’ve uploaded pictures of our room.  The pool was large and very nice.  There is a zero entry section which is great for little kids.  My boyfriend’s family rented…

title: A beautiful hotel!
review: I booked a 4-night stay with my teenage children at Sandpearl after reading the recent reviews on this site and wasn't disappointed. It's a magnificent hotel located right on the Gulf. A great facility, very clean, with a beautiful pool area. We booked a junior suite, which had a separate bedroom with 2 queen beds, a large bathroom with a Roman tub, a full kitchen, washer and dryer, 2 balconies and 2 flat-screen HD TV's. We had a Gulf-view room, so we could see Clearwater Bay to our left and the Gulf to our right. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only problem we had (minor in the scheme of things) was with the concierge, who made mistakes in some very basic functions, e.g., arranging a taxi for our departure and getting a rollaway bed to our room. If you make any…

title: Fun in the Sun
review: We arrived at midnight, with two kids asleep, after a series of flight cancellations and were treated in a manner that told me that we chose the right hotel for our vacation. The valet/bellman was extremely helpful and we asked for, and received, a great room upgrade from the front desk.  The room was well worth the money, as was the entire experience with the resort.   Our few complaints and suggestions are minor -  Have Country/State of origin on all the hotel name badges (makes it more personal and adds interest). Widen the offerings of food at the pool, or inform the wait staff of the full menu options.  With that said, Tate’s Grille is an excellent choice for lunch or dinner…and sitting by the pool. Maid service was adequate, but we had to call the front desk two days in a…

title: Loved the experience
review: The Sandpearl Resort was absolutely stunning. We stayed from June 29th to July 3rd and the days flew by! The water was always warm and relaxing, and the pool and hot tub were incredible. Tate's on the beach provided good service and drinks when we were sitting out by the pool. Food was top notch, and everything done was to satisfy the needs of the customers. Very friendly workers and close by restuarants that were within walking distance. We had a junior sweet with comfortable beds and amazing flat screen tv's. The hotel was very clean and well managed, except a few vending machines would have been nice, instead of just room service. However, it was a small price to pay for such an amazing resort. Definitely go to Sandpearl in Clearwater!

title: SANDPEARL a gem!!!  Gotta go here!
review: I've stayed in Clearwater several times at different resorts - the SandPearl is hands down the best!  5 Star treatment with casual atmosphere.  First choice if money is not an issue.  If money is an issue - at least price them, their specials beat the rates at nearby hotels.  SandPearl is awesome...Hilton the next best!  We booked the SandPearl online (check out their specials - 1/2 the rate!).  Joined IPreferred online and were upgraded to the Jr. Suite.  From what I hear you will be upgraded at least one category - you can join IPreferred at checkin but I'd do so beforehand to get better chance at upgrade.  ROOMS - 5 star accomodations, plenty of room with large closets, extra large bathroom wih soaking tub and separate shower (large enough for two...'nuff said...smile!)  Make…

title: Top class resort!
review: For the last few years, my family and I would rent a condo at Hilton Head.  This year, we decided to go to Sandpearl, after discovering it on the web.  We drove down from Chicago (2 10-hour days), and were blown away when we walked in the lobby.  The pics on their website do not truly show how impressive and luxurious the property is.  Exhausted from driving, I was greeted with a glass of champagne and a cold towel.  Nice!    Our room was amazing, great views of the gulf, tastefully decorated, impressive kitchen (we had the Caladesi suite), and huge bathroom.  The pool was incredible, with great food and drinks provided by Island Grill.  Carrettas is a topnotch dining experience, and the lounge has a great acoustic guitar singer/performer on weekends.  Great sushi spot directly…

title: Frst Class Beach Resort & Family Friendly
review: Our family had an excellent long stay at the Sandpearl.  The resort is essentially new and in excellent condition.  Things we loved:  1)The beach that fronts this resort is really outstanding and cared for by the City, truly world class.  2)We had an 8th(top) floor oceanfront two bedroom suite which was spacious and pleasantly although not extravagantly appointed.  3) Weekend breakfast buffets. 4)Consistently attentive and positive service.  5)  Excellent pool and surroundings.  Things that could have been improved were 1)  Inconsistent maid services 2) Speed of food service 3) Birds attacking the food at the restaurants and pools 3) Lack of controlled entry to pool allowing non guests at least temporary access to facilities until attendants eventually escorted them out. 4)The…

title: A Little Slice of Heaven!
review: We checked in to the Sandpearl after spending a few days at Disney World and we were ready to relax. Everything was  absolutely perfect right from the start! When we checked in they gave us a choice of Sparkling Apple Cider or champagne. The lobby was very luxurious. We got a room on the 8th floor and it was absolutely amazing. One bedroom, huge bathroom w/ walk in shower, full kitchen, living room with flatscreens and a balcony with a view of the gulf. The pool was great with two hot tubs. The beach is great with many areas to sit and perfect white sand. There is many activities for the kids to do like parasailing. The hotel is also a short walk to many shopping areas on Clearwater Beach. We ate at this restaurant called Island Way Grill which I highly recomend. You may also…

title: Hotel Snobs Recommend
review: My Husband and I stayed at the Sandpearl in mid June and loved everything about the resort.  We did not take our children because we were looking for a nice get away, but have already decided to take our oldest son, who is 3, back in September for a Disney trip and to spend a day at the beach.  The water and beach are beautiful - nice for a young child with the calm waters and dolphins that entered our swimming area.  The service was excellent and the spa was wonderful.  We used the work out facilities every morning where you could look out at the pool and beautiful gulf while running on the treadmill or using any of the other first rate equipment.  We wanted to feel like we were in another world and the Sandpearl delivered.  For a short stay, there is simply no need to leave…

title: Sandpearl Resort Is Fabulous
review: There isn't enough room to write my praises for the Sandpearl Resort in Clearwater Beach, FL. We just got back and my family all loved it (children are 13 & 16) Pool & private beach area, spotless & beautiful, never crowded.  Staff A-M-A-Z-I-N-G.....immediate (and i mean immediate) attention to any request no matter how small.  Room.....i don't even know where to start, beautifully decorated, flat panel tvs, granite counter tops, ceiling fans, thick full-size towels aplenty, etc., etc.   Trolley runs all day to get you places off campus but we really never went anywhere very far so we walked.  We were there for 2 1/2 days and were very happy just to swim in the gulf and the pool.  We did not seek out other activities and we were perfectly content.  So many nice table/chair…

title: Like a Ritz for families!
review: Went away for the weekend last weekend and have (almost) nothing bad to say about this place.  From the "VIP" check-in with champagne and cold towels to the room upgrade (iprefer.com) to the service in every aspect - this hotel was top notch!  everybody goes out of their way here and it shows.  and they literally cater to your kids (my twins are 4) - with the beach toys and frozen grapes and even the restaurants are kid-friendly!    would advise against the bay view due to mosquito issues or keep your windows closed!  although the sunrise is quite nice on the bayview side.. definitely ask for a suite - and they usually will give it - and the suites have full kitchens, two tv's, two balconies, etc...  tate's is definitely an experience and we loved the bonfire!  it's nice to eat…

title: Amazing, perfect, wonderful!
review: I was looking for a beautiful, family friendly, upscale hotel in Clearwater Beach.  At the last minute, I found this one.  If any of you are looking for a resort like you would find in Mexico or the Caribbean, yet want to stay in Florida, this is as close as you'll get.  It was unbelievably beautiful.  The location is awesome. The pool area is great, the beach is fantastic,  and the service is phenomenal.  From the champagne at check-in, to the continuous above-and-beyond service, I was never disappointed.  We joined Iprefer.com and were even upgraded to a Junior Suite.  Each employee does more than expected, even when asked for something unusual.  You won't be disappointed! After a 5 day stay here, we went to Naples to see family and stayed in the Naples Grande.  The only down…

title: Outstanding Beach Resort
review: My wife and I stayed at the Sandpearl for 5 days in early June. My only regret is that we could not stay longer. The lobby and rooms are definitely five star quality without being too stuffy for a beach resort. We stayed in a gulf front Jr. Suite. The room was large, two flat screen t.v.'s, large bathroom with soaking tub and separate shower, very comfortable bed, and outstanding views of the sunset every evening from the balcony. The beach is outstanding. I did not realize there were beach properties like this in the U.S. It was large, clean and had beautiful calm waters. The pool area is nice, we never had a problem finding a chair. We did not bring our children on this visit but will probably do so in the future. It did appear to be very family friendly. Although we enjoyed…

title: Interesting Visit
review: My friend and I were looking for a get away for a few days to the beach.  This hotel certainly was on the beach and had wonderful views.  I signed up for an iprefer card which got us a free upgrade to an ocean view room, a difference of $100 a night.  The room was nice and clean, I'm big on clean bathrooms and hotel rooms.  It was excellant.  We got there late at night and the clerk at the desk was not someone who regularly worked the desk, but he was polite and courteous even while it took a long time for us to check in and he was interrupted frequently by the phone.  I have to say all of the hotel staff was pleasant and helpful.  The biggest complaint I have is with the resturant staff.  They were awful.  I have never seen service so badly done in one area, and so wonderfully…

title: 5 Star Service and Family Friendly
review: We stayed at the Sandpearl for 14 nights from 22nd May 2008, with children aged 7 and 5.  We were quickly and easily checked in following our long flight from the UK and having taken other Trip Advisors' advice used I Prefer to get a room up grade.  We would advise all Virgin Holiday customers to do this as their "'room upgrade'" is still to the hotel's most basic room and the gulf view room is a lot nicer.  We found all staff to be polite, courteous and helpful.  We ate at the Caretta on the Gulf (the hotel's main restaurant) a couple of times for dinner and found the food to be 1st class and very reasonable compared to London restaurant prices. We also had breakfast there number of times and found both the al a carte and buffet breakfasts to be to a good standard and good…

title: Fantastic hotel on the beach!
review: Stayed at this hotel for the 2nd part of our honeymoon in Florida for 5 nights, here our are positives:  1) Beautiful location on Clearwater beach, step out of the hotel thru lush gardens past a gorgeous pool and you are on the white sands of this stunning beach. 2) The gulf view room was amazing, were upgraded due to being on honeymoon and were overwhelmed with the beautiful view of the beach and the gulf. 3) Big comfortable room with seating area leading to sliding door onto balcony/ 2 flat scree tvs/seperate bathroom with shutters that open out onto bedroom so you can bath with a view out to the sea. 4) Excellent helpful staff always on hand to help in any way. 5) Excellent restaurant and food, ate in the restaurant as a special treat one night and had a table looking out to…

title: no need to leave the country!
review: My husband & I recently celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary.  While searching for a romantic get-away and possibly leaving the country to travel to the caribean, we decided to stay here in the US.    Clearwater Beach is simply beautiful...white sand, beautiful sunsets.  The Sandpearl was fantastic!  We traveled during Memorial Weekend.  There was a wedding everyday so needless to say there were large groups at the pool and we were lucky to get a pool chair.  We too signed up for I Prefer and were upgraded to a a pool/gulf view room with balcony.  The rooms were perfect and the view was breathtaking.    We rented a car but only used it from the airport to the hotel and back.  So, the Valet charge of $16 a day upon check-out was a joke - just to park our car.  Everything was…

title: top notch resort
review: We stayed here for the week of Memorial Day. The resort from the start was class A from the service to the rooms and beach/pool. Clearwater is beautiful and the resort complements the beach perfectly. The resort was not crowded and was perfect for a family vacation. The room service was good and all staff were extremely nice and friendly. The only complaint is that I had gone to my car (valet had given me my car keys) and then I was scolded by security for being in the parking area. So there needs to be clarity among the valet and security about restricted access to the parking garage. Other than that the hotel was wonderful!!

title: Sandpearl impressed me, nicer than Don Cesar
review: I stayed at the Sandpearl for 5 days 4/28 to 5/3 and truly loved it.  I have stayed at several resorts in the area, including the Don Cesar and Vinoy, and believe this is the nicest experience.  I was at the resort for a conference and received a pretty nice rate, somewhere around $250/night.   Upon checking in, I was handed a glass of Champagne, which was a nice way to start the trip.    The room was excellent, nice big bath, flat screen TV, and plenty of room.  The room had a balcany that faced north, overlooking the ocean.  The hotel provides a nice sized refrigerator for customers in each room, which is a marked differnce vs. other high end hotels.    Throughout the stay, hotel staff was prompt and courteuous.   The beach was fabulous with very fine white sand, extremely…

title: Cool Elegance
review: The welcome was great and an easy check in.   The beach was great and the food was to die for.  Will definitely recommend to all my friends.

title: **5 star**
review: This is a 5 star resort! We had an awesome experience. It is first class all the way. I stay at 4 and 5 star hotels and this beach resort delivered that kind of treatment at the beach. This is the best beach resort in the Tampa area by far. It is only 9 months old, so everything is new. They have everything you need form beach towels to Evian cool spray. All you need to bring is your clothes. Everything else including the beach bar and dining is available at the resort. The white sand beach is perfect! I was suprised to find this resort in the USA. I normally have to travel to Cancun or the Dominican to find a complete beach resort.

title: This hotel and resort is a GEM
review: This hotel is beautiful.  It recently opened and it reminded me of some of the five star resorts that I have stayed at in Hawaii, only much closer to get to.  The beach is so beautiful, the staff was very nice and accomodating and the rooms were clean and beautiful.  I had a massage at the spa and it was great.  I cant wait to go back.  Also, the Sunday brunch is very good.  five stars all the way!!!

title: Don't expect perfect
review: I  initally wanted to wrtie a review soon after we stayed at the resort, but thought I should wait a bit and then reflect on the whole experience rather than responding immediately.    Overall, the resort experience was nice.  We stayed there from 3/28-4/4.  Our first few days was the tail end of most spring breakers and the resort was VERY busy and the staff seemed overwhelmed.  We stayed in a 1 bedroom Mandalay Bay View room on the 8th floor.  It was a fantastic view with two balconies.  If you can get a bay room on the top floor you won't mind not having the gulf view for $100.00+ more a night!!!  Upon arrival, we were taken to the VIP section of registration and given champagne and sparkling grape juice, nice touch. We did register at the iPrefer.com website one month before…

title: Thumbs Up
review: We had a great experience at the Sandpearl. We were upgraded to a partial oceanview room (thanks to signing up for the I Prefer card). Room was nice, beds comfy, nice flat screen tv.   Pool was very nice, as well as the 2 jacuzzi's outside near the pool. We had no problems getting chairs. Bonus: The wait staff came around with cold lavendar scented towels and frozen grapes every day. Nice touch!  Went to the beach one day and spent $25 on 3 chairs and an umbrella, which is a rip off  but we wanted to hang near the water and it was super-windy so the chairs kept the sand off us.    Staff were very friendly for the most part and accomodating to requests. I needed bandaids, called the front desk, and Jason was so kind (from security) to bring them to our room. Thanks!   I…

title: Best Hotel in Clearwater, by far!
review: Surprised with how nice this hotel was because reviews I read before my stay were iffy. This was a fabulous hotel with beautiful views of clearwater beach. We were upgraded to a suite upon check-in, which is always nice. Our balcony was so big and had a table with 4 chairs and 2 lounge chairs and still tons of room (to give an idea of the size).   The room service was by far the best I've ever had in my life. Food was so fresh tasting and delicious and it was 2 a.m. when we ordered it.

title: A Pearl on the Gulf Coast
review: I give the Sandpearl 4 out of 5 stars only because it just doesn't quite live up to a 5 star resort standard in my opinion.  They try very hard but I believe the only ingredients preventing it from being a 5 star is its location in Clearwater Beach.  The area is nice and trying to bring itself out of a 1950s past but to truly be a 5 star I believe you need the ambiance of a 5 star hotel which Sandpearl has but also the 5 star boutique shops and restaurants that are included in and around a nice resort.  The shops are there outside the resort but they are the old beach shops like you might see in Myrtle Beach or Ocean City, Maryland or NJ.  In other words the area is dragging down the potential of the Sandpearl but I believe Clearwater Beach is trying to correct that too as the…

title: Absolutely Loved the Resort
review: The hotel is absolutely beautiful!  The pictures posted by visitors to the resort are exactly what you will find.   The views from the lobby to the pool and beach areas are breathtaking.  From the moment you walk into the doors and stroll around the property, you feel like you are in the Caribbean.  Everyone from the valet to the front desk clerks to the maids are friendly and ready to serve you.   They remember your name and everytime you leave and return to the hotel, they speak to you by name.  The rooms are stunning.  The bathroom is large and very clean.  The beds are soft but if you prefer a firm mattress, you will need to make some adjustments.  I didn't see an ounce of dust, mold, or anything anywhere!  There are two flat screen televisions in the room.  One is in the…

title: best hotel in America........
review: we stayed in the sandpearl resort for 3 nights in May and on the middle day got married there.  The hotel is utterly fantastic and we found the staff to be professional, helpful and they went out of their way to make our stay extra special.  The hotel is immaculate - the rooms are extremely well presented as is the pool and beach area.  from the moment you step into the sandpearl until you check out you fel that there is no better hotel or location in America.  Overall there is not 1 aspect of our stay that we coud complain about.

title: Great Hotel!
review: We just got back from four wonderful days at the Sandpearl.    I took the suggestion of one of the reviews here and signed up for I Prefer before going and I am very glad I did.  Upon check in we were upgraded to one of their condo suites with full kitchen, huge bathroom and washer/dryer (great for drying swimsuits).   All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, from the front desk staff, to the activities desk staff by the pool.  We were  greeted with cold towels and sparkling wine upon check in, which was a nice touch.    We rented a beach cabana for one of the days, which was nice, but I probably wouldn't do it again as the lounge chairs by the pool were just as nice and had the little shade things on them.  The pool side restaurant was good for a quick lunch or fruity…

title: Great resort!
review: Loved this hotel! I had read different reviews about it before going, but friends stayed there and recommended it so we decided to go.  As is everything in Florida, it was expensive but we managed to get a good deal with AAA membership. It's about 30-45 min drive from Tampa airport and we rented a car which worked out well (although beware that there is a fee for parking at the hotel every night). The hotel upgraded us to a suite upon check-in which was fantastic, and we had an amazing kitchen and beautiful bathroom, not to mention the view! The food and beverages at the hotel were good but also expensive, but you can find some reasonable places to eat in the neighborhood. There is also a CVS pharmacy 1 block away. It was very family-friendly (we have an infant) and the staff…

title: It was a Pearl
review: We booked our three night stay some weeks ago and I subsequently read the more recent bad reviews of the Sandpearl and I debated on canceling my reservations, but I am glad I did not. My wife and I took my mother in-law to Clear Water for a three day weekend to celebrate mother’s day early. We booked a two bedroom suite, which was actually a one bedroom suite with a connecting hotel room and it couldn’t have been a better set up. We were on the eight floor and had an ocean view on one side and a bay view from the other side. There was even a balcony off of our bathroom. The set up gave our freedom as well as provided a central area for us to visit. From check in to check out our stay was top notch. We arrived at 8:00 p.m., no wait, we were met with sparkling wine, our luggage…

title: Heaven on Earth!  The Perfect Place!
review: We just spent one of the most wonderful weeks of our lives at the Sandpearl resort!  It is so beautiful!  Everything about our stay was perfect.  All the staff was very helpful and friendly (especially Jessica at the front desk).  Our Jr. Suit overlooked the Gulf of Mexico. It was was very comfortable, roomy, equipped well and decorated very nice.  The restaurant was exceptional.  Awesome food, and good service.  The coffee shop and pool side cafe were great too!The beach was amazing. A nice long white sandy beach with cabanas available.  The ocean was warm and calm, good place to swim.   The pool area was wonderful and the pools towels provided were nice and big.  The grounds were beautiful, like a garden. Very peaceful and restful.   We parked our car when we checked in and…

title: Cant wait to return
review: The Sandpearl was wonderful.  The beds are very comfortable, very quite rooms with the patio closed. Food & drinks a little pricey, but thats typical when you leave your small town. Everyone who worked there was very helpful, from front desk to conceriege to pool service.  Walking distance to Pier 60, shops & restuarants.  I'm looking forward to returning.

title: Not a five star hotel!!!
review: I was told that this hotel was 5 star. I was very disappointed by the quality/service of the staff.  There is no way this hotel could rate 5 star. The staff was slow and unresponsive. The bellhop took literally five minutes to appear at the front desk--it was 9:00pm and it was not busy. There is a certain class and elegance one expects when paying for five star service. This hotel does not have that atmosphere due to poor quality staff. On a positive note, the hotel is nice and clean. The suites are spacious and well appointed. (The suites are actually one bedroom condos). The view is average due to the way the building is set back off the beach. Most rooms that are considered "beachfront" actually overlook the pool, the grounds, then the beach.  One minor note, the chairs in…

title: A Four-Seasons Wannabe
review: Stayed over Spring Break, place is very clean/new.  Concierage service is weak, several times she told me she'd call me back, but never did.  Main restaurant is pricey but food is average -- don't eat there -- also, watch your checks because they automatically add 18% gratuity & then present you with a bill that has a tip line on it (very sneaky!).  Pool is nice, beach is great, but do not look to do anything in the surrounding areas as there is not much to do.  Seems geared to the older crowd (60's +) in terms of activities.  Starbucks in lobby (thanks), but be prepared to wait in line.  Worth renting the beach cabanas, $30/day but allows you to avoid rush for poolside seating (everyone runs down early am and sets towels on pool chairs to reserve them).  All-in-all would not…

title: New Resort, Worth a Look
review: Stunning Sunsets, GREAT beach, rooms are beautiful if you are facing the Gulf, which most are (make sure that's what you get, that's the reason for coming here, bay view overrated).  The pool is clean and scenic.  The beach bar has great drinks, wings and what a view, fire on the beach and sunsets! The restaurant has a great breakfast buffet. Staff are friendly and understand customer serv ice.  We had a member of our party sick and they brought her crackers and let us check in early.  The only negative is this is a bit pretentious so be careful not to think it is a resort for going wild (no flip flops in restaurant, switch glassware at beach, food not served on beach past 8:00 though sunset is later than that...)  The location is great, jet ski's and parasailing for rent close…

title: We loved it!
review: My husband and I went April 17-21 for an anniversary weekend.    I admit because of the poor reviews (lately) I was nervous to go, but we had an overall great experience!      I did join iprefer.com (as another poster recommended) and we were upgraded to a Gulf Front room and got champagne at check in.  Our room was beautiful to say the least and it was clean, too.    I will admit that on 2/5 days our room was not cleaned until after 4pm (which we had to call) - they were apologetic and took care of it right away.    The restaurants are good - at Carretel (pricey) my food did have a hair in it and I noticed it right when my server brought it to me - they replaced it... was very apologetic... but we were still charged the full price (weird).   This was the only negative I will…

title: Great Girls Weekend!
review: After reading some of the previous reviews, I have to admit, I was nervous to go here.  I had booked the Sandpearl through Bookit.com for a long weekend with my girlfriends. Honestly, based on some of the other reviews, I'm not sure we stayed at the same resort!   Just some background on myself, I find this helpful when assessing other peoples reviews.  I am a 34 year professional woman who works in Manhattan and lives in Jersey City.  I am not a trust fund baby or a celebrity, but I do consider myself a discerning traveler and have stayed at many top hotels/resorts around the world.    From check in to check out, we had a wonderful time.  We were put into a Gulf front room, which was amazing.  During our stay, we ordered room service, which was prompt and friendly.  We ordered…

title: Great potential.  Room for improvement.
review: We booked this room several months ago, before the recent spate of negative reviews.  Having recently read the reviews about the service problems, I went in with lower expectations, which helped improve the overall experience.  The property is indeed very beautiful, and the rooms have everything that you would expect in a new, upscale resort, although nothing above and beyond. Furnishings and decor are lovely. The rooms are quiet and well insulated from exterior noise.  Our original reservation was for a gulf view room with balcony in December, but when we had to reschedule our trip to April, we were told there were no gulf view rooms available.  We asked several times and were always given the same answer.  However, the hotel had very few guests the three nights we were there. …

title: ventilation problems
review: The hotel is lovely and the beach even better.  Due to something across the street the ventilation system pulls in sewer smells that permiate the hallways and our guest room.  After 3 complaints and no response, we contacted the hotel manager who explained the situation.  Really not good enough when you are spending $300 a night.  Also, we had to go each night to the Hyatt down the street to see hockey.  I know it is South Florida, but somehow the Hyatt figured out to carry an expanded cable package.

title: Great experience, a few negatives
review: My husband had a conference at the Sandpearl, and myself and two boys (ages 6 and 4) tagged along.  We were there from April 8-13th and experienced WONDERFUL weather, hight 80's all week, no rain.  Overall I was very pleased with our experience.    Checkin:  I called two days before we checked in to let them know we are I-prefer members (a free online service, qualifies you for upgrades when available at all I-prefer resorts.)  They asked for my I-prefer number and told me I would be upgraded a room category if it was available.  When we checked in, they did upgraded us to a partial gulf view.  We were very content with that.  Yes, a pool/gulf view would have been nicer, but who cares?  We spend most of our time EXPERIENCING the pool and ocean, not sitting in our room looking at…

title: Beatuful property!!!  Something for everyone.
review: We loved this hotel.  After being warned that Clearwater Beach is a cheesy shore town, we were not sure what to expect.  This hotel made it all worth it!  We were primarily in the area for Spring Training, but we had 6 people in our party, only three of whom are big baseball fans.  Those of us who chose to remain at the hotel were not disappointed.  We stayed in a two bedroom suite and it was fabulous.  All of the comforts of home with a full kitchen and even a washer and dryer!  Yes, there are some growing pains (I had to request that our room be made up one day) and it is tough to get a chair at the pool, but the hotel is luxurious and plush and that made up for it.  No one wanted to leave the room.  When we did, we found the food at the pool great and we loved the evening…

title: Beautiful Hotel!
review: I am getting married at the Sandpearl in May and experienced my first taste of what the Sandpearl has to offer this weekend.  The check in process was quick and we were served champagne and cool towels.  We were upgraded to a gulf front room which had a fabulous view.  The hotel grounds are beautiful, but I have to agree with other posters about the pool chair situation.  After 9:00 a.m., it is nearly impossible to secure a chair around the pool, but there are chairs on the boardwalk that are available.  The maid service could be greatly improved.  Not that it was terrible, but I've had better service in lower class hotels.  The soaps and lotions provided by the hotel smell like tequila!  Not good in the morning if you are licking your wounds from the night before!  The rooms…

title: Spring Training Vacation!
review: My son and I looked for a place in Clearwater to spend a week while we enjoyed some spring training baseball.  I have stayed in other plaes in Clearwater in the past but decided to give Sand Pearl a shot.  The check in process seemed to take forever!  It took us 30 minutes to complete only to find out that a room was not yet available.  We arrived at 3pm on a Sunday.  The front desk person took our cell phone number and said they would call us "very soon" so we could go up to our room.  We went to Tate Island Grill for a bite to eat (sweating in our Pennslyvania winter clothes).  It took 15 minutes before someone came to our table and another 15 for them to come back with just the drinks.  After having a bite to eat we walked around waiting for the phone call so we could get to…

title: Just OK....I would not recommend.
review: We were planning to stay 2 nights at the Sandpearl but checked out after 1 night. The property itself is very beautiful..however for the $$ , the service and overall "feel" of the place does not match the prices.  The check in process was odd. You walk in and immediately tend to go to the desk that says "reception"...however, the staff person indicated that this is not check in and pointed to  another room with 2 desks. 1 staff person comes out of a back room and starts to check in the customers before us..while we wait at the doorway for "our turn"...then another staff person comes and checks us in. We were upgraded to a partial gulf view room( I preferred members)..however, as well as gulf view, it was ovelooking the roof and the dumpsters.  2 customers before  us, got…

title: Beautiful Facility--but suffering from inexperienced staff and systems
review: I received an online survey after our stay, but after entering the information and submitting, I received an error message.  Based on my stay, I wasn't surprised, but thought I would try again.  Same response.  So, I thought I would respond to the email with my my feedback.  The response was "this mailbox is full."  Here is what I tried emailing:  Overall, you have a nice resort, but are not delivering to the service levels one expects to receive when paying this fee.  Check-in:  If the room will not be available until 4, please tell me.  Don't tell me you'll ask housekeeping to get the room ready next.  I enjoyed lunch while waiting, but didn't like hanging out in your lobby for two more hours.  I could have either retrieved my swimsuit from my luggage and enjoyed the beach or…

title: Fantastic Sunsets and Beach
review: What a great place this was for our recent Spring Break trip.  The hotel is beautiful and has a wonderful restaurant and Starbucks on premises.  The beach is gorgeous!  Close to pier and activities there.  Every night we enjoyed an awesome sunset. Room was very nice We would highly recommend.

title: Dissapointed
review: The hotel itself is beautiful. It is one of the prettiest hotels I have seen. The food was not good. I do not think of myself as a picky eater, but Frenchies the dive next door, had much better food than the hotel. We even found that the drinks at Frenchies were better and half the price. The service was poor. I have had much better service at Holiday Inn. They could not grant my request for a King bed, nor a balcony, not a beachfront view. These were all requests that I had made when I booked the room in January. I would have been happy to pay extra even. On the last day we asked for a late check out, they would not do that either. It was a very expensive place to stay for such poor service. I spoke to the locals and learned that it is well known that the owners are …

title: Don't do it!
review: I had to take care of some business in the Tampa area and decided to take a few extra days and have my wife go along, so we could celebrate our anniversary.  We wanted to stay at the best hotel in Clearwater Beach - the Sandpearl was listed as a "Preferred Hotel" and rated "five-star". We made reservations for a six-day stay in a king room, facing the gulf, and looked forward to a luxurious, relaxing business vacation.    The following is a day-by-day synopsis of our stay.  I included this summary as part of a six-page letter to both Mr. John Uberroth (president & CEO of Preferred Hotels and Resorts) and Mr. Stuart Arp (General Mgr of Sandpearl).  I soon received a letter from someone "on behalf of" Mr. Uberroth stating that they were sorry that our stay was so disappointing,…

title: Horrible Stay!!!!!
review: Me and my family stayed at this hotel right after new years for 2 nights. The hotel looks nice but treated us very poorly in the end. How would you feel if you bing your vehicle in perfect condition to valet, tip him well, not useing your vehicle for the whole stay when you get back thier is a dent in your door? We thought we would have no problem when security were taking pictures of the damage. We were supposed to be trading this vehicle in after our trip, so when we returned we had to have this fixed so it wouldnt affect our trade in value. We got it fixed and we still havent gotten paid by the hotels insurance and its April now!They told us to get estimates at body shops, it came to almost $1000 and they refused the claim!!! Why did they refuse????? My family is in the body…

title: Beautiful hotel & beach
review: Less than 8 months old, the Sandpearl is the only gem on the beautiful white sands of Clearwater Beach.  Surrounded by tacky shops, stores and tattooed beachgoers on what is one of Florida's prettiest beaches, the Sandpearl is an oasis of luxury.  The lavish bedroom suites are sumptuously decorated, and the suites on the top floors rival the best rooms at the top resorts in Florida and elsewhere.  Ours was an 1,100 square foot one bedroom with two balconies, a complete kitchen with granite tops, stainless steel appliances, a separate dining and living area with elegant furnishings, two plasma TV's and a gorgeous master bathroom, with separate shower and two-person jacuzzi.  The service is outstanding.  The one complaint?  Simply not enough pool chairs around what is otherwise…

title: Fabulous
review: We would highly recommend the Sand Pearl Resort.  The service is spectacular, the resort gorgeously appointed and very upscale.  We would definitely say this was nicer than any Ritz Carlton we have stayed at.  The beach is gorgeous and huge, the only negative was the Gulf was a little chilly in March.  Will definitely return and would definitely recommend this to our friends!

title: Nice hotel  Stressful pool scene
review: Nice hotel and rooms.  Definately the best in Clearwater. Our only complaint is the pool and beach chair situation. We were there over spring break and the hotel was totally unprepared. People got up at 5:00am to get a pool chair then only stored towels on and never used. The pool staff needs to fix this problem. Staff at pool and beach were clueless. Beach chairs were all gone  by 10am much better than 5am. But, there is no reason a hotel of this size can't order more plastic beach chairs. People were fighting over chairs, that ruinsvacations. My suggestion is  to use beach vendors who rented umbrellas for $10 no hassels and closer to ocean. We rented a beach cabana for $30 each day from hotel and were harassed the first day 6 times asking our name room number because they only…

title: Elegance on the Beach
review: Yes!  This is an outstanding hotel- small, intimate, personable. The staff is welcoming and the service is commendable; however 2 concierges gave us incorrect directions to 2 different destinations.  The lounge chair situation by the pool is taken very seriously:  If no one is on the lounge chair for 45 minutes your things will be moved and your chairs will be given to weary travelers waiting to relax by the pool.  For the cost of this resort I would have prefered a pool with grottos, waterfalls, a slide for all the children (full of children).

title: Really Amazing Hote
review: Just as the other reviews have gloated, this hotel is top notch.  Everything was perfect, from service to amenities to the condition and cleanlines.  There's nothing like staying in a new hotel (opened Aug 07).  Even though they have a strict 11am check out policy, they extended it till 1pm after we spoke to the manager.  Clearwater is very casual, so this hotel is out of its element, but that's what made it so enjoyable.

title: Unpleasant Stay
review: Beautiful new hotel directly on the beach.  Rooms are fantastic.  We had a 1 bdrm suite with kitchen.  Housekeeping was great.  Beautiful wide stretch of white sand beach.  Getting a pool chair is next to impossible.  Here a week and still haven't had one.  I've been out before sunrise and all the chairs were taken.  Situation on the beach is a little better, but there is a lot of hostility between the hotel staff and beach vendors that rent umbrellas and beach chairs.  Hotel staff have frequently yelled at guests for handling their own chair.  Pool/beach experience was unpleasant and anxiety provoking.  If you want a relaxing stay go somewhere else.

title: The Best in Clearwater
review: We just returned from a wonderful week at the Sand Pearl Resort. We booked two one bedroom suites, one for each of the families. The rooms are the nicest I have stayed in. We have traveled alot and these rooms are large and luxurious. The kitchens have full size all stainless Kitchen Aid appliances.. It was great for our kids, they are 14 and 10. The staff will bend over backwards to accomidate any request. We rented a poolside cabana for the day, it was awsome. The staff found out that I had seen too much sun the day before, they offered to get me anything to help with the pain. They ended up getting me some white vinegar from the kitchen, it was very helpful. The cabanas are as nice as the rooms with large flat screen TVs and sofas. Both of the families have already said this…

title: Beautiful resort, wonderful beach, poor management
review: Since I wrote an e-mail to the Sandpearl GM Stuart Arp which was returned due to his full mailbox, I'll instead post my comments to him here in public to serve as a general review:  Even though we were traveling with a three-year old and made this clear when we booked four months in advance, we were given a single king bed, which made sleeping arrangements challenging (and we were told no double queen rooms were available when we checked in).   We had no air conditioning our first night, and opening and closing the balcony door didn't help (the thermostat was on a sensor that turned the AC off automatically if the door was left open). The offer to send an engineer up at 1 a.m. wasn't a viable option for us, so our choices were to sleep in an 83-degree room, or keep the balcony…

title: Sandpearl is like a masterpiece of art!
review: Outstanding hotel! This hotel strives at every turn to provide you with the most sincere, efficient and utmost service. We have 4 rooms full of relatives here this week and they all agree with the above comments. The grounds and common areas are beautiful and inspirational. The rooms are beautifully done in high end and comfortable furnishings. The bed is wonderful (hard wouldn't even come to mind when describing it) and we've been sleeping like babies. They have gorgeous tile artwork everywhere and the decor in the entire building is tasteful and amazingly  awe inspiring. I'm not sure if the previous poster on this site stayed at the same place that we did. My husband and I stay at 4 and 5 star hotels often and this resort should be 5 stars if it isn't already. They have it all…

title: 'Luxury' and Refinement Are Strangers to Sandpearl
review: What looks like a breath of fresh air to greet the hotel scene of an otherwise pedestrian Gulf beach destination quickly rubs you all over with disappointment instead of sunscreen on what is indeed a beautiful 700 feet swath of manicured white sand.    The refined manicure ends as the sand meets the hotel.  That’s where mediocrity comes glaring at you at the same time the hotel’s unavoidable music piped throughout the pool and outside common areas annihilate your senses.  There’s no hope of tuning into the sound of waves caressing the shore and the natural call of a seagull to another.  And sadly the local memberships being sold to share the pool with hotel guests make it feel more crowded than the inside of the hotel.  From start to finish we encountered some of the nicest…

title: Fantastic pool, expensive hotel
review: We stayed in a 1 BR suite at the resort which overlooked the bay area (partial bay views), which means mostly street view, but it was cheaper than the gulf view rooms. First, the good: The bedroom had a nice king bed and a balcony with the aforementioned view. There were 2 plasma TVs. Plenty of closet space, washer dryer in the bathroom, and a fully equipped kitchen.  Free bottles of water in the room. The jacuzzi was very nice. The pool is fantastic and if you can get down early enough to stake a claim to one of the loungers lining the pool area (by 9 they were mostly taken) you could spend the whole day just laying in the sun. The beach is amazing, and you can also just spend your day there weather permitting. Being able to walk out of the hotel onto the beach was amazing.…

title: wonderful!
review: My husband and I stayed at the Sandpearl for three nights in March 2008.  The resort was beautiful and the service was great.  I won't repeat all of the wonderful things mentioned in previous reviews, but I will add a couple of comments.  We had lunch and drinks a couple of times at the Tate Island Grill next to the pool.  The food was great (they even made me something special that wasn't on the menu) and Kit and Steve were great servers.  The firepit area is awesome and the perfect place to chill.  Just steps down the beach, you will find Frenchy's Rockaway and the Palm Pavillion.  Both had live music both during the day and in the evenings.  We enjoyed the vibe at Frenchy's best for drinking, but liked the food better at the Palm Pavillion.  We didn't have the greatest…

title: Great Hotel, fantastic location
review: We stayed for 5 days at the Sandpearl in Feb 08 in a one bedroomed suite. The hotel is located directly on the beach, which is superb , being made up of the whitest, finest, powdery sand we've come across. It was also very clean and well maintained.  The suite was fantastic, comprising of a well equipped, granite topped kitchen area fitted with an oven, microwave, dishwasher and large fridge/freezer, dining table and king sized sofa bed in the living area, which also benefited from a 40" HD LCD tv. The bedroom had a king sized bed and another flat screen tv and the bathroom had two granite topped vanitry units, a sizeable corner whirlpool batch and generous walk in shower.  The pool is nicely laid out with plenty of sunloungers that benefited from generous cushions and there are…

title: Incredible Resort with Outstanding Service
review: There just aren't enough appropriate words to describe what an amazing resort Sandpearl is.   The grounds are beautiful. A heated lagoon-style pool sits footsteps from the white sand beach. The hotel lobby offers stunning views of all of this, with plenty of seating areas throughout. Interesting activities are scheduled daily such as Wine Tasting, Astronomy Night and Yogalates. Even the sun setting every day is an activity. The rooms are spacious with flat panel HDTVs, light tropical decor, and most with balconies facing either the pool/gulf or the bay.  That alone would have made the resort noteworthy. But it's the staff that pushes the Sandpearl from noteworthy to outstanding. Everyone was so friendly and accommodating, from the front desk to the valet to the concierge to the…

title: Not what we asked for
review: We had reserved a king size bed overlooking the gulf and ended up getting a room with 2 doubles and looking at other bulidings. It was not a nice view or what we had asked for.  Although the people were nice that served us, but we wish the hotel had did a better job accommodating us for what we had requested, and told we were getting.

title: Beautiful Hotel with minimal problems
review: After a week at Disney World we (husband, 2 kids ages 5&8 and myself) traveled to the Sandpearl for one night to spend a day at the beach.  We arrived at 1 PM and were greeted at the door with champagne (sparkling fruit juice for the kids) and warm hand towels. We were promptly assigned an upgraded room with an ocean view thanks to signing up at the iprefer website as suggested by an earlier review I read here at trip advisor!  We were assigned room 542 and the view was beautiful! The room was nicely furnished and very comfortable.  We headed to the beach. The recreation desk provided some sand buckets for the kids to use which was nice.  It was a little rainy but we had a great afternoon collecting shells, making sandcastles and relaxing on the beach right in front of the…

title: not what you pay for
review: We came with a large group in January.  Upon checking in we were given a room that overlooked a run down building and parking lot.  NO VIEW to speak of.  We also had two double beds, and had requested a king.  After calling the concierge, they moved us to a room with a side view of more run down buildings but at least a partial view of the ocean.  They were kind enough to move us rather quickly too.  The room was beautiful.  We had an amazing bathroom and the decor was very nice.  You could also adjust the thermostat to fit your needs.  The mp3 and ipod docking station was nice too.  The grounds were very beautiful and the staff was very friendly other than the spa.  That is where this trip took a huge turn.  I had booked a one hour massage for the day before we left.  When you…

title: Planning our return to the Sandpearl
review: We recently spent four wonderful days at the Sandpearl with our daughter who was on college break.  The experience was exceptional, including the professional staff, beautiful room, restaurants, pool and gorgeous sunsets on the beach.  Our gratitude to Michelle in the reception area for making our stay so special.  Greg - your extra efforts with our lost luggage were appreciated.  Nancy, Gina and Jesse were always attentive and added to our great vacation.  Returning to the Minnesota deep freeze is bearable after the warm sunshine and memories at the Sandpearl - we will be back!

title: You will LOVE it!!!
review: My husband and I stayed at the Sandpearl for a long weekend in January. We were very impressed with the hotel and would definitely like to return at some point. The service was impeccable. Everyone from the concierge to housekeeping to servers in the restaurants to the spa staff...literally everyone we came in contact with was professional, very friendly and very eager to please. They almost looked disappointed if you said you didn't need anything. I can't say enough about them.   The property is beautiful and meticulously maintained. Gorgeous artwork in the common areas and very nice landscaping cap off a very pleasing environment. Our room which overlooked the pool and the Gulf was very large for a standard room and extremely comfortable.  I'm always about the pool area and…

title: A Feast for the Senses!
review: Sandpearl Resort is truly a feast for the senses! Being an eco-conscious individual, it was nice to know that they took pride in being a "Green" hotel. The pool, heated by the sun and chlorinated by bromine salts truly relaxes your tired muscles. Your senses will be tickled as they SEE: the beautiful sunsets from the corner deck of Caretta Restaurant . . . . TASTE: the special grilled cheese sandwich with ham, pineapple and provolone with marinara dipping sauce from Sandpearl's own Tate Island Grille . . .  HEAR: the relaxing new age music as you enter your room at night . . . FEEL: the stress melt away after an Aromatic Pearl massage . . . SMELL: the clean clear air coming up from the Gulf of Mexico . . .I highly recommend Sandpearl Resort, and will be returning soon!

title: Very nice - just watch the extra's
